130084920504806.description:
The Great Bull Run is coming to Chicago on July 12th, 2014! Grab life by the horns and experience the rush of a lifetime as you sprint down a quarter-mile track with up to twenty-four 1,500-pound bulls hot on your heels. Cap off your run in our insanely fun tomato food fight, Tomato Royale, then celebrate all day long in our massive festival featuring rockin' music, great food, cold beer, games, and attractions! 

Not up for running with bulls? No problem! You can still watch all the action as a spectator or join in the fun as a participant in Tomato Royale! Be sure to read our Frequently Asked Questions (www.thegreatbullrun.com/faq/) for all the details on how the run is structured and remember: prices go up over time so don’t wait too long to sign up!
130084920504806.name: The Great Bull Run - Chicago

133408896834116.description:
Join Ustadh Hisham Mahmoud for lessons on the inner meanings of Surat al-Fatiha & for a taste of Fawakih's innovative Qur'anic Arabic curriculum. 

About the speaker: 
Hisham Mahmoud is an Arabic Lecturer at Harvard University, where he teaches all levels of Modern and Classical Arabic.

He has studied Arabic and its ancillary sciences with scholars in Egypt, Spain, Morocco, and Mauritania, where he pursued the disciplines of grammar, morphology, and rhetoric. He has held positions in Arabic at UCLA, Middlebury, and Yale University.

He has translated and edited several classical Islamic works on issues pertaining to ethics, jurisprudence, and legal theory, and has also lectured at dozens of universities nationwide on subjects pertaining to comparative religion.

Ust. Hisham is an advisory board member of al-Madina Institute and the Executive Editor for the Zaytuna Curriculum Series, which serves the four-year Bachelors Degree program for Zaytuna College, the first Muslim Seminary in North America.
133408896834116.location: Masjid Al-Faatir (1200 E. 47th St. Chicago, Illinois 60653)
133408896834116.name: Secrets of Qur'anic Arabic with Ust. Hisham Mahmoud

136681473172032.description:
One Tribe at Columbia College Chicago presents
F*CK DA POLICE: STORIES OF EXILE AND CONFINEMENT

A cage is lone bedroom's blinds drawn, walls always caving in (but never do)-- a foreign space you're given, your name written clearly on its outside, if only you could see that you belong (in a cage): Escape is an opening of the eyes. A stretch of an arm outside, looking in. Growing. And you're free.

Four readers open their eyes, stretch an arm toward
 a growing audience. We're all free.

Featured readers:
Bobby Biedrzycki
Conway At Columbia
Brontë Price
Frank Waln

OPEN MIC TO FOLLOW!
The event will also include an open mic portion to showcase 5-minute (2.5 page) stories from the audience.

PART 4 OF ONE TRIBE'S YEARLONG LIVE LIT SERIES
Curated by One Tribe Scholars Lance Taylor Cox and Brian Dragon Martin
136681473172032.location: Columbia College Chicago, 1104 S. Wabash, 8th floor, Chicago, IL 60605
136681473172032.name: F*ck Da Police: Stories of Exile and Confinement

Schedule can be downloaded here: http://bit.ly/taleefchicagoschedule 

MONTHLY CLASSES:

LIVING RIGHT
Borrowing from traditional texts and conventional wisdom, “Living Right” is a forum for newcomers to Islam, young people recommitting themselves to the Deen, or anyone seeking practical ways to progress spiritually.

Instructor: Usama Canon
Where: American Islamic College, 613 W Bittersweet Pl, Chicago  
When: Saturday, January 18th 1-3pm
Saturday, February 22nd 1-3pm
Saturday, March 29th 1-3pm
Cost: Free

QUARTERLY CLASSES:

INTRODUCING ISLAM 
This friendly, informal discussion is for anyone curious about Islam and Muslims. Feel welcome to bring your questions, concerns, and curiosity. Come and explore with us one of the world's largest faith traditions. For ages 16 and above.

Instructor(s): Alia Bilal, Mike Swies, and many more
Where: TBA
When: Sunday, February 16th, 12-4pm
Cost: Free
Registration Opens: January 19th
http://bit.ly/introducingislamchicago1

WORKSHOPS:

WAYFARING TO GOD 
A gathering for women, offering practical advice on purification of the heart and personal spiritual paths.  This workshop will discuss the translation of Habib Ali al-Jifri's "Wayfarers to God" as a spiritual guide.

Instructor:  Syeda Nejma Davis 
Where:  American Islamic College, 613 W Bittersweet Pl, Chicago
When:  Sunday, February 23rd 1-3pm
Cost:  Free
Registration Opens:  January 26th
Registration Link:  http://bit.ly/wayfaringtogod

SPECIAL EVENTS:

SCREENING & PANEL DISCUSSION:  PRISON BLUES
A screening and panel discussion highlighting a new Ta'leef Collective documentary, Prison Blues, written and directed by Mustafa Davis.  The documentary follows a group of formerly incarcerated and converts to Islam, exploring their lives and conversion stories.

Where:  Mandel Hall, University of Chicago, Reynolds Club, 1131 E 57th St, Chicago
When:  Friday, February 21st 7:30-10pm
Cost:  $10/person by February 16th
$15/person at the door
$5/students
General Registration:  http://bit.ly/prisonbluestaleef
Student Registration:  http://bit.ly/prisonbluesstudents

1377974745795655.description:
10 year old Blake Loudenber from Griffith Indiana will be celebrating his 1 year kidney anniversary on March 14, 2014.  Blake had his transplant done at the University of Chicago's Comer Children's Hospital in Illinois last year. He waited almost 8 years for a donor match to save his life. After many life threatening journeys, and  with his life still being at risk, Comer Children's Hospital continues to fight for him over and over.  Saving his life time and time again. Never giving up! In honor of Comer Children’s Hospital and the kidney donor who saved Blake’s life, we are asking that everyone help us donate New coloring books and  New boxes of crayons to the Comer Children's Hospital. Any other New and Non-Toxic Art supplies can be donated as well. We will have drop-off locations available for the entire month of March throughout Northwest Indiana. As soon as we confirm locations, I will update this event page so that everyone knows where they can take these items. Thank you all so much for your continued support for Blake, his family, and the community.

Confirmed drop off locations:

Griffith Indiana Police Department 
drop box available 24 hours at this location

BRIDGES' SCOREBOARD RESTAURANT & SPORTS BAR
 in Griffith Indiana during business hours. 

Wheatfield Lanes 
in Wheatfield Indiana during business hours. 

Team Toyota 
in Schererville during business hours. 

Walgreens
Located at the corner of Ridge Road and Colfax in Griffith Indiana.

NWI Fleet Maintenance Inc.
Located at 8765 Louisiana St in Merrillville Indiana.

CVS 
Located at 3835 45th St in Highland Indiana. 

Beiriger Elementary School
located at 601 N Lillian St in  Griffith Indiana. 

Strack & Van Til 
 located at 9632 Cline Ave in Highland Indiana.

              This coloring book and crayon drive will run from 
                            March 1, 2014 – March 31, 2014. 										

                Thank you for helping us give back in a BIG way.
 
                      Follow Blake’s journey on Facebook :
                https://www.facebook.com/AMiracleForBla
1377974745795655.location: Drop off boxes located throughout Northwest Indiana
1377974745795655.name: A Miracle for Blake Coloring Book and Crayon Drive for the University of Chicago's Comer Children's Hospital

THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO MARCHED ON MARCH 1, 2014 FOR THE WORLD WIDE MARCH AGAINST GOVERNMENT CORRUPTION. WE ARE SO PROUD OF ALL OF YOU! 

http://www.naaij.org/2014/03/01/march-against-government-corruption-media-from-around-the-world/

We look forward to the next event. Please post all your pictures and videos in this event as well as our facebook pages. Please chat in this event and continue to post. 

I hope everyone is ready for round 2. There are many world protests happening on May 1, 2014. So I think we should join them all. Let us make it our goal on May 1, 2014 to get out and protest once again to help wake up the masses. At this point that is what the protests are doing in many places. Getting us out in the public and the public asking questions so we can educate them. It shows them not to be afraid to get out and protest. With each protest our numbers are growing. Once we have the numbers on our side, the change we seek will follow. 

Once again the focus will be on world wide government corruption. Our goal is to wake up and educate the masses with this 4 day protest. Be peaceful and Loud! 

Once again let us unite all groups for this event. Every one is welcome.

1391392401139394.description:
Health Leads presents Sickcare vs. Healthcare: Envisioning a Healthy Chicago, a conference on the state of healthcare and the role of social determinants of health in the city of Chicago.

The event is totally free, and BREAKFAST and LUNCH will be provided to the first 150 people who register. Register here! https://hlsummit.eventbrite.com

Please join us in welcoming speakers and panelists composed of distinguished leaders in government, medicine, and nonprofit organizations to discuss the following topics:

• Community Health
• Healthcare and Government
• HIV/AIDS
• Violence and Health
• Universal Healthcare

The day will feature multiple panels and single-speaker sessions happening simultaneously, so you will have the opportunity to choose the topics that interest you most. Please tweet questions any question you may have for speakers to @HLChicago, including the hashtag #HLSummit. 

Undergraduates, graduate students, faculty, staff, and community members are welcome to attend.

Program Agenda:

9:30-10:00 On-site registration
10:00-10:20 Welcome from Cody McSellers-McCray, Managing Director of Programs of Health Leads Chicago
10:30-11:30 Session I: Single Speakers (listed below)
11:30-12:30 Lunch
12:30-2:00 Session II: Panels (listed below)
2:00-2:20 Dessert Reception
2:30-3:30 Keynote Speech from Dr. Jay Bhatt, Managing Deputy Commissioner for the Chicago Department of Public Health

Speaker Details:

Session I: Single Speakers
• Dr. Claudia Fegan, Cook County Hospital: Universal Health Care
• Dr. Doriane Miller, South Side Health and Vitality Studies: Violence and Health
• Dr. Evan Lyon, University of Chicago Medical Center: In-Home Care

Session II: Panels 
Community Health
•  Dr. Kohar Jones, Urban Health Initiative and Chicago Family Health Center
•  Judith Haasis, CommunityHealth Clinic
•  Dr. Susan Rogers, Physicians for a National Health 
Program, Stroger Hospital
•  Terri Zhu, Louis Groceries

HIV/AIDS
•  Dr. Daniel Johnson, UC Medicine
•  Dr. Richard Novak, UIC Medicine, HIV Community Clinic Network
•  Justin Hayford, AIDS Legal Council of Chicago

Healthcare and Government
•  Charles Watkins, Get Covered Illinois
•  Megan Erskine, CPS Student Health Specialist
•  George Cardenas, 12th Ward Alderman
•  Harold Pollack, UChicago Crime Lab

Our keynote speaker will be Dr. Jay Bhatt, Managing Deputy Commissioner for the Chicago Department of Public Health.

Sickcare vs. Healthcare: Envisioning a Healthy Chicago is made possible by the generous support of  University of Chicago Student Government, The Urban Network, The MARK UChicago, UChicago Careers in Health Professions, the Student Organization Catering Fund, the Campus Dialogue Fund, and The Graduate Program in Health Administration and Policy.

1391392401139394.name: Health Leads Presents Sickcare vs. Healthcare: Envisioning a Healthy Chicago

1398138257119717.description:
IAN MAKSIN @ CITY WINERY 
APRIL 14, 8pm, doors open 6pm

Special guests:  Ani Gogova - piano, Gabriel Datcu - guitar

TONIGHT!!!!  There are still tickets, but there might not be any left at the door, get yours now!!  http://www.citywinery.com/chicago/tickets/ian-maksin-4-14.html

Ian Maksin is back to City Winery with an all-new program ranging from two world premieres of contemporary classical pieces to a brand new set of jazzy renditions of modern pop songs. This time he will throw in  a couple of extra treats: turning cello into a whole orchestra with a loop pedal as well as singing some of his favorite ballads in different languages...   He will be joined by guest artists, Bulgarian pianist Ani Gogova and Romanian guitarist Gabriel Datcu.

Cellist and composer Ian Maksin has gained international recognition for his beautiful tone and distinctive style, as well as his uniquely charismatic way with the audience.  He performs over 100 concerts annually in the USA and Europe, and his performances have been broadcast on NPR, PBS as well as on national radio and television in many European countries.  In Chicago, Maksin has been a frequent guest on WFMT, WBEZ and Chicago Tonight, his performances appear regularly as “Critic’s Pick” in Chicago Tribune as well as the Time Out Magazine.  In 2012 he was named “Citizen Musician” by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra for his contribution to the city’s musical life and community engagement.   Apart from being recognized as one of the leading classical artists, Maksin has taken the cello well outside its conventional scope and plays jazz, world music, blues, flamenco, rock, R&B, pop, and has collaborated with such artists as Sting, Andrea Bocelli, P. Diddy, Snoop Dogg and Gloria Estefan.

Official Website: www.ianmaksin.com
Facebook Fanpage:  www.facebook.com/CelloMaxx
YouTube Channel: www.youtube.com/leftseat75
Twitter:  www.twitter.com/IanMaksin
1398138257119717.name: Ian Maksin @ City Winery Chicago TONIGHT!!

1399088853666358.description:
Join me on my yearly journey of cycling to put an end to AIDS and HIV, in spirit or by riding with me. We can conquer this disease in our lifetime and leave an AIDSless world for those who follow us. I ride because people I love are battling this illness and face stigma daily. 

I don't have AIDS.  I am not HIV Positive.  Nobody in my family is Positive.  Yet from June 1-7, 2014, I'm bicycling in my 5th AIDS/LifeCycle. It's a 7-day, 545-mile bike ride from San Francisco to Los Angeles to make a world of difference in the lives of people living with HIV and AIDS. 

A month later, We will be riding a 200 miles in two days from on July 12th and 13th from Chicago to Wisconsin in a effort to raise much need funds for TPAN (Test Positive Aware Network).

Help me fight this ENDABLE PANDEMIC!

HIV/AIDS has affected so many friends in my life.  Truth is that when I did my first ride, from Minneapolis to Chicago, in 2002, I didn't know anyone who had HIV nor did I really know anyone who had been affected by it.  But since my first training rides I have become close with many people affected by this ENDABLE PANDEMIC.

I'm attempting to raise the most money I have ever raised with every single penny going to the SF AIDS Foundation.  I believe in the SFAF and the work they do PREVENTING the spread and ASSISTING those living and dying with HIV.  They operate one of the most comprehensive needle exchange programs in the country, helping make the HIV transmission rate from dirty needles ZERO in greater San Francisco.

HIV/AIDS is not a gay disease. 
It is not a young person's disease. 
It is not a drug addict's disease.
It is not a people of color disease.
It is an all-of-us disease.

I train for thousands of miles and spin when I can't train outside. My first full week of June is dedicated to the fight for one simple fact: 

HIV IS 100% PREVENTABLE.  THIS PANDEMIC CAN END IN OUR LIFETIME!  YOUR DONATION WILL HELP TREMENDOUSLY!

Please give what you can.  $1,000, $500, $250, $100, or whatever you can.  Spread your payments over multiple months if you want.  And thank you from the bottom of my heart.

Help me support AIDS/LifeCycle by giving what you can. We'll keep riding until AIDS and HIV are a thing of the past.

Please help by donating at:
http://www.tofighthiv.org/goto/gregjarvis
1399088853666358.location: San Francisco, Los Angeles, Chicago & Wisconsin
1399088853666358.name: 745 Miles! AIDS/LifeCycle and Ride for AIDS Chicago 2014... Join me in spirit or ride with me!

1399126453684408.description:
Hi friends! I'd like to invite you to join me (team name still under consideration- currently 'Team McPartland') for the 2014 ABTA Breakthrough for Brain Tumors 5k Run and Walk on April 27th in Chicago! If you can't participate you can still make a donation! (links with directions below)

As you may know, the past few months my mom has undergone treatment for a brain tumor. This is what inspired me to get involved in Brain Tumor awareness, education, and fundraising. You can read more about my experience on my Fundraising Page. 

I've never done one of these fundraising things before but this is a cause I believe in with all my heart so I figured I'd give it a shot. If you feel inspired to run with me - great! Donate - great! If you read this message all the way through and just take a moment to lend your thoughts and prayers to the 700,000 people living with brain tumors today - great! 

I can't thank my friends and family enough for the love and support I've received from them through the last few months. Thank you for your support!


Link to Kaitlyn's Fundraising Page:

Candy Apple Crush - Candy Apple Crush have risen from the ruins of several former bands (but some names have been changed to protect the innocent). At the moment, Betsy Ade sings, while Matt Specht plays the piano and guitar. Betsy is a former recipient of the Wisconsin Area Music Industry's Best Female Vocalist award, and they both received a WAMI award for Best Rock Band as part of Rainy Day Crush. One time, they dug themselves out of a ditch in a snowstorm. They are currently working on a full-length album, and they hope you have a nice day. - https://www.facebook.com/candyapplecrush

Fire 9 - Fire 9 is a Chicago-based trio of queer rockers united by their love of Riot Grrrl and sounds that vibrate your lower spine. With a membership drawing from three different time zones, the band is driven by the drumming of Illinois native Naydja Bruton, who has made her mark in such bands as Lockjaw Nancy, Lezurreccion and Violet Kills. Hailing from the East Coast, Fire 9’s guitarist/vocalist Cheryl Lawson has brought it in multiple outfits, including Jackass Magnets, Crumbs Off the Table and The Recruitment. 1404675816466381.description:
Vicarious Venues and Chicago-Scene Magazine presents

>>>Chicago Scene LIVE at House of Blues Chicago<<<

A LOCAL SHOWCASE OF CHICAGO'S HOTTEST TALENT! 


Chicago-Scene and Vicarious Venues have collaborated to create a new music program called Chicago Scene LIVE. Join our debut show at The House of Blues!

Featuring LIVE performances from:

King by Friday

KING BY FRIDAY has a simple performance philosophy...perform GREAT music for GREAT people and have a GREAT time doing it. Fans and other musicians have described them as "a HOT live show," "Spot- on performance," and "Super fun presentation!" 

Based in Libertyville Illinois, they have headlined many of Chicago's top venues including House of Blues, Double Door, Abbey Pub, Bottom Lounge, and Many many more. They have even performed as a featured group on ABC7 news! Their reach has extended to NYC with live performances at National UnderGround.

http://www.kingbyfriday.com/

Chicago Loud 9
In January of 2012, members of three local Chicago bands came together for a Friday night winter showcase at the House of Blues… 

What began as a one-night-only musical experiment has become a fully-stacked 9-piece hip-hop / rock / pop ensemble, known for its wild mix of styles and high-intensity, rock-infused performances. Chicago Loud 9 has since appeared at a number of major venues across the city, including Double Door, Hard Rock Cafe, Subterranean, and Beat Kitchen, as well as several stints throughout the Chicago summer street festival circuit, including the Taste of Lincoln Ave in Lincoln Park.

 Labeled by reviewers as “a band with no genre,” Chicago Loud 9 blends veteran grunge-funk rockers from Eleven Dollar Life, live horns from roots-reggae outfit Drop Steady, rhythm players from cover bands Dr. Rock / On The Radio, and rapper-MC Pro Blak The Don. 

http://chicagoloud9.com/

Cellrs
High-energy, must-see show that seems to top with each performance, and a sound that can only be described as "Dirty Blues Pop".

"We're a kind of lo-fi, avant-garde blues band that still manages to sneak some soul in here and there. We enjoy playing what we believe to be great songs with positive, high-energy performances while not getting caught up in the studio perfection that so many artists seek these days. We want our songs to maintain a human element to them. We don't want a "snapped to a grid/copy and paste" feel when you listen to our music. 

Same with our live shows. As Leonard Cohen said, 'There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in.'" 

http://cellrs.com/

Fletcher
Fletcher began as a basement project between brothers Oscar and Harvey Baker and their long time friend Tom Fry. 

While two of the members are originally from London, England and the other from Chicago, IL, the band has been able to create a new strand of new-age British Rock with quirky melodies and brain tingling music.

 Insisting on sticking to a three-piece band, Fletcher has created a vigorous and chemistry driven connection between each member. After collaborating for just under nine months, Fletcher has gained a reputation around Chicago and beyond.

http://www.reverbnation.com/Fletchertheband

Red Jr
From the furthest stretches of Chicago come four unique musicians who delve into their listeners minds and bodies to bring them to complete awareness and total ecstasy using their pulsing rhythms and electrifying melodies that takes you to beautiful, far away places.

"It felt like I had sex for three straight days." - anonymous fan on how she felt the day after a Red Jr. concert. It's like that.

https://soundcloud.com/redjrmusic

AyOH
Think The Killers meets Coldplay meets Imagine Dragons. It's music for the hungry at heart.

AyOH found their rhythm and took it in stride, developing their own unique blend of harmony and sound, churning out original songs and quickly coming into their own.


With such natural chemistry and dozens of original songs on their roster, the next step for AyOH was to head to the studio. Chicago’s own legendary musician and owner of Transient Sound Productions, Steve Gillis, was “blown away” by what he heard from AyOH. 

http://www.ayoh.bandcamp.com/

1408221029449632.description:
Please help me and my team raise funds for a wonderful non-profit organization. We are honoring our late friend, Kevin Oldham, by raising funds for this organization in his memory. I hope you can help!

This is a team race that covers around 200 miles from Madison, WI to Chicago, IL.  The race does not stop and goes straight through the night.  Not many events like this!

We have assembled 12 runners for the 2014 Ragnar Relay - Chicago.  Seven firefighters from Waukegan, one from Grayslake and 4 others are  friends of mine that are killer runners.  We finished 49th, last year out of around 250 teams that finished.  Pretty solid I think!  This event takes place June 6th and 7th and starts in Madison, WI and ends in Chicago, IL..... THAT'S RIGHT! We are going to team up to cover around 200 miles of terrain across two states. Why are we doing this, you ask? Well we are raising money for a GREAT cause, Code 3 For A Cure. Code 3 For A Cure raises funds for firefighters that are battling all forms of cancer. They provide financial assistance and moral support for firefighters going through their darkest hour. Not battling a fire, battling for their life. Three years ago we lost our friend, Kevin Oldham, to pancreatic cancer. He left behind a wife and two precious girls. While Kevin was stricken with his cancer, he toured the country with C3FAC to spread a message of "early detection" to his fellow firemen. His goal was simple, to use his story to save another life before it was too late. Kevin was a great man, husband, father, son, brother, friend. We honor his memory by dedicating these 200 miles of ground pounding to him and his cause! Help us carry on Kevin's memory and mission of helping other firefighters with cancer! Make a donation today to support Code 3 For A Cure!!! Thanks for your help!  Here is the site if you would like to donate!

http://www.active.com/donations/fundraise_public.cfm?frid=4711504
1408221029449632.name: C3FAC Ragnar Relay Team - Chicago-Honoring Kevin Oldham's Mission To Save Firefighters Across America!!!

1409128442683259.description:
13th ANNUAL 
CHICAGO INNOVATION AWARDS
NOMINATIONS SEMINAR
 
LUKE TANEN
AWARDS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR 
   
                          
       Saturday, April 12, 2014 (9:30 AM –12:30 PM)
BLUE 1647 INNOVATION CENTER
1647 S Blue Island St (Near 18th & Loomis)
Chicago IL 60608
 
This is an event you have to attend! Come join the Chicago Inventors Organization (CIO) to learn more about the 13th Annual Chicago Innovations Award nominations process from the Awards Executive Director, Luke Tanen, Saturday, April 12, 2014, at the Blue 1647 Innovation Center.  Please note that we will be starting at 9:30 AM.
 
  Luke Tanen will discuss how Chicago area nominees can be high-tech, low-tech or no-tech; for-profit or not-for-profit; large or small       firms from any industry. Winners will be profiled in the Chicago Sun-Times, Crain’s Chicago Business and will be invited to ring the                       opening NASDAQ bell in New York City. The winners will be invited to meet with Mayor Rahm Emmanuel and Governor Pat Quinn    Hall to discuss how Chicago innovators can increase innovation in Illinois. The 10 Chicago Innovation Award winners will be invited to a 3.5 day business and innovation training program in Orlando, Florida provided by Disney Institute, including hotel accommodations for the winner’s family.

Admission to this fantastic public event is free for current members of the Chicago Inventor Organization and only $20.00 for the General Public. Visit our website (www.chicago-inventors.org) for more information or call   312-850-4710.
1409128442683259.name: Chicago Inventors Monthly Meeting

1409192946018307.description:
Join us for the closing of Backlit: Recent Works by Jeroen Nelemans and You Have No Idea, a site-specific installation by Jeffrey Michael Austin in THE SUB-MISSION.  
 
The reception will begin with a conversation with Jeroen Nelemans and Robyn Farrell, Curatorial Assistant, Department of Contemporary Art at The Art Institute of Chicago. Nelemans and Farrell will discuss Backlit -- Nelemans's second solo show at THE MISSION -- and his two recent series of light boxes which explore iconic imagery through the lens of the computer screen.
1409192946018307.name: CHICAGO: "Backlit" & "You Have No Idea" Closing Reception // Gallery Talk with Jeroen Nelemans & Robyn Farrell

1415286348731835.description:
Get ready for the musical sensation of the spring semester! The Musical Team ’14 presents their rendition of CHICAGO: a spectacle involving cabaret, liquor and all that jazz. Two women, determined to do whatever it takes for a life in the spotlights, wind up in jail together after both having committed a murder. A murder maybe, but not a crime… Fighting over lawyers, trial dates and, most importantly, their names in the papers, they are trapped in the merciless circus-act of Chicago in the 1920s, where they learn that it is never about what you do, it’s always about how you sell it. 

A major jazz band, big dance numbers and lots of lacy outfits; need we say more? You do not want to miss this show! We’re performing in Theatre Het Huis on the following dates:

Wednesday April 30th at 19:00 and 21:30
Thursday May 1st at 19:00 and 21:30

Tickets are 4 euros for UCSA members and 6 euros otherwise. They will be on sale in Dining Hall during lunch and dinner from the 21st onwards.

Mark it on your calendars. Don’t risk not buying a ticket, these girls are relentless….
1415286348731835.name: Chicago! And all that jazz...

Am Freitag den 9. Mai bekommt Linz hohen Besuch aus USA. Der aus Chicago stammende Techno-Pionier MIKE DEARBORN kommt in den Linzer Cembrankeller. Als DJ und Produzent seit den frühen Neunziger, zählt er wohl mit zu einem der ganz großen in diesem Genre. Als junger Produzent unter der Flagge des berühmten Labels Djax up Beats, welches heuer das 25 Jahre Jubiläum feiert, trug Mike Dearborn maßgeblich mit zu dessen Erfolg bei. Er schaffte es sogar auf dem Album „Homeworks“ von „Daft Punk“ namentlich als Inspiration erwähnt zu werden. Den weltweit gebuchten DJ-Namen Mike Dearborn kennt man in Europa von großen intern. Festivals und Raves wie z.B. Mayday und Awakenings. Unser Motto von "Mit Techno alt werden- Feiern wie früher" wird seinem Titel gerecht, wenn sein 120 Minuten Oldschhool-Set den Cembrankeller in einen Dampfkessel verwandelt und für eine unvergessliche Nacht sorgen wird. Support bekommt Mike Dearborn von Martin Mueller, dem Linzer Labelbesitzer von „HOME Recordings, welcher mit seinem Label seit 2006 konsiquent seinen Weg verfolgt und dafür mit internationaler Aufmerksamkeit belohnt wurde. So hat ihn Dave Clarke auf der Playlist und der bekannte DJ und Producer Mark EG, Redakteur beim Tilllate Magazine vergleicht ihn mit einen Global Player wie Robert Hood.  Chicago- Legende Mike Dearborn ist auf der 2011 erschienenen 12 Vinyl von Martin Muellers HOME Recordings namens „Asso“ mit einem Remix vertreten.

Weiters supporten Mike Dearborn die beiden bekannten Oldschool-Veteranen und DJ‘s Burne Maximilian und Dean Lee. Allesamt erfahrene Vinyl-DJ‘s. 

Straight Techno mit einem Schuss Acid :-)

Feiert mit uns eine unvergessliche Nacht !

1416810225240250.description:
5 kwietnia Klancyk! wystąpi na Festiwalu Improwizacji w Chicago ze spektaklem Zaburzone Osobowości!

Improwizatorzy z całego świata marzą o występie na scenie w Chicago, mateczniku impro. Chicago Improv Festival (CIF) daje teraz Klancykowi taką szansę. To nad jeziorem Michigan narodziła się współczesna sztuka improwizacji teatralnej, a scena chicagowska od lat jest wzorcem dla osób uprawiających tę formę sztuki. Jedna z dziennikarek opisujących chicagowski Festiwal Improwizacji napisała o nim „When it comes to improv, Chicago is Mecca”. 

CIF to nastraszy i najdłużej trwający festiwal improwizacji na świecie. Jego pierwsza edycja odbyła się w 1998 roku. CIF jest przeglądem najlepszych grup improwizowanych z Chicago, ze Stanów Zjednoczonych i całej reszty świata. 

Do tej pory polska improwizacja nie była obecna na scenie międzynarodowej. Klancyk, najstarsza w Polsce grupa impro, ma na koncie 8 lat występów, oraz odbytą w 2012 roku podróż do Chicago, gdzie zdobywaliśmy doświadczenie w teatrach iO i Second City (uczyli się tam m.in. Bill Murray, John Belushi, Mike Myers czy Robin Williams). Teraz przyszedł czas na zaprezentowanie swoich umiejętności przed amerykańską publicznością! 

Bujamy się na żyrandolu ze szczęścia, bo Klancyk jest pierwszą polską grupą w historii, której udało się zakwalifikować na ten festiwal. Nasz teatr będzie miał okazję promować polską improwizację w miejscu narodzin tej dziedziny sztuki.

Pakujcie walizki i lećcie z nami!

więcej informacji: http://chicagoimprovfestival.org/
spektakl: http://chicagoimprovfestival.org/cif-events/klancyk-twisted-personalities-improv-kandy/

Powered by culture.pl
1416810225240250.name: KLANCYK jedzie na CHICAGO IMPROV FESTIVAL!

1419321691658478.description:
Alicia Pons and Luis Rojas will be returning to Chicago following the Chicago Mini Tango Festival.  They will be giving an intensive weekend of tango workshops on May 3 and 4, 2014. We will be structuring the classes for the intermediate and advanced dancer. They will both be available for privates during their stay. Please schedule the privates early. 

Bio
Alicia Pons is an elegant and accomplished dancer with a refined technique and distinctive personality. Her ability to imbue the role of the woman with verve and style has made her one of the most sought after female partners in Buenos Aires milongas.

She is most noted for her beautiful foot play and the strongly sensual connection with her partner, which is done with humor and decorum. She exemplifies communication and presence in the dance, and this is a focus in her teaching for both men and women.

Alicia was trained in classical ballet from an early age and as a young woman performed in some of Buenos Aires' most famous theaters such as the Colon, the Coliseo, and the Alvear. Her introduction to tango came later, and her first teacher was Graciela Gonzalez, whose women's technique helped shape Alicia's tango footwork. Alicia then gravitated toward the milonguero style and her first inspiration and male teacher in that style was Tete Rusconi, one of the most renowned milongueros of his generation.

She taught a number of years with Cacho Dante, with whom she has performed at the Teatro San Martin as part of the City of Buenos Aires Tango Festival. Alicia has been teaching both private and group classes on her own in Buenos Aires and the U.S. for the last few years. She has become a very popular visiting instructor on the U.S. Argentine Tango workshop circuit.

As a teacher, Alicia emphasizes the connection between the partners, and in particular the woman's ability to not just follow, but to be an equal protagonist in the dance. Her knowledge of the mechanics of what makes the dance work in the "milonguero" embrace is unique.

Alicia's teaching methods are grounded in her academic training. She holds a degree in Educational Science and Psychology, and she is currently an instructor for university level education students, in addition to her teaching, being a mother of two sons, and running her family real estate business. She is a very warm and caring person who loves to share her knowledge.

Luis Rojas is a Professor and Dancer of Argentine Tango since 2004. He gave regular classes in Mar Del Plata, Argentina every Tuesday and Thursday from 2004 to 2008. He also organized during that time a Milonga every Saturday called “Milonga La Academia.” In 2009, he moved to Buenos Aires, Argentina, giving private classes and group classes in the hall of “Estudios A”.

Also in 2009, he travelled for the first time to Europe for 80 days primarily to Vienna, Austria. He gave group and private classes and performed exhibitions of Argentine Tango in events sponsored by the Argentine Consulate. He returned to Buenos Aires in December 2009 and continued giving group and private classes.

In March 2010, he returned to Europe for 85 days. He went to Vienna, Austria and to various locations in Italy. He gave group and private classes and exhibitions. Afterwards he returned to Buenos Aires and he started giving group classes and private classes and organized the Milonga in the “Nacional Dance Hall”, Alicina 1465, Buenos Aires. He later returned to Europe in 2011 and returned to Buenos Aires in December.

He returned to Europe in February 2011. This time, however, he taught and performed Argentine Tango in Italy, France, Belgium, Netherlands and Spain. He also returned to Europe from October to December 2011. The rest of the time in 2011, while he was in Buenos Aires he taught classes in the “National Dance Hall.”

In 2012, he continued with his group and private classes and exhibitions in Buenos Aires. He returned to Europe in March 2012 for 3 months from March to June. He then returned to Buenos Aires where he continued giving his classes in the “National Dance Hall” on Fridays. Later in 2012, he started giving classes with the great Alicia Pons in the dance hall “Aires Tangueros” until early January 2013 when he left to give classes and perform in Italy, Belgium, Holland and Spain.
 
Here are links to performances by Alicia Pons and Luis Rojas:

1420843468168396.description:
Marbin Never ones for sitting still for very long, Marbin have spent a good chunk of the last decade establishing themselves as one of the most talented and potent new maelstorms to shake the worlds of jazz-rock fusion and progressive music in recent memory. Formed in Israel in 2007 by guitarist Dani Rabin and saxophonist Danny Markovitch (who then relocated to Chicago in 2009) from the very start, Marbin has possessed an energy and zeal perhaps only surpassed by their work ethic, dedication and habit for not sitting still for long. 
Marbin is making their presence felt and placing their indelible stamp on progressive music. They are a band whose time has clearly arrived,

A full night of wonderful music for no cover from 10pm onward... don't miss out!

▄ █ TEKNICOLOR █ ▄
crime kitchen records / morphic records
Unbound by genres and trends, TEKNiCOLOR is on the forefront of the new bass generation. Performing all over the Midwest, his tenacity for unpredictable sets combines an eclectic array of originals and unheard tracks. In addition to his one-of-a-kind sets, TEKNiCOLOR’s electrifying energy behind the decks manifests the true meaning of the TEKNiEXPERIENCE. 

Developing from his original productions such as Forward, Contact, Circle of Life, and Reality, and remixes of the likes of TOER, Antics, Crush, Nero, and Diplo, it's no surprise he was dubbed the "fastest rising producer/DJ in the Midwest" and is ranked as Madison’s #1 DJ by the DJ List. Some prominent artists TEKNiCOLOR has provided direct opening support for are Big Gigantic, Griz, Manic Focus, Carnage, Vaski, Eliot Lipp, Lucky Date, Alex Young, J. Rabbit, and Kennedy Jones. Moreover, he has shared the stage with the biggest names in the bass music scene, such as Skrillex, Dillon Francis, Flosstradamus, Feed Me, Infected Mushroom, Alvin Risk, Zomboy, Eskmo, Paper Diamond, and many more.

Debuting at Infrasound 3D on NYE (2013) in Minneapolis, TEKNiCOLOR’s live performance troupe, the TEKNiCiRCUS, has been turning heads at clubs and festivals ever since. With over 5+ years of experience ranging from employment of other touring circuses, past live performance, teaching workshops and being constant innovators of the flow arts, the TEKNiCiRCUS performers are guaranteed to leave the crowd awe-struck. Coming from a background like no other combined with the mass combination of influence, talent, dedication, innovation, and commitment; TEKNiCOLOR truly is one artist you don't want to miss.
www.teknicolormusic.com
www.soundcloud.com/teknicolorr
http://www.youtube.com/user/OfficialTEKNiCOLOR
http://dj.beatport.com/teknicolor

1430429960529539.description:
Come join the Chicago Prayer Network (CPN) and the International House of Prayer University (IHOPU) students as we gather to worship Jesus and pray for revival in Chicagoland! Stop by for one, two or the full 24 hours.

CPN exists to contend for revival in the Chicagoland area through pursuing and establishing unity to the church body. As a network of churches, we come together regularly to empower and equip leaders to create cultures of prayer within their church communities. We believe revival looks like the lost being saved and spiritual hunger arising from within local bodies. Illuminate, the 24 hour prayer event, is one of the major worship and prayer gatherings, CPN hosts.

Teams from the churches are leading worship and prayer on things on the very heart of the local church alongside IHOPU teams. This is going to be an awesome event where the body of Christ will unite to glorify His name and pray for the lost!

“May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you the same attitude of mind toward each other that Christ Jesus had, so that with one mind and one voice you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.” Romans 15:5-6
1430429960529539.name: Illuminate Chicago 2014

1431956307021555.description:
What is Blacklight Run™?

Blacklight Run™ is a unique experience focused less on speed and more on Glow in the dark fun with friends and family. Glowing runners come from all different ages, shapes, sizes, and speeds; but everyone who shows up to get Glowed™ has the time of their life. Whether you are an avid runner or a walk around the park walker, the 3 miles of the Blacklight Run™ course will have you glowing and waiting for the next one!

How does it work?

The Blacklight Run™ has been setup with very simple rules:

1) White shirts (any white T-shirt will work) worn at the start line.

2) Glow covered runners at the Finish! Runner/walkers begin the 5k at the start line like a brand new canvas.

By the end, they look like they fell into a ghost busters movie and are covered with different colored Glow™. This is the first of its kind at night and is quickly sweeping the nation!

Each person running will receive:

- Blacklight Run T-Shirt
- Special Offers from Sponsors
- Race Bib
- Glow Pack to throw at the finish line!

What is the Glow?

Along the running path you will find Glow Zone's, which are associated with a designated color: green, pink, or blue. As the runners/walkers reach the Glow Zones they are showered with neon powder that glows under our high beam black lights. All products are 100% natural and non-toxic. At the end of the race there will be a Blacklight Run™ Party filled with Music pumping from the DJ, Glowing Neon Powder and tons of black lights!


What about the finish line?

Are you ready for the best After Race party on the PLANET. After the finish, participants are encouraged to stick around, celebrate, and see exactly how much Glow one person can handle. We will have Glow, and festivities that will make your Glowing head spin.

Stay Tuned

For the latest race updates and runner giveaways stay tuned to this web page, or follow Blacklight Run™ Facebook or Twitter pages.
1431956307021555.name: Blacklight Run™ - Chicago

1432237833685982.description:
=======================
Henhouse Prowlers (Chicago)
=======================
This band has the right formula: heavenly harmonies on top of furious fingerpicking, trucking down the highway at 200mph!
Nine years in the making, Chicago’s Henhouse Prowlers have built a reputation for hard work and non-stop touring, playing music inspired by the roots of bluegrass while branching out into a sound uniquely their own. From lightning fast picking, to sentimental ballads—playing storied original material, traditional songs, and contemporary covers — the PROWLERS’ live show leaves no one wanting.
The band was recently selected to spend a month in West Africa and headed back to Europe in 2014 for their largest tour abroad to date. The Prowlers continue to push the envelope with their highly original songwriting, tight arrangements, and electrifying stage presence. With the bluegrass mantle on their back and the best fans in the world by their side, The Henhouse Prowlers are here to stay for a long, long time.

http://henhouseprowlers.com
http://www.reverbnation.com/henhouseprowlers
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xl2zNq3Pksk

=======================
The Black Elephant Band (Fürth)
=======================
Ein kongenialer Opener ist The Black Elephant Band alias Jan Bratenstein. Das Intro sagt: „... beinahe Antifolk. Zumindest geht er seine Songs ähnlich sorglos und humorvoll an wie beispielsweise Kimya Dawson. Und es reicht ihm seine Akustikgitarre, um die kleinen lakonischen Perlen zu instrumentieren. Eine Art Jonathan Richman aus dem tiefen Südosten der Republik, absolut unterhaltsam.“
Und endlich mal wieder im tiefen Südosten der Republik zu hören!

http://soundcloud.com/the-black-elephant-band

1444613869104414.description:
Join The Post Family and Chicago Film Archives for a special evening of projected film and live music.

Revel in the experimental work of late Logan Square filmmaker JoAnn Elam. Stick around for a curated selection of your own resurrected celluloid home movie treasures.

Live musical accompaniment by Synesthetic, featuring: 
Angel Elmore : piano
Joe Vajarsky : tenor saxophone
Norman Long : field recordings
Dan Godston : trumpet
Lou Ciccoteli : drums

To view other events checkout: http://comfort.thepostfamily.com/

- - - 

The strength of a community hinges on the engagement of it’s members. Individual and collective growth is the direct result of an open, free-flowing exchange of information, ideas, resources and skills. The facilitation of platforms, environments and situations conducive to this type of interaction is central to the Post Family’s mission.

This March, the Post Family will leave the confines of their studio behind to call Logan Square’s Comfort Station home. Looking to the legacy of a “comfort station” as a public place of gathering—an architectural hub within a community that’s free and open to all—they believe this to be the perfect venue to bring their ideals to life.

Rather than mount a physical exhibition, the Post Family is curating a month of programming—a series of workshops, collaborations, performances, discussions and screenings designed to engage and unite the diverse Logan Square community. They will facilitate dialogue between residents old and new: families, professionals, artists, patrons, business owners and beyond. In addition to their own events, they will be partnering with a variety of “Family friends” – including Third Coast Audio Festival, Logan Square International Film Series (Comfort Films), and others – to diversify programming and enrich the level of dialogue throughout the month. Visitors will collaborate, debate, share meals, create artwork, and above all else, engage.
1444613869104414.name: Chicago Film Archives presents: JoAnn Elam & Logan Square Home Movie Night @ Comfort Station

Solstice Stained Glass and Larry Zgoda Studio will be collaborating to host Chicago's first Stained Glass Invitational Exhibit. Part of the Day of Glass, this event will focus on increasing awareness of the rich stained glass community in the area by offering discussions about issues central to the craft, as well as brief demonstrations of working with the medium. A more in-depth, live demonstration of window restoration and painting on stained glass will be underway through the course of the day, as different steps of a portrait will be painted on glass and kiln fired.

1454221961480558.description:
Добро пожаловать в криминальный Чикаго 20 - 30-х годов прошлого века!
Вас ждет незабываемый вечер в компании брутальных мужчин и роскошных дам! Бармены предложат Вам коктейли искусно замаскированные под кофе и чай, так как в Meresuu баре “Beluga Bay” будет действовать «сухой закон». В сигарной комнате бара Вы сможете насладиться элитными сигарами различных марок. Проникновенные звуки саксофона и чарующий голос солистки помогут вам погрузиться в атмосферу Чикаго 20 – 30-х годов.
Уважаемые гости, помните - это были опасные времена и поэтому будьте готовы к любым неожиданным приключениям!

Tere tulemast eelmise sajandi alguse kriminaalsesse Chicagosse!

Sind ootab unustamatu õhtu luksuslike naiste ja julmade meeste seltskonnas. Meresuu baaris kehtib alkohoolikeeld. Vaatamata sellele baarmanid pakuvad Sulle kokteile, mis on varjatud kohvi või tee nime all. Sigari toas saad maitsta ja nautida erinevat marki sigareid. Hingeline helide saksofon ja lummav solisti hääl viivad Sind eelmise sajandi 20.-30. aastate Chicagosse.

Kallis külaline, kui Sa tead, et see oli ohtlik aeg, siis ole valmis üllatusteks!
1454221961480558.name: Chicago Party@Beluga Bay

1459564170944701.description:
Zapraszamy na czwartą imprezę z cyklu Vatican Vibes. Po dźwiękach Los Angeles, Nowego Jorku i Berlina nadszedł czas na brzmienie typowe dla Chicago. 
▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂
TAX: 
10 PLN - Z LISTY FB DO GODZ. 23:59
20 PLN - WSZYSCY POZOSTALI
▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂

Juke house (i towarzyszący mu taniec footwork, terminy stosuje się często zamiennie) zaczął się formować już pod koniec lat 80., by w ostatnim pięcioleciu podbić międzynarodowe listy przebojów, blogi i festiwale muzyczne. Za narodziny juke house'u uważa się wczesne produkcje RP Boo bądź DJ Gantmana dla kultowego labelu Dance Mania. Juke jest pochodną ghetto house'u, nosi więc podobne cechy szczególne: niskobudżetowa produkcja, wykorzystanie dźwieków Rolanda 808 i 909, sample wokalne - zwykle nacechowane seksualnie. Wulgarne repetycje są tutaj podkręcone do tempa 160 BPM, co z synkopowanymi uderzeniami maszyn perkusyjnych powoduje prawdziwe szaleństwo na parkiecie. 

Z dumą prezentujemy naszego gościa:

☛ DJ EARL (TEKLIFE/Moveltraxx/Chicago)

Earl to najmłodszy bodaj członek kolektywu TEKLIFE, znanego w kraju głównie za pośrednictwem fenomenalnych występów DJ Rashada & DJ Spinna. Zaledwie 22-letni Earl wydał już trzy albumy (własnym sumptem) oraz dwie EPki - kolejno w Lil Pitch i Moveltraxx. Podobnie jak RP Boo, zaczynał swoją przygodę od tańca, później w 2008 roku poznał Rashada i Spinna. Zaczął tworzyć własne utwory, inspirując się nie tylko Traxmanem, ale również hip-hopowymi producentami jak J-Dilla czy Timbaland. DJ Earl reprezentuje nową generację chicagowskiego footworku, sampluje jazz, funk, pop i hip-hop, po czym zatapia to wszystko w charakterystycznych snare'ach i ciężkim subbassie.

http://www.soundcloud.com/djearlteckz
http://ghettoteknitianz.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Deejay-Earl/217300085654

☛ Paide (Polish Juke/Wrocław)

DJ, recenzent muzyczny, aktywny działacz wrocławskiego radia internetowego radio-alternator.com, w ostatnim czasie równie intensywnie zaangażowany w projekt Polish Juke - inicjatywę promującą polskich producentów zainspirowanych footwork/juke z Chicago. Wielbiciel amerykańskiego undergroundu i wszelkich jego odmian: nowoorleańskiego NOLA Bounce, jersey club, trapu, ale 
przede wszystkim footwork i juke.

http://www.radio-alternator.com/
http://www.mixcloud.com/Paide/
https://www.facebook.com/polishjuke

☛ Musley (Polish Juke/Wrocław)

Musley to rzeszowski producent i dj specjalizujący się w ciężkich wałkach inspirowanych Rolandem 808. Poza gatunkami takimi jak juke nie pogardzi skocznym future garage czy halfstepowym drum and bassem. Jego kawałki znalazły się na kompilacjach World Wide Juke, Lowfreq Poland vol. 3., Music of the Future vol. 1 i Juke World Order vol. 1.

https://soundcloud.com/musley
https://www.facebook.com/Musley.yo

☛ DJ Alonzo (Lineout.pl/Warszawa)

Redaktor Lineout.pl, dziennikarz i promotor, współpracuje z magazynami VICE, Decoder Mag i Resident Advisor, współorganizuje z Jakubem Mihilewiczem Targi Niezależnych Wytwórni; w swoich setach stawia na eksperymentalny house i techno z wycieczkami w stronę najróżniejszych mikrogatunków.

https://soundcloud.com/deejay_alonzo

☛ DJ Smakowita Pajda (Lineout.pl/Ślůnsk)

Człowiek-smalec: tłusty i zwierzęcy, ale pożywny i tani. Wśród przyjaciół słynie z nietypowego zapachu. Wytaczając nową jakość na rodzimej scenie klubowej, zdecydował się nie podpisywać umowy patronackiej z żadnym producentem alkoholu - zamiast tego wybrał produkty garmażeryjne.

Support:

Lineout.pl
Aktivist
future-bass.pl
PORCYS
Screenagers.pl
Polish Juke
1459564170944701.name: ☯ Vatican Vibes ☮ pres. DJ EARL [TEKLIFE/Chicago], Paide, Musley, DJ Alonzo, DJ Smakowita Pajda *LISTA FB*

1466836040214175.description:
Hi Everybody! 

I just signed up for the Bank of America Chicago Marathon! ...and you know what that means! It's time to RUN, RUN, & RUN! I know I've done it before, but this time it's a little different after I hurt my knee. Training is going to be a lot slower and I'm not going to be able to train as much or as hard as I did last summer. So, that being said... Every Marathon is a new experience, so let's make this one to remember and one that can really make a difference!

This year, I really want to run for a good cause and FOR A PURPOSE! ...and so, I will be running in order to raise money for the Organization called RISE INTERNATIONAL. What is it you might ask?! RISE is an Org. that builds primary schools in rural Angola to educate children, empower communities and contribute to the rebuilding of the country.This cause really speaks to me because all my life I have been given the privilege to go to elementary, middle school, high school, and even college! And honestly, I haven't been taking the full advantage of it. I've actually been very ungrateful about the life I have been given, forgetting that not everyone CAN or is ABLE to do what I do everyday. Sometimes all I want to do is dropout, give up, and just do something else with my life. I know that school isn't for everyone, but I still don't think that it's fair to those who have never experienced it. And so, here's were you come in! In order for these kids to go to school and better themselves, RISE needs help raising money to build schools for them to actually go to! Every child should have the chance to go to school, to learn to read and write. 4 million children in Angola do not have any access to primary education. I feel that everyone should be given the chance and the choice to go to school. So, can we help these kids to reach their full potential and even help them stop the cycle of poverty and illiteracy?

If this cause speaks to you as it has for me, feel welcomed to donate to this page. Again, my goal will be $1000, where just $250 can send a child to school! 
 
FOR THOSE OF YOU WHO LIKE TO RUN:
As I start training for this marathon, I will be still continuing on with my running club, NICE GUYS! For those who are interested in running a half marathon, a 5K, a 15K, want to build your endurance, or just want to run... You may contact me at jessal100103@gmail.com, Facebook message me, or text me if you would like me to train you or run with you. Each one-on-one or group run will be $1. And I promise you, each run & $1 we raise, will be time well spent. It will be worth that every mile and every minute knowing it may someday give a child the chance to better themselves in some way. So, again I never like asking for money! But, if you are willing and want to help... feel free to donate to this awesome cause!

Otherwise, thank you all for your support as always :)

For more information on RISE INTERNATIONAL please visit the link below.

http://riseinternational.org/
1466836040214175.name: Chicago Bank of America Marathon (RUN 4A CAUSE)

1470115926545051.description:
(Now with 100% More Public Invite!)

A Hearty Huzzah to Pillow Warriors Young and Old!

BEHOLD! The time of the Great Pillow Reckoning is soon upon us! We shall gather in our masses, bearing our pillows on high, and win the glorious victory of ridiculous horseplay!

The field of battle shall once again be Wrigley Square, at Randolph & Michigan!
MAP: http://tinyurl.com/CPFD2014

For those driving in, easy parking can be had at the Millennium Park Garage at 5 S. Columbus.

For those coming in on pubtran, the Randolph Metra station and the Randolph & Michigan bus stop (or the Michigan & Randolph bus stop) are both right there.

After the battle, join us across the street for Chicago style deep dish at Giordano's!

INTERNATIONAL PILLOW FIGHT DAY RULES OF ENGAGEMENT
________________________________________
1. PLEASE DO NOT BRING FEATHER OR DOWN PILLOWS.
2. IF YOU DO BRING A FEATHER OR DOWN PILLOW, DO NOT TEAR IT OPEN.
3. IF YOU SEE SOMEONE TEARING OPEN A PILLOW, PLEASE ASK THEM TO STOP AND HELP CLEAN IT UP! LITTER IS BAD, MMKAY?
4. DO NOT SWING AT PERSONS WHO ARE NOT PARTICIPATING.
5. DO NOT SWING AT PERSONS NOT HOLDING PILLOWS.
6. DO NOT SWING AT PERSONS HOLDING CAMERAS.
7. SMALL CHILDREN ARE FRAGILE! PLEASE PUMMEL THE HOBBITS WITH CARE!
8. WATCH OUT FOR VEHICLE AND FOOT TRAFFIC- STAY OUT OF STREETS AND WALKWAYS AND TRY NOT TO INTERFERE WITH NON-PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE GOING ABOUT THEIR BUSINESS.
9. OBEY ALL POSTED LAWS AND INSTRUCTIONS FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS.
10. PLEASE, NO ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES OR RECREATIONAL SUBSTANCES (EVEN THE LEGAL ONES). THIS IS A FAMILY EVENT!
11. EVERYONE IS ENCOURAGED TO STAY AND HELP CLEAN UP IF NECESSARY!

International Pillow Fight Day is a global celebration of the ancient art of pillow fighting. Throughout history, pillow fighting has been the civilized form of battle which results in victory for all who take part. Come, raise your trustiest war-pillow to remind destructive forces everywhere that the only truly valiant fights are won with stuffing and cloth!

We also want this event to be safe and respectful to the community that hosts it, so please read and follow the guidelines on the opposite side of the flyer. We're here to have fun and make people smile, and maybe even to make some people realize that life isn't all work and no play; but there will always be those for whom such pastimes are "childish" or "inappropriate". These people can't be saved, so just let them be. Additionally, this is a family friendly and community friendly event, so please don't engage in any illegal or reckless behaviors. Pillow fighting can be a blast without anybody needing to take a ride downtown. Let's make sure the only people getting smacked are those who want to be!

A word about feathers- I know some pillow fighters really enjoy the flying feathers, but the simple truth is that a huge blizzard of down floating around the streets, parks, and into the river is a nightmare to clean up, not just for us, but for the dedicated city sanitation employees who are probably underpaid and overworked. Beyond that, it's not kind to the environment, or to our fellow citizens. So, like the owl says, "Give a Hoot, Don't Pollute!"

Trash bags and gloves will be provided for those who want to help clean up after the event. Heck, you can even clean up the regular litter if you want- no reason we can't give back a little, right? When clean up is done, please join us for post-battle refreshments and tales of heroic deeds at a local eatery!

There are cities all around the world, from Amsterdam to Zurich, participating in Pillow Fight Day, and you can see all the cool places joining the battle at pillowfightday.com

Let's make sure Chicago remains one of the most memorable, fantastic, fun, and safe cities to pillow fight in, and let's show those other cities that we can pummel with the best of 'em!
________________________________________
1470115926545051.name: Global Pillow Fight Day Chicago 2014 - The Case of the Pillow Pugilists!

1477659185780057.description:
It's hard to believe it was 10 years ago a handful of friends got together for the first Chicago Gold Coast Film Festival. There they sat in the old Ambassador East Hotel taking turns showing off their homemade comedy films shot on home VHS cameras.

Fast forward to last year where over 300 people gathered in Park West to watch films from all over the country with much higher production values.

One thing has remained constant throughout the years, however; everybody gets dressed up for laughs with friends and another night of making memories.

This year the 10th Annual Chicago Gold Coast Film Festival is all set for May 10th at Park West. Doors open at 7:30pm and the films start at 9pm.

We HIGHLY recommend you eat dinner before arriving, as there will only be popcorn and candy available at the festival.

Tickets are only $35 and you can get them here: http://bit.ly/1psqWCq

1479235755623853.description:
RE:VISION - Chicago May 2nd 
featuring Alex Grey & Allyson Grey
Presented By In The Loop Productions, 
Euphonic Conceptions, Silver Wrapper, and Stilldream
music from: 

Michal Menert (Pretty Lights Music)

The first artist signed to Pretty Lights Music, after co-producing Pretty Lights' debut album, "Taking Up Your Precious Time (2006)" and contributing to a handful of the project's tracks afterward.  In 2010 he released his first full-length solo album, entitled "Dreaming Of A Bigger Life." He also performs with Paul Basic under the name Half Color. Michal's second release, the mega-LP "Even If It Isn't Right" is dropping in spring of 2012. Half Color's debut EP is expected soon after.. 

Phutureprimitive

Phutureprimitive's music is best described as dripping wet love drops of nasty mind melting sonic bliss. Lush melodies drift across intricate rhythms, groove heavy beats and warm, fuzzy bass lines. Often exploring a dark and dense palette, there is also a profound sense of tranquility and beauty, engaging the listener in hypnotic movement and often escalating into a full-on kinetic experience. Shimmering with cinematic qualities, his music ultimately speaks to the body, mind and soul.

ESKMO

Brendan Angelides is a Los Angeles-based electronic music producer who records and performs live as Eskmo. His multi-genre compositions have been featured on influential labels like Ninja Tune, Warp Records and Planet Mu. The "Terra" EP is the follow up and opposite-side-of-the-coin release to his October release "Language". While "Language" delved into "chunky dance aesthetics turned on their head", "Terra" explores a slower, slightly darker and more raw side of the field. The themes center around Earth from the standpoint of being human and the archetypal worlds we fall into. 


Paul Basic (Pretty Lights Music)

Starting out as a drummer, Colorado producer Paul Brandt aka Paul Basic joined a band with Derek Vincent Smith (Pretty Lights) and Michal Menert in high school before they each moved on to pursue solo production work. In fall 2011 Paul released his debut EP 'The Mirror' on Pretty Lights Music which featured a gritty, nostalgic sound blending dusty samples, grainy synths, biting bass and thick drums - a combination that earned him an integral place within the PLM movement. 


Late Night Radio (Denver, CO)

Medellin’s background in hip-hop is crucial to his development as a producer. Unlike some of his contemporaries who came up in the dance music scene, Late Night Radio keeps his cuts funky and inventive with an unshakable commitment to soulful grooves. Even when LNR breaks into high-energy, cabinet-rattling climaxes, the emotional depth remains. His wildly popular Vinyl Restoration series of old-school mixes has rooted his sound in deep, expressive sampling that keeps him firmly grounded in the lessons of the past, while reaching forward to craft his own signature sound.

Psydell (Chicago)

27 year old producer from central Illinois. Creating music with love and integrity in hopes of opening the minds of the masses and bringing people together. Spreading a message of awareness and compassion for each other and our surroundings.

and much more!

FYM presents 

JOHNNY FIASCO (Defected/OM Records) - CHICAGO    

Dieses mal haben wir weder Kosten, noch Mühen gescheut, um euch einen der Pioniere und Heavyweights der US DJ- und Producerszene ins schöne Bayern zu holen. Er wird euch mit deepen Rhythmen und satten Bässen zum ausflippen bringen!                                Hier schon mal eine exklusive Kostprobe seines Könnens : ➡ www.soundcloud.com/funkyamind/fym-podcast-016-johnny
Musikalischen Support gibt es wie immer von unseren FYM-Boys!                                                                                                                                                          

Timetable:

✖ Flobe b2b JHoni b2b Roman Lechner                                 

✖ Johnny Fiasco                                                                

✖ Andi Malanders                                                                                                                                                                                    

<3 Keep the funk alive, yours FYM <3


Einlass ab 18+ /// Garderobe verfügbar

Sound & Light by Mainstage Eventtechnik

➡ Mehr zu JOHNNY FIASCO:

www.soundcloud.com/johnnyfiasco 

Kaskade - 
"A true legend that has helped define the 'Chicago Sound' over the last two decades, respect." 

Jimpster (Official) - 
"Johnny has been rocking the spot for me ever since I discovered his ‘Conduction’ track. A seriously accomplished producer and DJ who is taking Chicago house to the next level."

Bio.
JOHNNY FIASCO, mittlerweile seit über 20 Jahren im Geschäft, ist nicht nur einer der Pioniere der "Chicago House" Szene, sondern eine LEGENDE. Dieser bemerkenswerte PRODUZENT und REMIXER spielt in Clubs und Events überall auf der Welt. Sein einzigartiger Sound, kombiniert elegant fundamentalen House mit Einflüssen aus Techno, Soul, Disco und Funk. Aufgewachsen in SouthSide, Chicago, startete Johnny seine musikalische Karriere im einflussreichen Club "SHELTER". Dabei brachte er u.a. mit Kollege MARK FARINA in der SMARTBAR, LIZARD LOUNGE oder dem berüchtigten Club NAKED, Housemusik auf eine neues Level. Heute ist Johnny Fiasco einer der Top Producer und Remixer in der elektronischen Musikszene. Sein Ruf als hervorragender Produzent hat ihm Aufträge von Toplabels wie SONY, JIVE, EPIC, WARNER BROS. und bedeutenden Independent Labels wie DEFECTED, OM RECORDS und UNIVERSAL UK eingebracht. Aufgrund seiner Klasse als Remixer hat er außerdem schon mit Musik Hochkarätern wie KASKADE, OWL CITY, RHIANNA, DONNA BARKLEY, BOB SINCLAIR, DJ SNEAK und vielen anderen gearbeitet. Die Remixes "RISE" von SAMANTHA JAMES und "CRY ME A RIVER REWORK" von JUSTIN TIMBERLAKE erreichten sogar Platz 1 der Billboard Charts in den USA. Zusätzlich komponiert er Musik für TV Werbespots und den Musiksender MTV. Dies unterstreicht, Johnny Fiasco ist ein musikalisches Multitalent und auf jeden Fall einer der bedeutendsten Produzenten weltweit!

www.5chicago.com/features/man-and-machine/johnny-fiasco/
1479715342244588.name: FunkYaMind presents Johnny Fiasco (Defected, OM Records) Chicago

1483451535204177.description:
Local arts organization, Chicago Avenue Fire Arts Center is leaping into a national spotlight with its upcoming exhibition, Playing With Fire. In conjunction with the Society of North American Goldsmith’s annual metalsmithing conference being held in Minneapolis (April 23-26), we will present the work of eight nationally recognized metal artists. An array ranging from hand made steel knives to jewelry and hand formed vessels will be on display from April 16-May 6, 2014.

CAFAC's own programs will also be featured during the opening reception on Thursday, April 24, from 5 to 9 p.m., with instructors demonstrating techniques ranging from blacksmithing to flameworked glass beads.

Conveniently located in the heart of Minneapolis on Chicago Avenue, this is a rare opportunity for the Twin Cities to view exceptional works of art made of metal and to meet many renowned artists working in this medium.

Curated by Heather Doyle and Carol Warner, artists included in Playing with Fire are:

Heinz Brummel, Enameled jewelry and sculptural objects (Minneapolis, MN)
Rick Dunkerley, Damascus steel knife maker (Lincoln, MT)
Darlys Ewoldt, Teapots and sculptural vessels (Chicago, IL)
Susan Hunt, Sterling tableware and candelabras (Menomonie, WI)
Heejin Hwang, steel and gold jewelry (Chicago, IL)
Barbara Minor, Enameled jewelry (Baton Rouge, LA)
Kevin O’Dwyer, Damascus knives (Tullamore Co, Offaly, Ireland)
Carol Warner, Color on handmade vessels (Minneapolis, MN)

CAFAC is also hosting an intensive Color on Metal workshop which local metalsmiths are encouraged to investigate.

“We are really excited about presenting this exhibition and workshop to the local community,” said Heather Doyle, Artistic Director at Chicago Avenue Fire Arts Center.  “This is the most ambitious undertaking of this nature in our history!”

Exhibition Dates:  April 16-May 6, 2014
Public Reception: Thursday, April 24, 5-9 pm
Color on Metal Workshop:
	Enamel Surfaces: Patterns and Markings, April 27-28

Space is limited.  Details available at: http://www.cafac.org/classes/snag2014

Funk has a new spokes band, and that band is Yo Mama’s Big Fat Booty Band. Known for their raucous live shows and outrageous stage wear, the Booty Band’s sound is a mix of deep funk, high energy rock, plus a little old school rap and soul thrown in for good measure.

Abbey Pub 
3420 W Grace St 
Chicago, IL 
Thurs, May 8, 2014
Ages 21+ | $10.00

Yo Mama's Big Fat Booty Band
www.bootyband.com
Yo Mama’s Big Fat Booty Band formed in 2002 and went through a few incarnations before culminating into the dynamic ensemble it is today. Mary Frances “Mama Funk” creates a sultry platform for her keyboard and keytar playing with her powerhouse vocals. Laying down the bottom is Al Al “Sweet Nasty” Ingram on bass and vocals and Derrick “Dr Ock” Johnson on trombone. JP “Smoke Machine” Miller soars on guitar, and Lee “Insta Funk” Allen drives it all forward on drums. The five-piece funk rock outfit fuels their high-energy show with original compositions, triumphant horns, laid-back grooves and heavy backbeats. 

Chicago Funk Mafia

1490274751194511.description:
When: Thursday, May 8. Doors 6:30pm, Presentations 7:30pm, Dinner 8:30pm

Why:  Be a part of the decision making model for funding a grassroots project that will benefit our city!

How: Donate $5-$10, which gets you a (substantial) dinner, a vote, and entrance to the event. 

Who:  Representatives from the following projects will present to you ...

**Follow the Alphabet Road aims to educate students, foster community and create beautiful art via a sculpture garden located behind a school on the Northwest side of Chicago.

**The Madonna Mission's Refugee Women's Cookbook is a plan to compile delicious recipes from female refugees who have come to Chicago from around the world.

**The Neighborhood Engagement Initiative Community Resident Survey is a grassroots effort to gather important information about the West Pullman community area, in the hopes of empowering the community to create a holistic plan to improve quality of life.

**Urban Escape Healing Studio opens its doors every 2nd Saturday to promote alternative healing options to those who need it, regardless of their financial situation.

The Grant Salon offers you the opportunity to learn about different initiatives headed by Chicagoans. You listen to four presentations on bighearted local projects and vote for one to receive a microgrant provided by Bold Urban Renaissance Network (along with the $5-$10 donations from the door). Democracy in action! And of course, all the voting is done over a tasty nutritious meal provided by Edible Alchemy Foods Co-op.  

The grants make a real difference for these projects, and we hope you can be a part of it. Please RSVP so we can make sure that we cook enough food!

We need lots of volunteers to make this event happen, so please consider helping out.  It feels good, and it's a wonderful opportunity to meet great people.  Just fill out the volunteer form at  http://bit.ly/1iiR1RO.  Thank you!!
1490274751194511.location: South Loop location (email civicgrantsATboldurbanDOTorg for location)
1490274751194511.name: Chicago Community Grant Salon (by BWB&BURN)

1491012724453759.description:
6th ANNUAL CHICAGO/ILLINOIS TAX DAY TEA PARTY RALLY  www.TeaPartyChicago.org

Rally across the street begins at 3:00 p.m.

Doors open at 4:00 p.m.

Requested Donation: $5.00 at door - Theater holds 900 - First Come, First Serve

Parking is just north and just west of the theater, Metra West line trains run from Chicago to Geneva & back every 1/2 hour

Theme: "Believe"

Come join us at the beautiful Arcada Theater, 105 E. Main Street, in St. Charles for an evening with top Illinois fiscal conservatives and great musical entertainment from amazing performers on April 15th, TAX DAY!

Parking is just north and just west of the theater. Metra West line trains run from Chicago to Geneva & back every half hour.

Master Of Ceremonies - Denise Cattoni - Founder, Illinois Tea Party

Confirmed Speakers:

Jim Oberweis - Republican U.S. Senate Candidate

Jeanne Ives - Illinois State Representative

Dan Proft - WLS AM890 Talk Show Host

Larry Kaifesh - Republican U.S. Congressional Candidate - 8th District

Jack Roeser - Owner, Otto Engineering and Founder, Champion News

Joe Walsh - Am560 The Answer Talk Show Host and Former U.S. Congressman

Andrew Gasser - Precinct Committeeman and candidate for McHenry County Board

Adam Andrzejewski - Founder of For the Good of Illinois

C.Steven Tucker - www.TruthAboutObamacare.com

Jackie Menconi - Representative for Term Limits

John Tillman - Founder of Illinois Policy Institute

David From - State Director - American for Prosperity

Darlene Ruscitti - Chairman, Dupage County Republican Party

and more......

Doors open at 4:00 pm with music by world class guitarist, John Ivan named "Best guitarist in the Midwest" by Steve Dahl. Atlantic Records "off broadway" and Big Guitars from Memphis guitarist and songwriter John Ivan performs solo in the USA, Denmark, Norway, Austria, and England. Winner of Musician magazine's BUB contest and Chicago Music Awards Best Entertainment nominee. John Ivan has the engaging style of Les Paul, and features a wide variety of great melodies from Sinatra to Beatles, Led Zep to White T's, standards to bop, hillbilly to hymns and authentic Flameco, Latin, Brazil and Mediterranean favorites.

Another great performer will be Kevin Chalfant, the first stand in lead singer for Steve Perry with Journey, performing 'Don't Stop Believing' and 'God Bless America'. The name Kevin Chalfant has been synonymous with rock royalty for the past two and a half decades and counting. From his early beginnings with Billboard charting sensations 707 to the 80s powerhouse group The Vu, the versatile vocalist has weaved a remarkably artistic web that eventually paved the way for superstardom with The Storm (including members of Journey and Santana), which became the first act in history signed to Interscope Records, known for the smash singles "I've Got a Lot To Learn About Love" and "Show Me the Way." 

Another great performer will be Bert Cattoni performing 'I Still Believe'. Singer/Songwriter Bert Cattoni manages to cross musical boundaries by seamlessly mixing Pop, Contemporary Country, Rock, Blues and a healthy dose of original music into an unforgettable stage performance that his fans have grown to love. Bert has opened for some music greats, such as Martina McBride, George Jones, John Berry and Lyle Lovett to name a few.

If you would like to walk with signs/flags prior to the event, we ask that you walk on the west side of the river on Rte. 64

Beer, wine, soft drinks and finger foods will be available at the theater

After Tea Party Party's for food and drinks will be held at:
- Acquaviva Winery Wine Bar
- Alley 64 Pub - Both are 2 blocks west of theater

Contact: Denise Cattoni - 630.290.2130
Steven Tucker - 630.674.1551
1491012724453759.name: 6th annual Chicago/Illinois Tax Day Tea Party Rally.

This is an event that has been scheduled for July 12th,2014,at Hawthorne Race Course. There are also other events scheduled throughout the US. 
The promoters bill this as a "fun and exciting event!" To have cattle stampeding in a closed area,while people try and not get trampled? I am appalled that NO animal rights groups are speaking out on this. www.thegreatbullrun.com is the link to the site for more details.
So...why am I bitching about this? Well, I also started an online petition to shut them down! 
Here is the link for the petition.Please sign and share! Thanks and peace and love!

I appreciate if you RSVP,but would REALLY rather you SIGN the petition! Smooches!

Patty Vaccarella

Delta 9, is a hardcore techno DJ/producer from Chicago.
The name "Delta 9" comes from delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (Δ9-THC), the main psychoactive substance found in the cannabis plant.
Delta 9 has been producing since 1994, starting with Deep 13 & The Hate Tank on Drop Bass Network Records. His many releases with Industrial Strength Records date back to 1995. Delta 9 is also owner of Psychotik Records, and has over 40 solo 12 inch releases (including under his alias The Imposters).
Delta 9 has appeared on over 200 compilations including the Thunderdome series, Hellraiser, Third Movement's Demolition, the Mystery Land[disambiguation needed] series, and the Masters of Hardcore compilations. He has also done many remixes for bands including Corrosion of Conformity, Napalm Death, The Berzerker, Agoraphobic Nosebleed and Soil.
On January 18, 2008, Delta 9 announced that his new label, "Devil Times Nine" would start distributing his works through Sound&Base Music, starting with DTN1 in February 2008.

Nancy Reagan Smoke a Dope on the Quad Day at UChicago was four year (maybe) annual event that occurred in the late 1980s and featured about 150-200 students and some professors smoking marijuana (though it was illegal at the time) in the center quads. Smoking a blunt with your professor, that's the dream! I'm not bringing back the event and rather, just wanted to share this awesome fact about the university (also to collect some data).

I KNOW. I'm an asshole and I tricked you and this isn't as cool as it sounds but help me out anyways and... if you would've attended such an event or would attend the event now, please click that you're attending and if you're interested in it and wouldn't participate but would stop by and look, click maybe. 

....please help me with this and invite your friends, respond, ask any questions. PLEASE. 

Thank you, my good samaritans.
