276871452469046.description:
***SCHEDULE IS UP***
http://tinyurl.com/CGS2014schedule

***RULES AND FORMAT ARE UP***
http://tinyurl.com/CGSrules

***PRIZE MONEY***
$1,000 for first
$500 for second
$300 for third

Tickets are $10 for adults, $5 for youth

*****
THE REGISTRATION AND TICKETING PAGE IS NOW UP!!
http://ticketsweb.uchicago.edu/shows/chicago%20grand%20slam/info
http://www.strikingly.com/chicagograndslam2014
*****

This is an experiment. 

This year, for the first time ever, Catcher in the Rhyme (the University of Chicago’s Spoken Word student group) and the Reva and David Logan Center For the Arts are pleased to announce the first annual Chicago Grand Slam (CGS): A day-long poetry festival to be held on Sunday April 13, 2014, at the Logan Center on the University of Chicago campus. 

The premise is simple: Chicago is the birthplace of Slam Poetry—but what started in the 80s at the Get Me High Lounge has since become a worldwide phenomenon open to poets of all ages. It’s become a vehicle for young people to express things they couldn’t express in a classroom, in a conversation, or even in a written poem. To that end, wonderful spoken word events like Brave New Voices, CUPSI, and Chicago’s own Louder Than a Bomb have catered to young, high school and college-aged poets. But here, in the birthplace of Slam, there are still very few opportunities for poets of all ages to perform together on equal ground—not as mentors and mentees, but fellow students of our own voices. Fellow poets. 

To that end, CGS will be a city-wide individual poetry slam open to performers of all ages, the goal being to bring together high school, college, and adult poets for a day-long poetry festival where we can write, teach, learn, and explore together. There will be cash prizes for the top three finalists, and various workshops and other performance events throughout the day for anyone with a festival, poet, or staff pass. 

Registration will cost $30 per person (making it less expensive to enter than any other major slam), and Festival Passes will be $10 for adults and $5 for high school or college students. Festival volunteers will receive a free Staff Pass that guarantees their entry into all the day’s events. 

Regardless of our age, our class, the number of books we’ve published, or the number of slams we’ve won, the poets of Chicago are all of the same lot. We live in a city of grand contradictions: A city known for great violence and great art, lavish corruption and grind-mode work, abject resignation, and endless wonder. Our poetry teaches us how to exist in this space. It teaches us how to speak up, and how to do it well. It comforts us, saddens us, moves us, and redeems us. It teaches us to find our voices, and then it teaches us how to use them. 

This is an experiment. You are hereby cordially invited to the Chicago Grand Slam. 

—Shaan Heng-Devan, Founder and Organizer
276871452469046.location: Reva and David Logan Center for the Arts
276871452469046.name: Chicago Grand Slam (CGS)

277532865757188.description:

284574051702875.description:
A Gala celebrating the renaming of South Street Journal to Chicago Street Journal.  While the newspaper has been a major part in forming and shaping the news in reports, the event will be paying homage to Black Wall Street-Chicago; on the first BWS District of 75th Street, the Quarry, located at 2327 East 75th Street, Chicago. 
Carrying on that spirit during the second inauguration of President Barack Obama, as  the President paid honor to the historical event of Black Wall Street Tulsa Oklahoma, and the remaining decedents; 2014 marks the 184th year of the Spirit of Black Tulsa's rise to self-sustainability. This year also marks the 94th year of the physical destruction of the 40 square-block area in north Tulsa; and the 7th year of Black Wall Street Chicago. 
State Senator Donne Trotter will be a special guest as he passed Senate Resolution SR 0432 recognizing Black Wall Street District Chicago of 75th Street. The SR 0432 resolution comes on the heels the Honorable Dorothy Brown, clerk of the Circuit Court of Cook County Circuit Court of Cook County in September. Senator Kwame Raoul (D) 13th
In addition, led by the South East Chicago Chamber of Commerce the State of Illinois House of Representative General Assembly passed the resolution for Stony Island as a Black Wall Street District sponsored by former Representative Melvin Colvin; 71st Street to 95th Street of Stony Island. In the making State Senator, Jacqueline Collins is proposing legislation for 69 and 79th Street, and Congressman Bobby Rush is preparing for National Recognition of Black Wall Street.
With the theme of “All Eyes on the District” BWSC is continuing the agenda with Summit XXII in June of this year. This is not just about today, but for future generations avoiding what should have happen before this generation using the power of the press of the renewed Chicago Street Journal. 
It will be our honor for you presence for networking, food, entertainment, art auctions from the publisher and just great people in a reunion format of the 20 years of the newspaper.
284574051702875.name: Chicago Street Journal Celebration Gala of Black Wall Street

286289674859534.description:
Legends of the Chicago underground since the 80s, ONO make their triumphant return to the Bottle tonight and are sure to wow/confound/destroy all in attendance like they have before. They've remained outsiders in a sea of outsiders, and if you've seen em before you know to expect the unexpected...it might be sparse electronic beats, motorik drums, guitar skronk, slinky bass riffs and rock theatre for the end of the world, or it might be the best Roxy Music cover you've never heard. ONO are heroes to all the freaks and they will never die. They will be aided by  Brett Naucke on sick synths.

An elusive rhythm & bluesman born in West Helena, Arkansas, T. VALENTINE first came to Chicago in 1950, when he was 18 years old, to make music and become a performer. VALENTINE has been performing his own renegade brand of off-kilter Chicago R&B/soul bag raunch ever since and he founded VAL Records in 1962, where he released "Do the Do," "Betty Sue," both of his versions of "Black Power," and his biggest hit (for his ex-wife), "Lucille Are You A Lesbian." Norton Records, who'd been looking for VALENTINE since the late-80s, finally tracked him down in 1999 and released a compilation album, Hello Lucille, in 2000, which is the same year T. VALENTINE made his Empty Bottle debut! Tonight the 80-plus years old T. Valentine will be performing with his new backing band THE VELCRONICS (Velcro Lewis Group plus one James Porter) so don't miss it!

BIL VERMETTE has been recording and performing electronic music since the early 70s--probably longer than you've been alive (but maybe not, who knows). His 1984 album Katha Visions, a private press super-rarity, was just reissued by the fine folks at Permanent Records/Galactic Archives (Plastic CW's imprint), who say "Fans of all things SYNTH absolutely must hear this LP." VERMETTE makes ambient synth dirges that are repetitive, layered and soothing ala krautgods Cluster and Tangerine Dream, and he's joined by the organizer of tonight's event, PLASTIC CRIMEWAVE, making the performance about as rare and special as it gets.

Born in 1945 in Chicago, JIM CUOMO is a saxophonist and composer who has made brainwaves melt from the 60s through the 80s with experimental psych band SPOILS OF WAR and witchy acid-folk group MORMOS, not to mention collaborations with John Cage, T.Rex, the Monty Python-connected Bonzo Dog Doo Dah Band  and his pioneering solo computer/8-bit music for the Commodore 64 (try and compete with that CV, I dare you!) Joined for this show by ANNIE THE HAT and ELLIOTT DELMAN (of Mormos/Spoils of War), JIM's woodwind improvisations (acoustic and digital) have been reunited with his classic compositions from the 60's and his game music from the 80's into a completely unique live show.
286289674859534.name: FREE MONDAY: Secret History of Chicago Music 10th Anniversary Show!

289364447885229.description:
Get Off The Couch Presents... 

We have assembled 4 of the finest bands from Chicago, Nashville, and New York to end Record Store Day with a bang.

Join us at Martyrs' as we welcome:

Kyle Andrews (Nashville) 
Jonny Drake (Chicago)
Jeff Taylor (New York) - EP Release Show
Ace Reporter (Chicago) - Album Re-release Show

This is a "Get Off The Couch Presents..." show which means 4 full sets and no couch - just a night of music that will blow your mind.

----
KYLE ANDREWS (http://kyleandrews.com)

1. originally from Chicago (go bulls, go cubs)
2. moved to Nashville in 2002
3. released Amos In Ohio on Badman Recording Co. in 2006
4. Amos In Ohio was based around acoustic guitar, synth keyboards, and lo fi live drums. 
5. followed by Find Love, Let Go EP  in 2007
6. spawned live fan favorite "Get Mad"
7. and acoustic ballad "Lackluster Love" was featured in the indie movie "Cherry" 
8. 2008 started Elephant Lady Records and released Real Blasty
9. featuring the electro pop song "Sushi"
10. KANGAROO EP in 2010 featured the song "You Always Make Me Smile"
11. an infectiously sunny acoustic pop song that became familiar around the world in various TV uses.
12. 2011 saw the release of full length #3, Robot Learn Love
13. Loud electric guitars, deep and dark synth bass, heavily processed "pop" vocals
14. co produced by Chris Grainger
15. 2013 Brighter Than The Sun
16. a consistently "positive" record from front to back
17. co produced by Chris Grainger
18. featured "The Way to Wonder" a whimsical acoustic song
19.the video sent Kyle on an Ipad to space singing the song, it was pretty rad. 

----
JONNY DRAKE (http://jonnydrake.bandcamp.com/)

Jonny returns to the Chicago music scene on the heels of wrapping production of his upcoming "Lovers" LP, after a year on hiatus. Drake's solo group is a seven piece, pulling talent from Jaime Rojo, Magical Beautiful, Brother George, and more. Daniel Villarreal on drums, Jim Drake on organ/guitar, Nick Broste on keys, Neal Neumann on bass, with Ann Marie Meiers and Christine Chung Kenny on backing vocals. Jonny's unique banjo and acoustic focused neo-folk sound recalls that of Roy Orbison, Neil Young, Grandaddy, Kurt Vile, and at times The National. Simple and dark, analog and tape driven, the new material is hypnotic and addictive. 

----
JEFF TAYLOR (http://jefftayloralive.bandcamp.com)

The title track of Jeff Taylor's new EP, 'Organelle,' originally emerged as a dream dialogue. Taylor envisions himself alone in a dark room, left behind by a lost love who haunts his memory. The world around them is melting, all color and stories from their doomed relationship running in anastomotic streams. 

With musical roots in Taylor's Western Pennsylvania writing sessions of the previous January, the song stood out to Bartlett as a candidate for potential recording sessions. 

The tail end of 2013 was spent writing and recording his first solo EP, 'Organelle.' Producer Thomas Bartlett is featured on piano throughout, along with a cadre of local musicians who are also Taylor's dear friends. The release is a limited pressing of 45RPM 10" vinyl, and will be available through the standard digital outlets.

Jeff spent a good part of 2012/2013 touring with Trixie Whitley and Kishi Bashi. He finished out the year with his stage debut as Larry the Dwarf in Frank Zappa’s '200 Motels.' In 'Motels,' Taylor sang with the Los Angeles Philharmonic for the 10th Anniversary Celebration of Disney Concert Hall.

The 'Organelle' EP is out April 1, 2014 on Rockwood Music Hall Recordings. Visit jefftayloralive.bandcamp.com to listen and purchase.
-----
ACE REPORTER (http://yearling.fm/)

A rooftop overlooking Manhattan’s Fifth Avenue. A fleabag motel on the banks of the Susquehanna River. A bus winding through sleepy Chicago suburbs. A book-filled bedroom. A sculpture garden in Washington, D.C. 

These are the memories that inhabit Ace Reporter’s debut LP, Yearling. They are memories from a single year, one that musician Chris Snyder spent writing and recording one new song every day. In 2010, after the breakup of his longtime band The States, Snyder, a songwriter, composer, vocalist, and multi-instrumentalist based in Brooklyn, embarked on what he called the threesixfive project. Each day came with a mandate for the musician to start and finish a new track. From this burgeoning collection of songs, four EPs emerged, which Snyder – who began playing violin at age four and landed his first singing gig as the featured boy soprano on the soundtrack for The Crow – eventually transformed into a full-length album culled from the experiences and inspirations that propelled him through that year. 

Yearling was recorded in a converted barn in upstate New York in the spring of 2011. The idea was to take ten of the best songs from Snyder’s massive collection and imbue them with greater life and augmented instrumentation. “During the threesixfive project, I had two hours every evening to write, record, and mix a new song,” Snyder says. “This meant that I had to give up on premeditation – whatever happened when I sat down to write became the song, period.”

The album has the effect of a kaleidoscope, where Snyder’s poetic lyricism and evocative imagery draw the songs together to create a collection that tells the story of a year, each song refracting a different memory of a time and place.
289364447885229.name: Kyle Andrews / Jonny Drake / Jeff Taylor / Ace Reporter at Martyrs' on Record Store Day - Chicago, IL

ABOUT TIGA
2007 – Present, “Ciao Means Forever”
Sometime in 2007, Tiga achieved Full Online Consciousness. This has given him the ability to speak directly to you through the computer, a miracle you will only now come to fully appreciate:

My Name Is Tiga. Welcome to the Bio-Dome, mec!

As you know, my remix work has slowed considerably as of late. While my versions of tracks by Alter Ego, New Young Pony Club, The Gossip and Human League have only enhanced my reputation as the Sex Whiz of Sonic Parkour, I felt I needed to start hoarding my best ideas for my own music. The remix of Alter Ego’s “Gary”, for instance, forced me to cannibalize much of the work I’d done in my now-legendary sessions with Bobby McFerrin. It was then that I knew that I had to draw the line.

The seeds for ZZT, my ongoing collaboration with Zombie Nation, when we hit it off at the semi-biannual Gigolo High-Earners Galmour Pageant and Hot Meal. After falling out with Gigolo over accusations of cyber-arson, I approached him about working together, possibly on music. I soon came to love his thing-throwing, humor-having ways. Our tracks tend to be “live” in nature, in that we try to only use parts that require four hands at a time. Or 19 fingers and three lips. It depends.

Rainier Werner Bassfinder takes everything great about my work with Jesper Dahlback and takes it to a new level. One that forces me to use a fake name. I chose the moniker “The Dove” for reasons contractual and shame-based. Probably 70/30, contract/shame. Oh, Michael Gothard, I only wanted to do right by you!

Over the past few years, I have continued to tour the globe extensively. I have eaten Club Sandwiches in over 60 countries and done “The Sandwich” in over 600 clubs. I was also brave enough to visit the Middle East, with a harrowing trip to war-ravaged Dubai. I was taken falconing (this is 100 percent true), which was strange enough before I found out that the falcons undergo extensive plastic surgery to look more like celebrities. My falcon, I was told, was supposed to resemble Ethan Hawke. I don’t know who that is.

The past few years have also seen a resurgence at my record label, Turbo. The work done by Thomas Von Party in A&R and Oliver Interactive in International Business Affairs has been invaluable. I can’t express how much I appreciate their efforts in making Turbo the Towerhorse it is today. I would be remiss, however, in not mentioning the real star of the show, our Branding Consultant, Brandon Branding.

Brandon saw ways of expanding our brand in new and exciting directions. He insisted I start participating in community soccer leagues to lend an “everyman” quality to my daunting brilliance. I was skeptical at first, but soon I came to treasure seeing the faces of 50-year-old men in goggles light up as I take the field. I am a defense-minded, vaguely passive-aggressive midfielder, and have trained online with Ghana international Michael Essien.

Mr. Branding also encouraged me to write for the label, birthing a torrid run of press sheets that has sparked in me a love of letters deep and true. Now I write all the time. I even replaced my car’s paneling with dry-erase board, so that I may lean out the driver’s seat window at a moment’s notice to scrawl away at the face of literature.

Today, our reach extends even further, thanks to my venturing into the world of amateur inventing. There’s the Grocery Claw, aimed at those who rightly abhor what I call Market Filth. And, with an eye towards the future of our planet, Solar-Powered Wind.

Most importantly, 2009 will see the release of my new LP, “Ciao!” This album will surely cement my status as a Storytella and Funky Fella. “Ciao!” is the fruit of 15 months of collaborations with such leading lights as Soulwax, Jesper Dahlback, Gonzales, Jori Hulkonnen, Jake Shears and James Murphy. An impressive roster, to say the least. What was that? What do you mean, “What?” That sound you just made! It was like a snort, a dismissive snort. have you worked with, then, genius? Sting Jr.? That weirdo form Simply Red? Lady Sting? I am not impressed in the least.

All in all, at the end of the day, I can’t help but gaze into the reflecting pool and think to myself, “I guess I really turned the night on, huh?”

1976 – 2003, “The Creation Myth”
“The citizen may take a bride, but it is the rifleman who takes a lover. Ultimately we all must choose either the myth or the mountain.”

The origins of Montreal born DJ-producer-incipient Teutonic legend Tiga lie to the vague and troubling East, where he was weaned on the nefarious milk of the notorious 1980s Indian club scene.“To the unforgiving eye,” he says of the sybaritic night-kingdom,“a world of filth and decadence is revealed. For example, I’m fairly certain that more than a few club owners had an unsavory arrangement with the man who brought the folding chairs. I was at once appalled and enraptured. After that, I had no choice in the matter.”

By 1990, Tiga had returned to Montreal, prodigiously nightwise and unsatisfied with the existing local club scene (calling it “the plumage of a bird I cannot bring myself to want.”) With the help of a core group of friends, he began to throw a series of small parties infused with the sense of dead-eyed ennui gleaned from a past littered with acid whores and crazed Indian gamblers. Other innovations which Tiga introduced to Montreal party culture include guest DJs, intense street promotions featuring rival gangs of street acrobats, color flyers, multi-dj sets, and leading the supplicant crowd through the innermost corridors of one’s soul.

It was this heady time of dizzying innovation and ravenous sexual ambition, which culminated in the birth of 1993’s “Solstice,” generally, considered to be Montreal’s first genuine rave. (A year earlier, a hyper-prescient Tiga staged “Eclectricity,” the first online rave, a project whose utter failure remains a source of bafflement: “It broke my heart, given my views on diversity . . . I am, I feel, a very interactive person.”) Tiga has since helped to orchestrate no less than ten major events, including “The Orb Live,” “Pure,” and the very first North American appearance of continental illusionist Jean-There.

In 1994, Tiga bought DNA Records, a small medical data concern, and parlayed it into Montreal’s premiere electronic music boutique. “We’ve always believed in putting the customer first, from helping you find that one minimal house record that will make your collection to offering concerned looks as you wade through the enormous backlog of test results to discover if you are in fact afflicted with a congenital disease.”

In 1996, Tiga privately sang about the death of actor and poet Tupac Shakur.
That same year, the Montreal dance community found a haven for the boldest feats of dance, where fools are in love with mystery and sex-valor is prized above all else. Sona (meaning literally ‘Liar-dancer’) was initially conceived of by Tiga and his two partners as “a perverse, jeering monolith, because nothing is sacred anymore” but it has evolved into much more. In addition to its place among the pantheon of urban groove centers, on weekdays it rents out its facilities, at a very reasonable rate, to a local program dedicated to teaching homeless men to dance properly (“I just think it’s an important project,” Tiga said at the time).

In 1998, Tiga started Turbo Recordings as an outlet for his wildman organ escapades but he soon found a host of other artists who were willing to be paid to record for him. Turbo has released over 20 albums, 2 samplers, and 12 vinyl twelve inches as well as secured global distribution with Prime, Intergroove and Caroline. Notable releases include Peter Benisch’s “Soundtrack Saga,” Christopher Handlebar’s “To a Time of Asia” and Tiga’s own “Mixed Emotions” and “American Gigolo”

By 2001, however, overwork and media saturation began to show their strain, as evidenced by Tiga’s hysterical outburst at a fashion photographer during a promo shoot:

“I’ll sit for your venal cigarette pictures, but I will not indulge you in your game of ‘Eyes! Lies! Surprise!’ I dare you, coward—call out your cloakmen! What are you waiting for? The truth?!”

Following a month spent riding horses and caring for his voice, Tiga entered the studio with producer Zyntherius “Jori” Hulkonnen and a singular vision: “electro, but mainly about my eyes.” The result, a searing rendition of his former Mother Mio bandmate Corey Hart’s solo smash “Sunglasses at Night,” challenged dancers and seduced critics alike, yet Tiga is coy when asked about its impact, particularly in Germany: “’Sunglasses’ is a sinless child, a gleaming medallion. But is also a trick, a trick of memory. You must understand – on a whim, we revealed the hidden fire of Europe.”

But fires need tending and lumber. And so the onslaught of Tiga-powered releases was fated to continue. They are his craft, his life, his living craft-fire.

“We live in the Age of Cruelty and every day I struggle to find my place in it. All I know I can offer the world is a thousand more adventures through dancing and light.”

2003 – 2006, “Get on Top of the Fire”
If “Sunglasses at Night” marked Tiga’s coronation as the steely Wolf-King of Dance Mountain, then his subsequent remixes for the likes of Martini Bros., Alpinestars, Linda Lamb, Crossover, FC Kahuna, Cabaret Voltaire, Telepopmusik, Felix da Housecat, Fischerspooner, FPU, The Devils (Nick Rhodes), and Danni Minogue birthed his dewy-eyed heir, Darian. Says Tiga, “I have also produced remixes for City Rockers, and singles for Turbo Recordings, Intec, Drumcode, and Electrix with Mateo Murphy under the name TGV. I am also the hidden hero of the ongoing NHL lockout. I will break the players’ will – you have my solemn word.”

In 2003, Tiga took his conqueror’s tools to the streets, with a heralded mix CD for !K7’s DJ Kicks series, and an ethereal reading of Nelly’s “Hot in Herre,” which became a stalwart success and was subsequently licensed in the UK by Skint (in the UK) and Warner Music (the GAS region). The video, which can be seen at http://www.eyeballnyc.com/tiga, is a revelation of neo-urban dazzle-do, courtesy of the puppet wizardry of Tiga’s brother, the Lord of the Marionette (www.lordofthemarionette.com).

Tiga was also gracious enough to lend his wind-shattering vocals to Richard X’s “You (Better Let Me Love YouX4) Tonight,” as well as “Heartbreak/Ananda,” by Beyer & Lenk (Adam Beyer and Jesper Dahlback), and Rik Stamina’s “Dancing Inside You.” His remix work on Alex Kidd’s “Come With Me”, Neon Judgement’s “TV Treated,” Scissor Sisters’ cover of Pink Floyd’s “Comfortably Numb,” “Da Hype,” by Junior Jack and Robert Smith, and Peaches’ “Shake Yer Dix,” and Soulwax’s “E Talking” comprises a merciless Crimson Romance, lapping at the shores of eternity.

Tiga’s smash single “Pleasure From The Bass”, a two-fisted jackal that drew a line in the dancefloor sand, was released in 2004 on the Belgian imprint PIAS.

2005 saw remixes for Depeche Mode, The Vests, Moby, LCD Soundsystem, Mylo, Phillipe Zdar, Chelonius Jones, Drama Society, Thomas Andersson and countless others. In October, Tiga womanized the world with “You Gonna Want Me”, his toothsome duet with Jake Shears (of Scissor Sisters’ fame), “Once again, I proved you can’t spell ‘sword’ without ‘words’” says the dance-freckled Disco Jockler.

2006 began with the release of Tiga’s debut album Sexor, which sounded the clarion call of an emergent Nation-Man. “It is an exhilarating time – the woes and the whoas, the thrills and the throes! Like Icarus, I have flown dangerously close to the fun, on a dare to wear my overalls undone.”
Tiga then embarked on the “Sexor over Europe” and “Sexor over Canada” tours in a manner befitting The Most Compassionate Man Alive. “Soon I will position Sexor over America and Sexor over Japan, forcing rapt smiles onto the faces of the discovantaged, those fey, oblivious costumers’ sons…”, he said.

That same year, Tiga made you go “Tig-unnggghh!” with the video for the single, “(Far From) Home.” Shot in Tokyo, the clip follows Tiga on a soul-laughening journey down a street of some sort. The video was helmed by Nagi Noda, the accalimed Japanese director of the groundbreaking music video for Yuki’s “Sentimental Journey”, a short film, Ex Fat Girl, which features exercising poodles, and projects for Nike and Laforet, for which she has won a host of prizes in Japan, not the least of which being Tiga’s coveted “Admiration-in-Japan” Medal.

Meanwhile, the “(Far From) Home” single left mankind fitted for underjeans, provocatively asking listeners “Are you a DoJ or a Don’tJ?” The release included remix work by the DFA, Digitalism, and Chicken Lips, showcasing Tiga’s incredibly exotic voice in new sonic locales, as well as a remix by Tiga himself, “The Speed of Sexor Reprise.” A well-meaning dub edit by Jon Aerosmith & Eduardo B. Rich was politely declined.

Tiga’s reign of wonder continued to not stop, as he dutifully drew up the dance contracts for tracks by Coldcut and Pet Shop Boys. “As both a student – and a significant part – of history, I feel it would be a betrayal of my stewardship to ever remix music in anger. It is not the Way of the Musician, nor is it the Musician’s Way.”


ABOUT GREEN VELVET
Change has been a constant theme throughout the successful career of Green Velvet, but as he has crossed genres, explored themes from the comedic to the serious and changed monikers, the common thread running through the music he has made for nearly two decades is its roots in and dedication to the Chicago House sound.

His first transformation came when he left master’s degree studies in chemical engineering at UC-Berkeley to turn a hobby into a career making music, influenced by the sounds he had been exposed to as a science-fiction-loving, video-game-playing kid whose father was a part-time Chicago DJ.

As Cajmere, he released his inaugural Underground Goodies EP in 1991 on his Cajual label, keeping true to the early House sound. He quickly followed it up the next year with the smash hit “Coffeepot (It’s Time for the Percolator).”

Not one to rest on his success, he soon changed things up, teaming with vocalist Dajae for “Brighter Days,” a more mellow House tune, this one released by Emotive. That pairing would be his last with a female vocalist until his recent partnership with rapper Kid Sister for “Everybody Wants.”

The 17 years in between those two projects witnessed an incredible array of electronic music emanating from this prolific artist, as well as a second label under his direction, Relief. Adopting the persona Green Velvet (not to mention a Day-Glo shock wig) for his techno-oriented pieces and DJ appearances, he became the champion of new wave Chicago beats through the ’90s-known best for hits such as “Preacher Man,” “Flash” (a No. 1 U.S. dance hit in 1995), and 1997′s laugh-inducing “Answering Machine.” The decade ended with his first album, Constant Chaos in 1999.

The new century brought a compilation album, Green Velvet, during a brief signing with Warner Bros. Records’ short-lived F-111 imprint, and a production album, Whatever, on Relief. The punk-inspired Whatever explored darker themes than his previous work, including racism (“When?”), drug use (“Genedefekt” and “La La Land”), alienation (“Sleepwalking”) and bending to authority (“Gat”).

“La La Land” went on to become by far the biggest selling track of his career. His live act expanded as he began playing a keytar, with two other musicians-Nazuk and Spaceboy-backing him, playing heavily distorted synths.

The last decade also saw Green Velvet become a fan favorite across Europe, playing to huge crowds at festivals in addition to live radio appearances and club gigs. Numerous side projects and remixes under various names also added to his seemingly nonstop musical output.
In 2005, Green Velvet released his third album, Walk In Love, which stayed true to the House sound, with a few pop- and punk-oriented tracks for good measure, including “Come Back” and “Pin-Up Girl,” both of which featured a live guitarist.

The ongoing evolution in the music, career and life of the artist born Curtis Alan Jones in Chicago has been and will continue to be fascinating to watch and experience for his many followers.

Over the past seven year’s Green Velvet has released some of his most beloved anthems, including “Shake and Pop”, “Everybody Wants”, “Milli Vanilli”. Riding the wave of critical acclaim and success, Green Velvet has been touring the globe stopping at some of the most respected clubs and festivals along way.

In addition to his solo work, he has been collaborating with some of underground dance music’s most respected and popular producers, including Maceo Plex, Jamie Jones, Danny Tenaglia, Pleasurekraft, Phil Kieran, Carl Craig, Derrick Carter, Crookers and DJ Sneak.
292016767621481.name: STUDIO 4/4: TIGA (Turbo Recordings, Montreal) & GREEN VELVET (Relief Records, Chicago)

292093297620195.description:
The Chicago Mustangs will Host Mustang Dancer auditions to make up the 2014-2015 Team. All dancers Interested in becoming part of the Chicago Mustang Dancers, we are looking for smart, talented, beautiful women, with charisma and high energy, to unite as a team and deliver a high power performance for The Chicago Mustang Home Games! We invite you to discover what it takes to become part of the Chicago Mustang Dancers! **For Audition application and more info please email chimustangdance@yahoo.com**
****************************************************************
—The Chicago Mustangs will be searching for new dancers to join The Chicago Mustang Dance Team. The Chicago Mustang Dancers are now accepting applications for the 2014-2015 season, applications will be completed upon arrival. Auditions for Mustang Dancers will be held on Sunday April 27th, 2014 from 1pm to 4pm at Xsport Fitness Gym in Lyons, IL. Once selected, the dancers will be scheduled to perform at all Chicago Mustang Football Home games and other promotional events.
WHEN: April 27th 2014, 1pm-4pm (early arrival is encouraged, be prepared to stay longer than 4pm if need be, please plan accordingly)
AUDITION FEE: There is an audition fee of $25 for new dancers, and $20 for veteran dancers, please follow the link to pay: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/chicago-mustang-dancers-auditions-2014-2015-tickets-11332990279
WHERE: Auditions will be at Xsport Fitness Gym 3940 S. Harlem Avenue Lyons, IL 60534
ATTIRE: ***FULL PERFORMANCE HAIR AND MAKE-UP*** NO big earrings (stud earrings are encouraged) **figure must be visible** Half-top/crop top (any style and color), Short Shorts/Dance Briefs (any style, any color), Dance (jazz) shoes/Dance sneakers, sheer to waist panty hose (any brand), NO Slacks, Leggings, Capri’s, Tank Tops, or Cover-ups, NO excessive jewelry.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Dance Ability, Personal Appearance, Energy, Showmanship, Poise, Enthusiasm, Figure, and Personality.
WHAT TO BRING: Bring cash if needed for audition fee/drinks/snack purchase, Bring Cover ups to keep warm while you wait to audition, bring water/snacks for breaks, sweat towel, extra sheer panty hose (in case of a tear), extra make-up/hair tools for touch ups, any other personal items needed for the day.
WHAT TO EXPECT: We will begin by leading a Warm-up followed by stretching segment and additional individual stretching time will be allotted. Next, Across the Floor/ technique segment will be taught. A Signature Mustangs Sideline will be taught followed by a Signature Mustangs Half Time routine. Auditions will promptly follow. If asked upon please be prepared to answer personality questions during the audition process. 
for additional questions regarding auditions please email: chimustangdance@yahoo.com

295433240619100.description:
We are incredibly excited to be hosting the Chicago Premiere of the wonderful Italian atmospheric horror film ACROSS THE RIVER with our friends over at Chicago Filmmakers. This screening will be on June 7th at 8pm. View the trailer here:

http://youtu.be/4RTNz6pNtcg

 For more information, here is the synopsis:

“A wildlife biologist has set up a variety of trophy cameras along a path in the remote Italian mountains. Living alone in a cabin, he collects data daily, reviewing footage, studying animal behaviour and their tracks, on the hunt for ever-elusive wild beasts. Occasionally, strange items appear, such as a beautiful piece of cloth flowing down the river, from what appears to have been a dress. One day, he takes his camper further down the road and ventures past the river, which traps him unknowingly on its opposite shore. Wandering deeper and deeper within the forest, an abandoned village catches his attention, and what he discovers within its walls, lurking at night, unseen, is far more unnerving than he could have imagined. The darkness engulfs him. Meanwhile, an old man watches over it all, guardian of a terrible secret.”

One of the most downright efficient, atmospheric horror film of 2013 and a chilling discovery from Italy, ACROSS THE RIVER prioritizes a slow-building, intense crescendo approach to its atmosphere of disorientation and dread, forsaking cheap scares for the sake of terrific sound design, carefully placed shadows and rustling leaves. Thrusting you deeper and deeper into the clutches of his dark, otherworldly woods, director Lorenzo Bianchini offers an almost dialogue-less hybrid of THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT (without it being subjective found footage) and INTO THE WILD, pulling you into the supernatural wilderness one discovery at a time, insidiously even, until you are, like his protagonist, completely trapped and at the mercy of what lies within. The unique infrared wildlife footage peppered throughout takes on a vividly evocative quality, as uncanny images of the wilderness are produced, forcing you to wonder as to what is really there. A classical horror tale spun from the interstices of man and his digital technologies as confronted with the (super)natural world of yore, ACROSS THE RIVER is a brilliant opposition of new and old narratives, building towards a downright terrifying finale. Wander, wonder and dare cross the river, you will be glad you did. (Thanks to Ariel Esteban Cayer of Fantasia and Pop Montreal for the write up!)

This is the first time that this film has been screened in America! Do not miss this wonderful Italian horror film. Here is all of the info:

ACROSS THE RIVER
Location: Chicago Filmmakers
5243 N Clark St. 60640
Date: Saturday, June 7th
Time: 8:00pm
Ticket price: $7.00 at door

Looking forward to seeing you all there!
295433240619100.name: ACROSS THE RIVER (Chicago premiere) hosted by The Chicago Cinema Society at Chicago Filmmakers.

297840200363664.description:
$5,  free for festival attendees. cash bar

Chances Dances 
http://www.chancesdances.org/ 

Chances dances is a queer dance party and collective dedicated to building safer spaces in Chicago since 2005.


Kodak, 2013
Dan Paz

work in progress

One iteration in an ongoing body of work, Kodak, 2013 that is transported to Chances Dances. For Kodak, 2013, I film contemporary queers and queers of color as they work through poses and gestures that, to them, articulate the ideals of their own identity expressions. As they put their bodies on the line, they intervene on the utopic (and often impossible) ideals of who is fit to be filmed proposed by Kodak’s 1922 tests.
 
Sponsored by Lagunitas and Dark Horse Wines

300217893460629.description:
Celebrate Jazz dance in Chicago with Inaside Chicago Dance’s weekend of explosively entertaining music and movement.  In honor of its 10th season of integrity, passion, and pride, Inaside will present new dance works and repertory favorites at the Athenaeum Theatre April 25th and 26th at 8pm.  

New works premiering will include "Six Stevies", a spirited piece by Preston Miller featuring the vivid music of Stevie Wonder and" My Side" by Kirsten Harvey, Inaside’s 2014 Choreographic Sponsor.  An exploration of the complex relationships that exist between siblings, relatives, and loved ones, "My Side" It is a lighthearted-look at the connections that in one moment are represented by loving gestures and the next in loathing glares.  The program will also feature a new duet by company member, Sarah Ford. 

Inaside will also highlight works previously created for the company including Autumn Eckman’s playful take on “boy meets girl” in "A Lot Like Love" and the critically acclaimed "Mink, Jazz, and Swing: Dancing to the Music of Miss Peggy Lee" by Harrison McEldowney and Tony Savino.  Please join us in celebrating the monumental significance Inaside has had on jazz dance in the Chicago Community. 

Tickets for the performances are $30 for adults and $20 for students, seniors and dancers. Following the Saturday performance there will be a special 2 hour anniversary reception at the Diag Bar and Grill. Mix and mingle with the artistic minds behind Inaside Chicago Dance while noshing appetizers and sipping beverages.  The performance will be located at 2936 N Southport Ave.  Reception will be located at 2856 N Southport. Tickets may be purchased online at www.athenaeumtheatre.org or by calling 773.935.6875.
300217893460629.name: Inaside Chicago Dance 10th Anniversary Spring Concert

300941750058610.description:
Join special guests Taryn Power-Greendeer, her daughter Valentina Sales, and theatre producer Michael Butler as we honor the 100th anniversary of screen legend Tyrone Power's birth (May 5, 1914). Power's daughter and godson will introduce the films and discuss the life and career of Tyrone during the intermission.

This is the first of many tributes planned around the country. The Pickwick Theatre will also be selling limited edition copies of Romina Power's memoir, "Searching For My Father, Tyrone Power." This will be the American debut (of a book previously published in Italian). This edition will only be available at centennial events.

Organist Jay Warren of The Silent Film Society of Chicago will be performing prelude music between 6:30-7 PM.

Please visit www.parkridgeclassicfilm.com for updates on the Tyrone Power Centennial Event.

Admission is $7 ($5 for seniors 60+)

ATTENTION MIDWEST GREEKS!!!!

THE 2014 CHICAGO GREEK WEEKEND COMMITTEE BRINGS YOU….

THE CHICAGO - ATLANTA GREEK PICNIC PARTY BUS | THURS JUNE 4-SUNDAY JUNE 8

http://chigreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/
http://chigreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/
http://chigreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/
 
Visit http://AtlantaGreekPicnic.com for AGP Details and http://chicagogreekbustrip.eventbrite.com/ to reserve your seat on the CGW bus!
 
On behalf of the Chicago Greek Weekend Committee I cordially invite you to take part in Chicago Atlanta Greek Picnic Invasion. Wednesday Night June 4th our coach bus will depart Chicago enroute to this year’s 2014 Atlanta Greek Picnic. This will be a weekend packed with festivities, parties, the Atlanta Greek Picnic, fellowship, and much more.
This year we are doing it bigger and better as seats fill up rather quickly and we expect even more participation this year. We have coordinated with the chair of the AGP to ensure that the trip will be a special time for all who are fortunate enough to join us.
 
Financial Obligations:
• $175 for bus travel (All persons will be picked up at one location in
Chicago on Chicago St. University’s Campus or a college campus
depending on your geographic location and returned there Sunday
evening)
• $109 for hotel stay for 3 days (rate quoted at 4 per bedroom. This rate will be smaller if you plan to have more than 3 in a room per night) All persons are responsible for booking their own hotels and can do so  here. Call 404-521-0000 to speak to a representative from the Atlanta Marriott Marquis Host Hotel.
• In order to reserve your seat a $75 deposit is due.  We sell ever year so be sure to put your deposit down before the bus fills up. 
We will likely have 2 buses this year if the demand is there. 
 
Benefits:
• In addition to the clear economic advantage of paying  about $250 for travel and hotel (which you will book on your own)
The bus will take us to and pick us from all events and will make any stops that the group would like to make as a whole
Departure/Pick Up Times and Locations:
We will be departing from Chicago, IL June 4 at approximately 10PM
from the Campus of Chicago State University (9501 S. King Dr) and be
arriving back to Chicago on June 8, 2014 in the evening. We will be able to
stop in Central Illinois and Southern Illinois to accommodate riders who are
on campus and details for those pickup locations are forthcoming.
 
Email ChiGreekWeekend@gmail.com for more details

Have questions about Chicago Greek Weekend Atlanta Greek Picnic Bus Trip 2014? 

Contact CHiCAGO GREEK WEEKEND

Incorrect Music & Paradigm Underground Present

THE INCORRECT MUSIC LOFT PARTY
featuring 

ANTHONY ATTALLA
COCODRILLS
w/ special guest Dustin Sheridan 

Saturday, April 5th 
Location TBA ~ Chicago, IL
Doors at 12 midnight

Advance tickets highly recommended, space is limited:
www.wantickets.com/incorrectchicagoLOFT

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Incorrect Music frontman Anthony Attalla teams up with the Paradigm crew to bring the sound back underground, featuring 7+ hours of proper house showcased in an off-site loft space.  Along with Attalla, Space Miami residents Cocodrills will be flying up from South Beach to make a special appearance in the Windy City.  Opening the night is Chicago favorite and Spybar resident, Dustin Sheridan.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

ANTHONY ATTALLA
Incorrect Music // Chicago, IL

As we enter 2014, Anthony Attalla has firmly established himself as a rising star in the electronic music community.  His personal growth in the studio as a producer and on stage as a performer has the industries biggest taste makers, as well as its biggest publications, proclaiming that Anthony is set to break out in the coming year.  Never resting on his laurels, Anthony has also demonstrated his passion for the business side of the industry by creating a platform to showcase his favorite talent through Incorrect Music, his music production-company, which has proven to be a most successful endeavor.  

As an artist, Anthony has charted over 50 Top 100 tracks on Beatport.com, the widely popular outlet for purchasing Dance Music.  With popular labels such as Sony, Atlantic, Warner Bros, Ultra, and Toolroom seeking his productions as well as underground heavyweights Suara, Great Stuff, 1605, Trapez, Tronic, Break New Soil, MBF, and Stereo Recordings, Attalla has become a wanted man.  In addition, the demand for his live performance has grown to an all-time high with continuous touring throughout the United States, as well as international bookings in Europe, Ibiza, Mexico & Latin America, Asia, the Middle East and Canada.  Furthermore, Anthony made his mark this summer on the White Isle (Ibiza, Spain) as he was asked to support Axwell and Sebastian Ingrosso on their newly formed 'Departures' project.  The residency at the uber exclusive Ushuaia Hotel & Pool showcased the world's most in-demand talent and is arguably Ibiza's hottest ticket.

Now surpassing its three-year anniversary, Incorrect Music has experienced success at an alarming pace.  The label’s achievements include having tracks played and charted by some of the industries’ most credible artists, boasting over 70 Top 100 tracks on various Beatport Charts, and spreading its wings globally with artists from more than 20 different countries making up its impressive roster.

With Anthony’s multi-faceted approach to an increasingly demanding industry, he illustrates his ability to evolve and achieve as he continues to make his meteoric rise in international dance scene.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

COCODRILLS
Incorrect Music // Miami, FL

Where they're from or how they grew up is entirely irrelevant. When they started off and what their influences were are inconsequential. Listing the popular venues they've played or name dropping artist that support them would be disingenuous. This is because a short anecdotal paragraph loaded with DJ/producer cliches wouldn't do their style, or their sound, any justice. The Cocodrills (Christian "Pridef" Diaz, Adam Cruz) pride themselves on creating a unique musical experience, which can only be just that; experienced. But make sure to leave your pretense at the door 'cause you won't find any bullshit at one of their parties; only funky grooves, positive vibes and rampant debauchery. And while they don't claim to have reinvented the wheel, they do like to take that wheel down the road of sound for a ride so wild it wakes up the next morning with no tread smelling of burnt rubber and a wondrous sense of "let's do that again!". Act accordingly.

420011958120612.description:
Excision 2014 tour dates announced and the return of The Executioner.

Get tickets for Chicago @ http://smarturl.it/XApr18Tickets

There is truly no sleep for the wicked, as Canadian Dubstep pioneer Excision announces his massive 2014 Tour. Starting this January Excision will hit the road only weeks after wrapping the final string of Destroid live shows for 2013. 

Embracing an unyielding pursuit to push the boundaries of bass music, Excision is continually creating and re-imagining innovative uses of cutting edge technology to impact his fans, as well as the EDM community at large. This 2014 Tour will prove to be his most extensive and most immersive tour experience to date. With an already phenomenal level of production at his disposal, you better believe he has gone even further. He is stepping things up to a whole new level and bringing a monstrous 150,000 watts of sound, which is capable of delivering insanely loud yet crystal clear audio to blast dance floors with room shaking bass in a way that bass music is ultimately designed to be felt as well as heard.

The 2014 tour also marks the return of the 28 foot wide, 15 foot tall mammoth video and lighting installation known as The Executioner. This custom crafted stage production was specifically designed for Excisions 3D video mapped visual sequences as he DJ's both music and video live on stage. The Executioner is fully recharged and returning as Excision’s on-stage bass bunker, complete with brand new 3D visual animations displayed across its 420 square feet of surface area. This technological audio video monstrosity is equipped with various sliding panels and pneumatics to hide lazers, fog machines, an extensively upgraded lighting system and more than a few surprises yet to be revealed.


Dirtyphonics
-
Dirtyphonics, the fabulous french DJ team joins with Excision for his 2014 tour. Bringing their signature style of genre bending madness from DNB, Electro House and everything in between, don't miss a second of their electrifying sets as they set the world on fire!




Ill.Gates 
-
Ill.Gates is a Toronto-based composer, performer and educator. Over the past 16 years, he has established a global fanbase and a reputation as one of the most dynamic electronic music artists around. He regularly tours across North America, Europe, Australia and Asia. Gates has headlined at such festivals as Burning Man, Shambala, the World Electronic Music Festival and the New Orleans Jazz Festival. His first full-length release, Autopirate (Muti Music, 2008) charted and continues to sell strongly. His upcoming triple album The ill.Methodology and accompanying online course are highly anticipated. Gates was recently selected as one of the Next 100 by URB Magazine.

Many of his contemporaries cite ill.Gates as a key artistic influence and inspiration in their music. While on tour, Gates frequently teaches workshops to grateful and attentive audiences, in which he shares his highly effective approach to producing quality finished music as well as insights into the mentality and strategies necessary to succeed in the music business.
420011958120612.name: Excision in Chicago @ Aragon Ballroom

Marbin is an instrumental rock band based in Chicago, Illinois.

Marbin first started in 2007 as an improvised music duo consisting of Israeli guitarist Dani Rabin and Israeli saxophonist Danny Markovitch Slor.[1] Markovitch and Rabin met shortly after Markovitch Slor had completed his military service as an infantry sergeant and Rabin had graduated from Berklee College of Music.[2][3] Since 2008, Marbin has been living in Chicago and performing all over the United States, playing over 300 shows a year with the accompaniment of drummer Justyn Lawrence and Bassist Jae Gentile, making Marbin one of the busiest bands in the states. They have released four albums: Impressions of a City (2009) as part of Paul Wertico's Mideast-Midwest Alliance, and three under the name Marbin,[4] Marbin (2009) as a duo, Breaking the Cycle (2011) with drummer Paul Wertico (Pat Metheny Group), bassist Steve Rodby (Pat Metheny Group), and Jamey Haddad (Paul Simon), and Last Chapter of Dreaming (2013) with its touring band and an array of thirteen guests. Marbin is currently signed to Moonjune Records and Management.

424068137726096.description:
The Flow Show 2014
Flow Arts Showcase Coming to Chicago

Save the Dates:
March 28th - 30th

Doors at 7:00pm Show at 8:00pm

TICKETS ON SALE NOW!!

https://www.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=d25c8ce4fff893d6f877681a9be29cc6

We proudly announce that the Flow Show, a showcase of some of the country's best talent in the flow arts, will be coming to Chicago in 2014! Chicago is honored to be the third city selected for this intimate celebration of movement and community. As proved in other cities, this two night spectacle of object manipulation and technical dance composition is certain to leave a memorable impression on the Windy City.

Flow Show Chicago will take place at Studio 773, a recently renovated theatre with black box elegance of draped curtains and modern architecture. The venue is located one mile west of Lake Michigan and is conveniently nestled within unique dining and shopping experiences. 

The Flow Show anticipates a delightful evening. Since it's birth in San Francisco, 2009, the Flow Show has been met with consistently sold out performances and rave reviews, providing audiences with inspiration and excitement for a growing art form. 

Flow arts communities across the country, from San Francisco to Brooklyn, New York are teaming with creativity and talent, each with their own unique local flair. The Midwest, too, is home to a thriving community of object manipulation enthusiasts and performers. It is only natural that Flow Show Chicago 2014 is born. With only 150 seats available at Studio 773, Chicago anticipates a full house.

www.theflowshow.org

TICKETS ON SALE NOW!!
https://www.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=d25c8ce4fff893d6f877681a9be29cc6

441956489240062.description:
Hi friends!

I'm writing to invite you to the annual Casino Night fundraiser I've helped coordinate to benefit the Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago Peer Alliance, a board formed in 2013 that I serve as co-President. 

Peer Alliance is a city-based program in Chicago, and we are dedicated to providing support for adults ages 18-35 affected by epilepsy. Our free programs create a safe community for individuals to come together as they enter new challenges of adulthood with epilepsy. Our mission is simple: no one should stand alone.

Having struggled with epilepsy since the age of 7, I look back and wish there had been times in my rocky journey in which I could've related to someone going through a similar experience. This is why we are here and have created something lacking in the Chicago community. I am proud to be a part of this effort. 

Here is the link to purchase tickets or donate to the event. We do have an early bird ticket price that ends today so grab 'em now!! 

http://epilepsychicago.donordrive.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=donorDrive.event&eventID=554 

The early bird ticket price of $75 ($85 regular beginning March 13) includes heavy appetizers, beer, wine and a signature cocktail, dancing, DJ, "fake" gambling money and some awesome raffles to bid on. Come dressed in cocktail attire, ready for a red carpet photo opp! 

If you have questions, msg me or email at msultemeier@epilepsychicago.org 

Thank you for your support. 

Love,
Maria
441956489240062.name: Casino Night - Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago!

445295155616526.description:
Onsdagen den 16:e april spelar Hornsgatan Ramblers på Chicago swing dance studio. Hornsgatan Ramblers, (tidigare Handsome Fred and his Tall Kings of Tempo)  bildades för snart 5 år sedan och det av unga swing entusiaster som hade lindy hop-dans som sitt största intresse. Faktum är att alla bandets medlemmar träffades, mer eller mindre, nere på Chicago swing dance studios dansgolv. Vissa av dem hade då inte ens rört ett instrument och det faktum att de nu för tiden turnerar runt bland Europas största swingfestivaler verkade då ganska osannolikt. Detta band har själ och hjärta i dansant swingmusik. Med en blandad repertoar av tolkningar av kända såväl som okända swinglåtar från legender som Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Jimmie Lunceford, Louis Jordan med många fler så vågar vi lova en hårt svängande kväll.

Varmt välkomna!
MVH
CHICAGO swing dance studio
Hornsgatan 75
www.chicago75.se

Chicago Singles Club offers us a glimpse into what the future of the music industry should look like. This ambitious collective is an online record label that produces an original recording of two songs, a video interview, and a photoshoot every month with a different independent Chicago band, then given away for free.

This specially curated evening will feature the dream pop of Panda Riot, the spacey synth sounds of Sexy Fights and the avant rock of Moritat.

The Fine Arts faculty and Portfolio Center at Columbia College are proud to present the third annual Fine Arts Open Studios, featuring afternoon critiques and a festive studio open house designed to showcase the studio practices and working methodologies of our Senior BFA students. Guests are invited to provide feedback on work-in-progress that will culminate in a thesis exhibition later this Spring, and enjoy fellowship with students, faculty, and alumni in our vibrant studio complex.

Participating artists include: Sarah Colbert, Kiana Englehaupt, Traci Fowler, Jesus Hernandez, Lauren Nicole Iacoponi, Alexandra Maistros, Max Schif, Jeremy William Steffen, Brandon Studer, Cristabel Tapia, Diana Zabielaite, Monica Pizano, Marija Ratkeviciute, Trevor Schmutz, and Donna Skonning. 

This event is part of Industry Events 2014, Columbia's annual showcase series introducing emerging talent to professional creative communities. See the full schedule at colum.edu/industryevents, running now through May 15.

Justin Randel, le multi-instrumentiste connu sous le surnom de I Love You, crée une musique envoûtante sur des équipements midi.

I LOVE YOU, est une association de musique libre de genre, tout en conservant une sonorité unique d'album en album depuis 2009.

Bien que les albums varient en style, les performances en direct présentent un remix transparent qui commande le public à la piste de danse.

488591677935399.description:
Charlie's Chicago invites you to join us for a 3-part series of beginning level "West-Coast Swing" dance lessons! 

We are thrilled to have Charlie's regular Herb Moore as our guest instructor for this series of lessons. West-Coast Swing is a partner dance that is very popular around the world. 

The first session will be on Friday, April 11, 2014.  During the first lesson, we will start with the very basics and make sure you feel comfortable with these basic moves.  Additional sessions will be on 4/18 and 4/25 where we will introduce a few turn sequences and “moves to impress your friends.” 

As always, the lessons are free....and will begin at approximately 9:30pm each Friday. A partner is not required (we have plenty of dancers), so please plan to join us!
488591677935399.name: Charlie's Chicago Presents Introduction to West-Coast Swing Dance Lessons! - Session 1

Then please come out and support myself and my family in our pursuit to open The Arizona K9 Center in Chandler. The planning and zoning hearing is on the 16th of this month and we need all the support we can get. Only Chandler residents are able to speak at the hearing. But a showing of support speaks volumes in our favor. We need a positive vote so that we are able to move on to the City Counsel hearing May 8th.

If you are unable to make it to the hearing please "Like" our FB page and help spread the word by "Sharing" this invite and the FB page with your friends.   -Thank you!

Purdue's Boilermaker Soccer Complex will serve as the site of an April 1 exhibition game between the Indy Eleven and the Chicago Fire. Indy Eleven is gearing up for its inaugural season of play in the North American Soccer League.

Tickets for the exhibition are currently available at IndyEleven.com and cost $15 for Preferred Seating and $11 for Standard Seating/General Admission/Supporters Sections (plus fees). Please note that online ticket sales will end on March 31 at 11:59 p.m. ET. Fans that choose the e-ticket option of delivery should receive the e-ticket in their inbox on Monday, March 24.

Separate sections at the Boilermaker Soccer Complex will be made available for members of the two clubs' respective independent supporters groups -- the Brickyard Battalion & Section 8 Chicago.

http://www.purduesports.com/sports/w-soccer/spec-rel/031214aaa.html
508092082634759.name: Indy Eleven vs. Chicago Fire at Boilermaker Soccer Complex

508124512604846.description:
This documentary tells the story of Judi Bari, Daryl Cherney and others that were working to prevent logging of old growth forests by organizing with loggers and by using non-violent direct action. 

The documentary explores and the mystery behind the bombing of her car with both she and fellow Earth Firster, Daryl Cherney inside. 

This documentary will be followed by a discussion of themes and topics covered in the film  including government/state repression of activist organizations and what we can learn from the struggles of activists who have come before before us.

It would be great if you could bring a few dollars to give to support the organizations hosting the event. 

Rising Tide Chicago. Chicago IWW, Multi Kulti

http://www.whobombedjudibari.com/
http://risingtidenorthamerica.org
http://chicagoiww.org/
508124512604846.name: Who Bombed Judi Bari?--Future Chicago Events TBA

☆★☆ LINE UP ☆★☆

MC'd by Sutton Kidkandi!!!

Skyler Shores
https://www.facebook.com/officialskylershores
https://soundcloud.com/skylershores

Born and raised in California, Skyler Shores was heavily influenced by the Southern California EDM scene. Shores drops everything from electro house, to moombahton, to trap, to dubstep and more. He has played at the same events as Skrillex, Dillion Francis, Alvin Risk, Digitalism to Jack Beats and has upcoming bookings along with Adventure Club, Zomboy and Candyland. He has played in four different states along with venues including The Congress Theater in Chicago and The Rave in Milwaukee.

Brad DJ-Bizerk
https://www.facebook.com/BizerkMusic
https://soundcloud.com/bizerk-music

For over 10 years, Brad (Bizerk) Nierman has rocked crowds across the nation. Played along side DJ Mags Top 100 #23 in the World and Hardstyles #1 DJ Headhunterz. With over 15 releases through various record labels, Bizerk's sets include a mind-melting high-energy bass-thowmping-sound that includes original tracks and absolute-party-bangers. Expect nothing but the best when this headliner takes the stage! You can catch Bizerk locally in Chicago, or on Soundcloud, just search "Bizerk Music".

Denyed
https://www.facebook.com/denyedofficial
https://soundcloud.com/denyed

DENYED is a 18 year old producer/DJ of Electro from Chicago, IL. He makes the kind of music that shakes dance floors and inspires you to move. Expect big things from this young aspiring producer in 2014, because he's about to take the scene by storm. All mercy, DENYED.

FLYING IN FROM LAS VEGAS FOR THIS PARTY - Trigga V 
https://soundcloud.com/triggv

Famous producer from Las Vegas has rocked the crowd all over the US, Denver, LA, etc. now Chicago. Played with Loudpvck-Excitsion-Brillz-Deltron3030 at the 1st bank center sold out show! Now we are bringing him out to Chicago. Lets show him how Chicago rages !!

DJ Lady Raven
https://www.facebook.com/DJ.Lady.Raven?directed_target_id=0

With a true passion for sub-bass, Chicago's premiere female Dubstep DJ brings nothing but the dirtiest upfront beats. 
Lady Raven has been headlining parties across the U.S. and creating new legions of fans all over the world. 
She has rocked crowds across Chicagoland and various nightclubs / underground events all over the Midwest. 
She has already performed alongside Dubstep heavyweights Rusko, Flux Pavilion and Doctor P. 
She strives to be at the forefront of the Midwest Dubstep scene. Her mixes have been featured on Digitally Imported Radio, Radio Dubstep, and Global Vortex Radio. 
Lady Raven is guaranteed to put on an explosive show filled with the filthiest beats to blow your mind. If you like it dirty, then don't miss Lady Raven!

Solstis

https://www.facebook.com/solstis.music
https://soundcloud.com/official-solstis

Dj/production duo currently on the rise, Solstis is made up of Andres Garcia and Brandon Myers. The duo mainly produces electro and progressive house, but like experimenting with other genres as well. Started off as a garage band, then moved on to edm production under the name Get Sum. After a few years they outgrew the name and began their current project Solstis. The duo was born in raised in Chicago and was always heavily influenced by the trance, electro and progressive house scene over the years, with influences from above and beyond, Ilan Bluestone, Alesso, Dyro, Porter Robinson and more. Solstis plays a variety of genres and constantly surprises the crowd with unexpected twists in their sets. They have played events with Bro safari and Heroes and Villains and currently have support from Jordan Alexander, Heroes and Villains, Disflow, Frankie Sanchez and more.

BassDoctoRx 

http://www.mixcloud.com/bassdoctorrx/ https://soundcloud.com/bassdoc90

Your neighborhood BassdoctoRx has played with such names as JRabbit, Dieselboy, and soon to be Heyoka. Dubstep, Trap, Drumstep, and Drum and Bass are his specialties, with a strong passion for music, the dose of bass pumping out of the speakers comes a sound that only a licensed doctor can prescribe. He is sure to have you moving, if not you must have flat lined. Get ready, Cause the Doctor is in...

FOXHOUND 

Foxhound has played in audio assassins and also various clubs around the chi with AA like porn and chicken, primary, and exit! He also has killed many shows under the alias SKITTLES. Doing all things heavy and hard FOXHOUND delivers sick drops and beats that rattle through your ear drums. Be sure to catch this set because FOXHOUND will be killing it wherever he goes and throwing down!!

With strong roots in RnB & Rap, Dubstep & Trap,House and UK Garage, DUB REPVBLIK is here to convert nations of humans to dance floor monsters.

Bio 
Mario Gonzalez 
http://www.mariogonzalezjr.com/

 Mario Gonzalez come to Gallery13 fresh from a 64-day world tour which began with an artist in residence in Gwangju, South Korea that included a two person exhibition. Following a month stay in South Korea, Mario was invited to return for a solo exhibition as well as participation in the Gwangju Biennial 2014. He was sponsored by the US Consulate to represent Chicago in the International Meeting of Styles in Wiesbaden, Germany this summer and also received an 

Mario Gonzalez has traveled the globe  painting subways, murals, performing, teaching and showing works in galleries and museums "searching for the perfect beat" which he had always carried all along.

In 2002, he started painting smaller works that he called "Graffpop" because Graffiti was a mainstream art phenomenon. 

t Mario began painting in larger scale while opening a studio at the Zhou B Art Center in Chicago. In his new studio and surrounded by a vibrant art community, Mario fused all the elements that he had experienced over the years such as pouring, dripping, drawing and using non-traditional techniques and processes. These new approach culminated into a style of urban abstract graffiti and expressionism that is now highly acclaimed by local and international galleries and museums.


Bio 
Sergio Gomez
http://www.sergiogomezonline.com/

Sergio Gomez is the Director of Exhibitions at the Zhou B. Art Center, owner & director of 33 Contemporary Gallery, contributor for Italia Arte Magazine, founder of VisualArtToday.com; a curated online exhibition space for international contemporary art. In addition, Sergio is an accomplished graphic designer, Art/Design faculty at South Suburban College, Creative Consultant for Idea Seat Marketing and Advertising and co-founder of 3C Wear LLC.

Sergio has organized numerous important exhibitions such as “The National Self-Portrait Exhibition”, “Get Real: New Figurative Realism in Chicago” “CelebrARTE”, “Chicago’s Twelve”, “Chicago’s Twelve at Garfield Park Conservatory”, “Style Bombing” 

Sergio’s work has been subject of solo exhibitions in the United States, Italy and Vienna. He has participated in numerous group exhibitions in Spain, Sweden, Mexico and the US. His work can be found in private and public collections of the National Museum of Mexican Art, Brauer Art Museum, and the MIIT Museo Internazionale Italia Arte among others.

The human form is the most important element in Sergio’s work and it exists as an anonymous representation of the self. The figure dominates the work and it is depicted as a shadow, aura, ghost or energy light. Sergio is interested in the human and spiritual experience throughout the cycles of life.

The 2014 edition of the Cold Waves Music Festival (Cold Waves III) has returned again to Chicago for it’s third straight year. Once again the festival has been taken to new heights by it’s organizers with surprise headliners and bold lineups filing out the 2 day event. The festival returns to the Metro Chicago but the headliners now range from EBM and Waxtrax legends, Front 242, to the Industrial metallers, Fear Factory. The diverse lineup includes Germany’s Die Krupps, The return of Chris Connelly (Ministry, Revco, Pigface) with his latest project, Cocksure, Pitchfork Magazine’s EBM darlings, Youth Code, Madison’s Caustic and the critically acclaimed ∆Aimon. Additional support is given by Author and Punisher, SMP (Sounds of Mass Production), Chicago’s Cyanotic, Acumen Nation and the very in demand, Surachai alongside special guests.

Limited $72 2 day passes and the single day passes ($42) will be on sale via the Metro website on Friday 4/18. Some very limited VIP packages ($170-$200) will also be on sale via the Cracknation website on 4/18. A portion of the proceeds will go to benefit Chicago’s Hope for the Day which utilizes music and the arts to offer education, prevention and hope against suicide.
