612267792196772.description:
This August Justin and Chris return to the windy city for some mid-western therapeutic bliss. Give your body and being the gift of learning to give and receive, immersed in the world of yoga, flying therapeutics, Thai massage and other bodywork modalities. Harness the power of gravity and explore new freedoms in three-dimensional healing touch. Relax into the rejuvenating power of supportive community... Come fly with us!

This immersion teaches valuable tools for yoga teachers, massage therapists and physical therapists who want to develop their capacity to heal using their hands, and fulfills one of the prerequisites for the AcroYoga Teacher Training. This event also qualifies for 30 contact hours as part of the One Yoga USA TT and Yoga 4 Love Advanced Trainings; a certificate of completion will be given at the end of the 5 days. No previous experience or partner necessary. This training is for everybody; you do not have to be a yogi or have practiced acro.

To Register: 
http://clients.mindbodyonline.com/ws.asp?studioid=520&stype=-101&sView=day&sTrn=100000074

Questions: chris@acroyoga.org, 570.460.6824

Location:
3113 North Lincoln Avenue Chicago, IL 60657

Investment:
Full 5 days Early-Bird until July 23rd: $435
Full 5 days from July 24th on: $535
Saturday only day rate: $108

Schedule:
Sat - Wed 10am - 5:30pm

What is AcroYoga?
AcroYoga blends the wisdom of yoga, the dynamic power of acrobatics, and the loving kindness of healing arts. These three lineages form the foundation of a practice that cultivates trust, playfulness, and community. In this immersion we will focus on the Lunar Healing Arts Practices that cultivate listening, loving and letting go and Yogic Practices that cultivate breathe awareness, life balance and connection.

AcroYoga is a space to:

- Heal the body
- Learn to massage both on the floor and in the air
- Play with freedom
- Connect profoundly both with both yourself and with friends
- Break the barriers of what you believe impossible
- Conquer gravity
- Take off in flight
- Join the world community of AcroYoga
… and smile a ton!


About Justin Caruso:
Justin feels the body to be a reflection of life: an ecstatic temple, a work of art, and a vehicle for connection. Just before the financial crisis Justin made a timely exit from Wall Street to return to yoga, a practice he began over fifteen years ago. A New York native, Justin has spent the past seven years traveling extensively through South America, Asia and the US, teaching and studying yoga, AcroYoga, bodywork and water therapies with many of the world's master teachers of the healing arts.

About Chris Loebsack:
Chris Loebsack 500hr E-RYT uses the power of yoga to create space for students that cultivates trust playfulness and connection within themselves and their communities. Living by her mantra, Clarity, Integrity and Love, she draws upon her AcroYoga Practice to share the healing power of touch and safe intimacy. She is a valuable mentor to many upcoming educators. 

Testimonials:

"Thank you for such an incredible experience you just facilitated. You are gifted teachers, really. The material was presented with such ease; in an accessible, thorough, as well as FUN way! The healing that came from Thai Massage ( every morning ), and the playful laughter from flight; I truly feel nourished, inspired, and transformed. My deepest gratitude."

"Thank YOU for passing on and spreading your beautiful loving Energy. I missed going to the immersion this morning. Even though i went back to the same routine as before, today was a different day. Eternally grateful for having the opportunity to be your student for a few days.
Many more will come. Muchas bendiciones y mucho amor"

"Still riding so high on the waves of love shared at the lunar immersion in Miami! I am left with so many images from that weekend that make me weep from the pure beauty and loving that was embodied so perfectly in yourself, Chris, Ari and Lau! You've touched me profoundly and inspired me deeply! HUGE gratitude...thank you!"

"I am singing praises for the connectedness and receptivity that I was blessed to experience this past week. Weaving threads of trust and surrender into one mandala of supreme symmetry, balance, and love. Learning how to allow my inner light to sink deeper into a space that homes boundless expansion. If we can move with ease and grace in our lives with an open accepting unconditional love for ourselves, only then can we truly give love to others. I am a conduit of radiance that is open to shine and was born to shine. Thank you from the bottom of my heart Chris Loebsack and Justin Caruso for awakening these gems of wisdom within me. I will never forgot our Lunar Immersion together and the beautiful sangha that was created. Endless gratitude to the divine healing in AcroYoga"


"Last year, when I saw the amazing cast of great teachers that was going to teach this immersion I decided wholeheartedly to dive in. I rest reassured that that was one of the best ways to start 2013. I'm deeply inspired by where you have taken your practice (and where it has taken you) and feel grateful for how generous is your desire to share it. As it is with those souls that inject one's life with the substance of spiritual growth, I rest comfortably assured that there will be more opportunities for sharing the same space and share some love."

"Justiiiiiiiiin GRACIASSSS! THANK YOUUU! It was a truly amazing experience. I joined the Lunar Immersion to put myself outside of my comfort zone. At first I thought I was just going to be a spectator not having any experience but your teaching techniques were flawless and I very quickly felt like I was part of it all. I LOVE LOVE LOVE the aspect of giving in Acro Yoga I had a very big need to channel my need to give in a loving and nurturing way. Receiving was too much to handle! (No words to describe) The whole experience filled me with a renewed energy. My students have not stoped commenting that I look so happy. It was such a great investment. I still don't have the confidence to fly them or try any of the techniques but I do have my 6 yr old daughter and she is my little person to practice with. I still have to keep learning so for now I will continue to study as much Acro yoga as I can. Thank you for coming to Puerto Rico, for being such a great instructor, for sharing your light and for doing what you do. I wish you a whole lot of goodness!!!! I hope our paths cross again soon Big Hug"
612267792196772.location: Ganesha Yoga and Adventures in Fitness
612267792196772.name: Chicago AcroYoga Lunar Immersion with Justin Caruso and Chris Loebsack

612365345518415.description:
Very Special Guest" Piano Schulze "
Manne Chicago
Video ansehen http://www.myvideo.de/watch/9236699/Manne_Chicago_2
Seit über 50 Jahren spielt er mit Leidenschaft und Herzblut Blues und Boogie Woogie am Piano und gilt nicht nur in Berlin als Legende.
Alles begann mit dem Film "Swing Serenade", den er Mitte der 50er Jahre in einem Berliner Kino sah - mit Auftritten von Count Basie, Lionel Hampton, Jack Teagarden und vielen anderen mehr, was ihn begeisterte, - doch es gab noch etwas anderes, das ihn wie er sagt geradezu "elektrisierte": und das waren in den Pausen zwischen den gezeigten Big Band-Auftritten  Zeichentrickcartoons, die musikalisch untermalt waren mit den Boogie Woogies von Albert Ammons, Meade Lux Lewis und Pete Johnson, und zwar in einer selbst für heutige Verhältnisse erstaunlich klaren Tonqualität.
Schellack- und Vinyl-Platten in diesem Bereich waren rar, immerhin konnte er Pinetop Smiths Boogie Woogie und eine EP mit den Aufnahmen von Albert Ammons Rhythm Kings erwerben. Über England gelangte er an Platten im frühen Barrelhouse Stil, einer rustikalen Art des Kneipenboogies, die seine Spielweise maßgeblich mitgeprägt hat, was sich vor allem in überfüllten Berliner Kneipen immer wieder als Vorteil erwiesen hat.Da es weder Klavierlehrer gab, die den Stil beherrschten, noch brauchbare Klavier-Noten, hörte er mit einem alten UHER-Tonband, das er auf halbe Geschwindigkeit stellte, Piano Solos heraus. Eine Technik, die von vielen Pianisten in abgewandelter Form bis heute praktiziert wird.
Unser Preisträger ist der einzige Boogiepianist, der einen der großen Drei, nämlich Pete Johnson noch live erleben durfte, Ende der 50er Jahre im Rahmen der Konzertreihe Norman Granz' Jazz At The Philharmonic im Berliner Sportpalast. In ebendieser Zeit gründete unser Preisträger ein Trio mit Bass- und Schlagzeugbegleitung unter dem Namen "The Boogie Woogie Prayers", ferner spielte er als Mitglied der Formation Hans&Co.
Der Rundfunk entdeckte ihn für die Sendungen SFBeat des Sender Freies Berlin und Club 18 des RIAS Berlin.
Gleich nach der Grenzöffnung unternahm er mit dem Gitarristen Gunther Schulze sowie Schlagzeugbegleitung, ausgedehnte Tourneen in die Neuen Bundesländer.  Dort begrüßten ihn die Konzertbesucher begeistert und sagten: "Endlich erleben wir dich mal live, wir haben dich früher immer im Radio gehört!"
Es wäre müßig aufzuzählen, wo er überall gespielt hat, - in kleinen und großen Kneipen, z.B. 2-3 die Woche über Jahre regelmäßig in der Ostberliner 88-Kneipe,  aber auch in Konzertsälen, auf privaten Feiern, oder zuletzt beim großen Festival der Hamburger Boogie Connection in der Fabrik.
Ich durfte ihn Mitte der 80er Jahre in Berlin kennen- und schätzen lernen, als Musiker und jemanden, der für andere Pianisten eine Anlaufstelle war, jemand, der immer ein freundliches und bestärkendes Wort übrig hatte für die, die sich selbst am Klavier ausprobierten. Und auch heute noch mit 74 Jahren gibt er gerne die Begeisterung für den Boogie in Form von Klavierunterricht weiter.

Mitte der 80er spielte sich die West-Berliner Boogie Szene vorwiegend im Bermuda-Dreieck der Lokale Blues Café, Jazz For Fun und dem Yorkschlösschen ab, wovon heute leider nur noch das Yorkschlösschen übrig geblieben ist. Dafür gibt es heute andere Auftrittsgelegenheiten. Aber gerne erinnere ich mich noch an die Konzerte damals, die nicht vor 22 Uhr anfingen und um 3 Uhr auch noch nicht zu Ende waren, mit unserem Preisträger in vorderster Linie.
Als Haupttonarten des Boogie Woogie gelten C-Dur, F-Dur, G-Dur. Und wie Sie alle wissen, ist der prägnante Grundtonanschlag in der linken Hand ein unverzichtbarer Bestandteil des Boogies. Das tiefe C ist in allen drei Tonarten wichtig. Als Tonika in C-Dur, als Dominante in F-Dur und in G-Dur als Subdominante. Was aber, wenn ausgerechnet dieser Ton kaputt, also klanglos ist, weil ein Betrunkener Bier ins Piano geschüttet hat? Ein Fiasko für viele, aber kein Problem für unseren Preisträger, der auch in den abwegigsten Tonarten wie H-Dur, E-Dur und A-Dur heimisch ist.
Einmal, so schildert er, schaute ihm ein anderer Pianist auf die Tasten und sagte empört: "H-Dur? In der Tonart spielt man nicht!" - worauf unser Preisträger entgegnete: "Was heißt hier, in der Tonart spielt MAN nicht. DU kannst das nicht spielen, MAN kann das schon, wie Du siehst." Ja, man kann und das heißt genauer gesagt: MANNE kann! Wir würdigen ihn heute in der Kategorie Besondere Verdienste um den Boogie Woogie, aus der Bundeshauptstadt Berlin:

MANNE CHICAGO!

Laudatio gehalten von Jo Schumacher
612365345518415.name: Manne Chicago - Der Große Alte Mann am Boogie Piano - Eintritt frei

612490675510831.description:
*** Tickets on Sale NOW****

Please join Dancing Classrooms Chicagoland at the Red Carpet premiere of Dancing In Jaffa at the Music Box Theatre Chicago with a special performance from some of the Chicagoland children who've participated in the Dancing Classrooms program after the screening


Tickets on sale NOW!! 
A portion of each ticket we sell goes to help benefit the Dancing Classrooms Chicagoland.

$10 General Admission

$40 Reserved Admission:
includes Pre-Party with a free cocktail, 1 free Medium Popcorn & Soda.

$100 VIP Admission:
Includes Pre-Party with a free cocktail, 1 free Medium Popcorn & Soda, and a VIP Cocktail Reception with Hors D'Oeuvres immediately following screening.

Pre & After Parties will be held next door to the theater at the Music Box Theatre's new event space: 
3375 N. Southport Ave. Chicago.

VIP & Reserved tickets are limited... so get yours now!

About the film:

Dancing in Jaffa is the story of Dancing Classrooms founder and four-time ballroom champion Pierre Dulaine and his effort to bring Israeli-Jewish and Israeli-Palestinian children together through ballroom dance.

 This film is the third about the highly successful U.S. and international program. The Dancing Classrooms story has also been told in the hit documentary Mad Hot Ballroom and the feature film Take the Lead, starring Antonio Banderas as Mr. Dulaine.
 
Dancing in Jaffa follows Mr. Dulaine to the city of his birth, Jaffa, where historic strains between two cultures bubble beneath the surface of tense co-existence.

 Can a ballroom program that has achieved success in the U.S. and other countries work in a community where distrust and violence has been the norm for decades? Mr. Dulaine believes it can.**
612490675510831.name: Dancing in Jaffa Chicago Premiere and VIP After Party

613314458756360.description:
10:00pm - 11:15pm       Rhythm Method
11:30pm - 1:00am         Cool Waters Band
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Cool-Waters-Band/179301573456

$10 ticket. 18+ show

Rhythm Method is a five-piece, energetic rock band. We perform hit covers from the '60s (i.e., Beatles, Stones, Zeppelin), '70s (i.e., Petty, Springsteen, Queen), as well as '90s and more recent material (i.e., Cake, Sublime, Weezer, etc).

Eric Nyberg: Vocals, piano
Vince Versaci: Guitar, vocals
Allen Morris: Bass
Jake Dubravec: Drums
Chris Hopps: Saxophone

The Cool Waters Band is Good Time Rock and Roots at its finest - high-energy, dynamic, intense, inviting, feel-good music. Based out of the hard-working Fox Cities of Wisconsin (Appleton, Oshkosh, Green Bay), CWB is single-handedly changing the way live music is listened to and appreciated throughout the region. With an extremely dedicated fan base throughout the Midwest, Cool Waters is making powerful statements on their own terms, in their own unique way. 

CWB’s original sound reclaims the best of classic southern rock peppered with Bob Marley and Led Zeppelin (remember when music used to be good?!) Their music knows no color or boundaries. The band has been critically acclaimed by all walks of the music business as the “must see” act in the region. Their diverse sound has paired them with all sorts of regional and national acts such as Blue Oyster Cult, Seven Mary Three, Leftover Salmon, Death Cab for Cutie, Roger Kline, Robert Bradley’s Blackwater Surprise and the Gin Blossoms. Warner Brothers’ A&R representative Braden Merrick describes the band as “…Maroon 5 meets The Black Crowes meets Train meets Tesla. A definite Bonaroo band.” 

In 2005, The Cool Waters Band won a Wisconsin Area Music Industry "People's Choice" award. They have also been nominated for other "People's Choice" awards as well as "Recording-Album of the Year" for 2005’s, "A Rose Pedal to the Metal". Their first 3 singles have received steady radio play on major radio stations throughout the region, and the response from listeners has been overwhelming. “You will be impressed, a pleasant surprise. Awesome!” describes 105.7 WAPL DJ, Len Nelson. Cool Waters has sold over 10,000 copies of recent studio and live releases. Poised to continue making great music and great times, The Cool Waters Band guarantees an over-the-top performance each and every show. Their schedule, as well as their albums are available online at www.coolwatersband.com.
613314458756360.name: RHYTHM METHOD | COOL WATERS BAND at HARD ROCK CAFE Chicago | Ages 18+ Show

621653044577736.description:
CHICAGO, IL – The Chicago Outfit Roller Derby, member of the Women’s Flat Track Derby Association (WFTDA), takes the track for their first home bout of the season on Saturday, April 26, 2014.

Doors open at 6:00pm at the Windy City Fieldhouse (2367 W. Logan Boulevard) in Chicago. The double-header kicks off with The Outfit’s Shade Brigade vs. the Twin City Travelers (B) at 7:00pm, and the excitement keeps rolling with The Outfit’s Syndicate vs. the Twin City Travelers (A).

Tickets can be purchased online for $15 at www.chicagooutfitrollerderby.com, or at the door for $20. Discounts are available for groups of 10 or more.

 Partial proceeds will support the Anhelo Project, a non-for-profit organization in the City of Chicago that aims to close the income gap and increase academic opportunity for low to middle income, underrepresented minority students that require financial support to continue with their post-secondary education. In 2009, a group of committed college students and advisors sought to create change by hosting a gala event to raise funds in order to award scholarships for highly qualified students. Many of these students are leaders in their communities, but unfortunately cannot access the financial means to fund their undergraduate education. The Dream Scholarship is available to undocumented students residing in Illinois, attending any college or university within the city limits of Chicago.

The Chicago Outfit's official “little sister” league, the Chicago Riots Youth Roller Derby team, will play during the first halftime. Coached and mentored by members of The Outfit, the Chicago Riots were founded in fall of 2009 and are open to girls ages 12-18 who have not graduated high school. The second halftime entertainment will be a crowd activity.  

Additional treats and entertainment will be available for all to enjoy. Check out the “Fan Zone,” featuring games, temporary tattoos, a coloring book (hand-designed by the skaters), face painting and more.  Friends and fans can strike a pose in the free photo booth, compliments of 9 Muses Photo. Beer and wine will be available for purchase, the latter courtesy of Derby LITE. The following food and art vendors will be on hand: Taquero Fusion (www.taquerofusion.com)
The Vegan Food Truck (stemartaen.com/foodtruck)  
BabyCakes Food Truck (babycakestruck.com)
Safara Chicago  (safara-chicago.myshopify.com)
Sketchy Fetish (facebook.com/SketchyFetishInc)
Cranky Pickle (etsy.com/people/CrankyPickle)
Seward Street Studios (sewardstreetstudios.com)
StephXstitch (etsy.com/shop/stephXstitch)
Hell Razor Art (etsy.com/shop/HellRazor)
Custom Derby Armbands (etsy.com/shop/CustomDerbyArmbands)
The Shiny Object (etsy.com/shop/TheShinyObject)

The after party will be held at Township (2200 N California Ave.) following the bout.
621653044577736.name: The Chicago Outfit Roller Derby - Home Opener Bout to Benefit the Anhelo Project

623517041055498.description:
WIN A SIX-DAY MICHFEST TICKET!!
The Night Stage features surf punk dance-band Venus in Furs, Chicago's legendary Drum Divas, Poet Warrior Extraordinaire C.C. Carter, Louise Cloutier's burn-down-the-house a cappella, smooth-joking Shannon Noll, swoon-worthy kings Style & Swagg, and fire goddess Terri Burch.

$5-$10 suggested donation
No one turned away for lack of funds

Join 400 hundred women “on the land” at the Abbey, for dancing, live performances, and mingling in the Twilight Zone, Bush Garden Lounge, Triangle Fire, and Night Stage. And, you never know what might happen on Lois Lane...

TRIANGLE FIRE JAM
Triangle Fire Jam features the very talented Aerin Tedesco, Andrea Bunch, Jenny Urban, Maria Gullo, Angelisa Crognale, Amelia Starnsta, Betsy Odom, Angie Maloney and special guests. Gather round the fire pit for some fierce singer-songwriters. Bring your instrument and join in. 

Dance all night, feel the Michfest love, and help us raise money to send women to Festival! Last year we gave away 10 tickets from the FREE DRAWING to women who needed support to get to festival. Come to the party to enter the free drawing!!

Arrive Early!
Early Bird Raffle Drawing at 8:30pm
FREE RAFFLE TICKET at the door if you arrive by 8:30pm
Triangle Fire Music Jam 8pm-9:00pm 
CC Carter Line Dance Lessons 9:00pm
DJs and Live Performances all night

New Venue!
We outgrew the Holiday Club and our new host is The Abbey, Chicago's famous concert pub. The Abbey has a big beautiful stage and dancing til 2am, so bring your friends and share that Michfest love. In addition to the fundraising raffle, any woman can enter the FREE DRAWING to be eligible to win a ticket to festival. Last year, we raised enough money to give Michfest tickets to 10 women. The FREE DRAWING is for women who self-identify as "needing help" to get to festival this year. You can only enter if you attend party, so join us for a great night and a good chance for a free ticket. 

FABULOUS RAFFLE PRIZES
Six Day Michfest Ticket Grand Prize!!
Plus Concert tickets, CDs, Yoga memberships, Dykey Films, Bar Tabs, Michfest Swag, Women & Children First Gift Certificate, and dozens of great prizes. 

Your Party hosts:

Brenda Schumacher, Pat McCombs, Marla Nitt, Julie King, Patience Meeks, Sherry Wright, Marie Walz, Valentia Gaglio, Amigas Latinas, and Pow Wow

Join Chicago Michfest Facebook Group at www.facebook.com/groups/Chicagomichfest

**Party proceeds will fund tickets for women who need help to get to Festival. 

More info: www.facebook.com/groups/Chicagomichfest or flybike7@gmail.com

ABOUT MICHFEST: 

The 39th Annual Michfest is happening August 5-10, 2014, and we are starting the party early. Whether this is your 1st year or 39th year going to Fest, come out to celebrate with us and get ready for the best Michfest ever!

This August, hundreds of Chicago women are heading north to Hart, Michigan to attend the legendary Michfest. We will join thousands of women from across the globe in this paradise on 650 gorgeous acres of woods, ferns and rolling fields. Don't miss what will be one of the greatest experiences of your life with music, dancing, workshops, delicious food, parties, bon fires, hiking, and camping. You will find an amazing feeling of community, friendship, openness, and high-energy fun. 

Whether you like quiet hikes and movies under the stars, workshops on everything from kissing (um, a hands on class) to singing to trapeze tricks to finances--or if you prefer mosh pits, crowd surfing and late night parties deep in the woods, you will have the time of your life as part of this amazingly diverse community that is Michfest.

Join us at the the Abbey on April 26th for a great party, and to learn more and meet some amazing women. We will have info on tickets, ride shares, and all things festival. And we’ll raise money to buy tickets for those who need help. Come to the party to enter a free drawing for a Festival ticket.

GT005 : Firstly we would like to say a huge thank you to all who helped make our March party with Snowskull another sell out event. Serious vibes and friendly faces all around... Couldn't have asked for a better crowd!


This month sees us teaming up with the mighty Dimensions Festival to bring you a taste from one of the worlds most respected underground electronic music festivals. Also known for their 'Outlook' parties, Dimensions Festival brings some of the worlds most pioneering electronic artists to an abandoned fort along the coast of Croatia, Previous years have featured the likes of Mount Kimbie, Theo Parrish, Motor City Drum Ensemble, Moodyman, Blawan, Steffi, Skudge, Levon Vincent, Tony Allen, Model500, Mr Scruff, Ben Klock, Giles Peterson, Daphni, Omar S amongst hundreds of other top names from around the globe.

Make sure to keep your eyes peeled as we will be giving you a chance to win X2 Dimensions Festival 2014 tickets at the Cardiff launch party, Info to follow shortly at bottom of the page!


•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••



TEVO HOWARD - Tevo Howard Recordings // Permanent Vacation // Beautiful Granville Records


[2.5 HOUR SET] This time around we bring one of underground house music’s most serious emerging talents, Tevo Howard. Well we say “emerging” but Tevo has been spinning records since 1987, when he’d barely hit puberty. Growing up in Chicago at that time, it was perhaps inevitable that he’d catch the house bug. But his interest in music went beyond that, and he would later study music and bass guitar at college as well as several degrees in different subjects embarked upon by the academically gifted.

Since his teens Tevo has come a long way, being a major player in the underground house scene running Chicago based Label “Beautiful Granville Records” named after a three block stretch that he lives on in Chicago and “Tevo Howard Recordings”,  As well as releasing on labels such as Rebirth, Buzzin' Fly Records and Sounds Of The Universe. Now moving his base of operation to Berlin he has had the pleasure of remixing the likes of Midland, Dusky, Suspect, Ben Sun as well as being remixed by the likes of Marcus Worgull, Noir & Martin Thompson and Francis Inferno Orchestra to name a few.

 

Little more needs to be said about this man his soul full productions and hypnotic sets speak for themselves. He started to DJ at roughly thirteen or fourteen years old, putting us back to about 1987. After a skateboard accident in 1987, He decided being a DJ was a hobby that wasn’t either illegal, or dangerous, and that it would be fun to DJ his own music. Needless to say it became an addiction, It started by walking down to Gramaphone Records and bought one record, “True Faith,” New Order”.

 

“I am grateful to have Grown up in the Chicago record scene, because it provided a medium to apply my curious mind as a young musician”.

625744010783805.description:
Join us at The Whistler on April 7th at 9pm!

We continue the 5th Anniversary Season of what Thrillist Chicago calls one of the best karaoke spots in the city.

Here's how to participate:
1) Choose a scene.
2) Have a drink.
3) Get on stage.
4) Be awesome.

(repeat as necessary)

For those who don't know, "movieoke" is a portmanteau of "movie" and "karaoke". Instead of songs, you quote a movie scene of your choice as it plays for you and the audience (captions will be provided). It's free to participate, but if you do order a drink at the bar, be sure to tip your bartenders. ;-)

If you can't make it, feel free to invite others who may be interested! This event page will be updated every month, so even if you can't make it one month, keep an eye on this page for future Movieoke dates.

Join in on the fun! Like Chicago Movieoke here on Facebook, follow @ChicagoMovieoke on Twitter, or visit ChicagoMovieoke.com for the latest info!

626949904041839.description:
Tickets:
http://www.ticketweb.com/fb/4113194/mayne

Price:
$33.00 - $43.00

Additional Info:
An evening of Jazz music, Champagne, Specialty Cocktails, Gourmet Delicacies by Chef Dejan and more......

All tickets include delicious appetizers and 2 drinks, your choice of champagne or the evening's specialty cocktails:the favorites of jazz icons Billie Holiday,Chet Baker, Frank Sinatra and Nat King Cole.

Charbonier will perform a selection of songs as made famous by the above mentioned jazz vocalists. 

Also performed will be medleys of songs written by John Lennon & Paul McCartney as well as Hal David & Burt Bachurach.

Accompanied by Adrian Ruiz on piano, Michael Lough on bass, Nils Hidgon on drums and Shaun Johnson on trumpet the evening will take you on a musical journey of the 1930's to the 1960's.

Special guest performers include the legendary Joel Hall Dancers premiering a new piece to Charbonier's Stormy Weather!

Be the first to see Charbonier's world premiere music video of his new single, "You've Been Dreaming" 

On the Mayne Stage's big screen, enjoy the video highlights of Charbonier's December album release party.

Feast your eyes on a sampling of the vintage car collection of Lou Rugani.

Remember, it's a Spring Soiree so dress in your Sunday best!

Jazz vocalist/songwriter, film and music producer Jesse Charbonier has just released his first album, Jesse Charbonier: Live at the Vic Theatre - Chicago.  In that album he pays tribute to the iconic jazz vocalists of the 20th Century. Click the link to get a taste of that album and his live performance. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WF_7Ov4k6zI

Presently he performs regularly at Chicago's iconic Drake Hotel in its legendary Coq d' Or Lounge with his trio to rave reviews since the summer of 2011.

Let's Not Discuss It. Charbonier's first single release co-written with composer Federico D' Antoni, and produced by Juan Manzur has been gaining momentum and is at the top of the ReverbNation Jazz Charts. The accompanying music video produced by Charbonier and directed by Tadeo Garcia and Mario Carrasco, has been called "A Mastepiece" "Cinematic",& "Breathtaking" Click the link to view the music video. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMch4bZTroQ

Charbonier, also has performed at venues such New York City Henry's Restaurant and Lounge (formerly Birdland), Chicago's Vic Theatre and now Chicago's Mayne Stage, as well as for such prestigious organizations as The Chicago International Film Festival.

To learn more visit his website: www.JesseCharbonier.com
626949904041839.name: A Spring Soiree with JESSE CHARBONIER at the MAYNE STAGE - Chicago - Featuring the Gourmet delicacies of CHEF DEJAN and a special performance by the legendary JOEL HALL DANCERS

629982833707711.description:
The Luau tournament is in its 19th year and takes place in beautiful Chicago, IL. Soak up both the sun and spectacular views of the Chicago skyline and Lake Michigan while you play!

The Luau is Chicago’s largest grass volleyball event for all levels of play and boasts over 2,500 participants. Tournament play begins in the morning with the Bud Light beer truck parked right up on the grass to get the party started! Entry fee for the event includes tournament play, food, beer & a DJ music all day. Spectators are encouraged and welcome to come; a wristband can be purchased and includes all-you-can-eat and drink during the day. Huge cash prizes for the top levels, costume contest info, sponsored games/contests with prizes and more to come! Stay tuned for info on the post party!

You must be 21 years old to participate in the event. Rain or shine - no refunds.

More info and registration coming soon!

645474302168148.description:
PASSWORD is "BOND" for reduced entry and LADIES FREE ALL NIGHT... ONLY with password.

Gabriel & Dresden 

For electronic dance music fanatics, the year 2011 marks a new musical promise. After three years of work apart, the critically acclaimed and multiple award winning duo of Josh Gabriel and Dave Dresden are back together with a new energy and spirit. 

In 2001, Josh and Dave joined forces under the now legendary Gabriel & Dresden moniker. Within their 6 years of collaboration, Gabriel & Dresden scored 19 number 1 Billboard Hot Dance/Club Play remixes and tracks, made three DJ-mixed compilation albums, an artist album and won seven International Dance Music Awards. Their tracks 'Arcadia', 'Dangerous Power', 'Let Go', 'Tracking Treasure Down' Andain "Beautiful Things" and numerous other masterpieces have turned into some of EDM’s biggest classics. 'As The Rush Comes', by their Motorcycle alias with Jes Brieden, they won the IDMA award for 'Best Progressive Trance Track' as well as peaking at #11 on the official UK top40 charts. The G&D treatment, through remixes and interpretations, was given to tracks by The Killers, Annie Lenox, Sarah McLachlan, Dido, Tiësto, Paul Oakenfold and Way Out West, making their sound cross borders from trance and progressive with pop, indie and soul sensibilities.

In 2008 After 6+ years of hits and and awards, both guys felt it was time for something new and took a break from Gabriel & Dresden to focus on their individual careers. Inspiration came flowing with the new tide. After the split, Josh Gabriel set up his own label, 'Different Pieces' and focused on his Winter Kills and Andain projects. On his album 'Eight', Josh intertwined techno and house into pieces of pure electronic bliss. In the meantime, Dave Dresden took charge of the dancefloor with his Dresden & Johnston project and spawned a US radio hit in the song 'Keep Faith' and "That Day" (with Nadia Ali on lead vocals), as well as remixes for the likes of Owl City, Nadia Ali, BT and The Crystal Method. But you simply can't stop musical synergy. 

As 2010 came to an end, Gabriel and Dresden decided to go back to their roots and reunite at the Hollywood Palladium in Los Angeles for New Year’s Eve 2011. Their return behind the decks showed that after two and a half years apart, nothing really changed. Gabriel & Dresden's comeback marks one of the most notable moments in EDM this year, finally answering the call of millions of dance lovers. With gigs at some of the world's biggest festivals, clubs and events planned and a new compilation in the making, Gabriel & Dresden are all set to do what they love most: celebrate music. And we're all invited.

654846977896731.description:
North Canterbury Musical Society presents for 2014 - "Chicago" - A show to die for!
Season is  1 May - 17th May 2014 at Rangiora High School Auditorium. Tickets sale online www.ncms.co.nz

Opening night - Thursday 1 May 7.30pm, Wed - Sat 7.30pm, One matinee only 2pm - 17th May Saturday. Season is  1 May - 17th May 2014.

Directed by Ravil Atlas, Musically Directed by Leanne O'Mahony, Choreography by Annette Searle.

About our Director -  Ravil Atlas:

Ravil makes his directing debut with NCSM in Chicago.  In New Zealand he has directed the opera Hansel and Gretel for the Invercargill Arts Festival (also conducted), Broadway Here We Come for the Smashing Ambitions company, various scenes for Southern Opera and The New Zealand National Singing school, was an acting and creative consultant for Godspell and Little Shop of Horrors for Burnside High School, and has taught script-based Stanivslaski acting techniques for NASDA.  

Moving to New Zealand in 2009 and Ravil quickly established himself as an important voice in singing pedagogy, acting, and performance techniques.  Prior to his arrival Ravil designed the program of vocal studies for the Theatre Artists Institute in California, an intensive training program for professional musical theatre performers, and was the course leader for musical theatre (university level) at Newcastle College in the UK.  He directed Pippin in New Castle and directed and conducted Tosca for the Garden State Opera company in New Jersey.

Ravil has starred as the leading tenor in more than 70 professional opera production in six countries, appeared in several long-running Broadway musicals including Les Miserables and The Phantom of the Opera and has taught many other professional singers and actors at the highest level.  He began his professional performing career as a member of the Grammy® award winning vocal ensemble Chanticleer and has worked with some of the world’s most important directors, conductors, and performers including Tony®, Grammy®, Academy®, and Oliver® award winners.  

Currently Ravil runs a thriving singing and acting studio in Christchurch including mentoring work, teacher training, and seminars.  He also supervises the singing and choir programme for the Christchurch School of Music, and teaches singing and choirs at several Christchurch schools.
654846977896731.name: "Chicago" - North Canterbury Musical Society presents...

655163644540302.description:
Order tickets via Eventbrite:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/lesbians-who-tech-and-friends-march-chicago-happy-hour-tickets-10637229239?aff=efbevent

Lesbians Who Tech is global community of over 3,000 queer women in and around tech.

Whether you work at a tech company, have a technical job or just love technology. Yes, even if you’re just obsessed with every new app that comes out. 

We want you to join Lesbians Who Tech and:


Get geeky with techy folks just like you
Enjoy tasty adult beverages
Land gigs, make new friends & connections



Why Lesbians Who Tech?

To Be More Visible To Each Other

We all know that familiar feeling of meeting someone in a work setting, knowing she’s a lesbian, and trying to work it into a conversation and make that connection. We’re about making that happen: connecting lesbians and building a network of colleagues, associates and friends in the industry.

To Be More Visible To Others

Outside of Ellen, Rosie, Melissa, and now Tammy, what other mainstream lesbian role models can most people name? We need more examples of lesbian leaders and that means we need to come out as the amazing, successful people we are.

To Get More Women and Lesbians in Technology

Lesbians are women first, and right now women are some of the most gifted folks in technology, yet there are far fewer of us than there should be (women account for 1 in 15 people in STEM fields). Because there aren’t enough women, women are rarely quoted as experts by the mainstream media and blogs, on panels, etc. And add the element of being lesbian, it’s equally important for us to represent women, and out women, for our communities.

Things to do at Navy Pier

Historic Navy Pier® is Chicago's lakefront playground. And it's the Midwest's #1 tourist and leisure destination, attracting more than 8 million visitors per year.

Navy Pier excites and entices guests with their favorite sights and sounds of the seasons. Open year-round (with the exception of Christmas and Thanksgiving Day), there is always a reason to visit the place where excitement awaits! Navy Pier showcases a unique collection of restaurants and shops in addition to unequaled recreational and exhibition facilities - in a setting like no other!

There is no admission to enter Navy Pier. Attractions within Navy Pier may have admission prices and those prices can be obtained from each individual attraction’s box office.

Navy Pier is a 3,300-foot long pier on the Chicago shoreline of Lake Michigan. It is located in the Streeterville neighborhood of the Near North Side community area. The pier was built in 1916 at a cost of $4.5 million.

******************************************
Deposits/ Final Payments/Refund Policy:
Deposits are due 15 days after reserving your seats unless we are within the 60 day window of final payments. Initial $50 deposit are non-refundable and cannot be transferred from “trip-to-trip” or “date-to-date”.

When resulting in cancellations that reduce the group's size/hotel deposit. If a trip is cancelled by the host or bus company, all travelers enrolled at the time of cancellation may be entitled to a full refund (as determined by cancellation policies of individual vendors). 

Final payment is due 60 days prior to the departure date of the tour. If you cancel prior to the 60 days all funds will be returned except the $50 Initial deposits which is non-refundable . If payments or deposits are not received we would unfortunately have to remove you from our reservation list. We will gladly accept payments throughout the year for any of our tours. 

"BAM Bus Tour" acts as an agent reserving hotels and other accommodations/attractions and cannot be held responsible for non performance of hotels and other providing services for our tours. We reserve the right to alter/change the itinerary if it becomes necessary. Liability cannot be claimed for delays caused by acts of God, public enemies, authorities of law, break downs & road or weather conditions beyond human control. In the event of a delay with unplanned overnight stay you would be responsible for your room, board and any other expenses that might occur.

Children 4 years old or older recommended

Support the urgent work of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum and learn more about the Chicago Next Generation, which seeks to use the lessons of the Holocaust to create a future different from the past. As the next generation, let’s inspire action!

Cocktails and hors d’oeuvres will be served.

The ticket price for the reception is $45 and increases to $55 on March 31 and at the door.

Join us for a private pre-reception dinner from 6 to 7:30 p.m. at Epic with Holocaust survivor Margot Walton, a child survivor and volunteer coordinator of the Chain of Memory program, which connects young people with stories of Holocaust victims. The ticket price is $85, inclusive of the dinner and cocktail reception.

Space is limited. Please register early by visiting  www.ushmm.org/events/chicagonextgen. To learn more, contact Renee Davis in the Museum’s Midwest Regional Office at 847.433.8099 or redavis@ushmm.org.

664719586919227.description:
So one of my goals for awhile has been that I wanted to run a marathon before age 30.  I just turned 28, and I did the half marathon last year.  So, this year is the year that I am going to do it!  I am also going to do the Shamrock Shuffle, possibly the solider field 10 miler, and one of the half marathons.   

I decided to join Imerman Angels and agreed to raise $1000.

I am throwing a Wristband party at Schoolyard Tavern  on April 26th from 8-11.  The wristband is $25, half of that will go to the fundraiser.  I will also be having a raffle for some great prizes. (gift cards, apparel, tickets, etc.)  I am in the process of collecting items for the raffle, so if you have anything you would like to donate or know anyone else that can please message me or text/call me (715-220-5138).  I would greatly appreciate it!!! 

If any of you cannot make it to this fundraiser, but would like to support me running the Chicago Marathon and help raise money for a great cause you can go to the link below and donate.  EVERY dollar counts :)


http://www.crowdrise.com/stephanieclarke1-TeamIA/fundraiser/stephanieclarke1

A little information on Imerman Angels for those of you that are not familiar: 

Team Imerman Angels is a group of individuals who like to stay fit and have fun. We participate in various activities spreading awareness and raising funds that provide free 1-on-1 cancer support for cancer fighters, survivors and caregivers. We currently have over 200 participants on Team Imerman Angels who are involved in various races and events all over the world. Make a difference today.

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!
664719586919227.name: Chicago Marathon Fundraiser!!!

664907776899564.description:
21+| The event is free with an RSVP, and Do312 provides the details: http://do312.com/cuffmeetup

Come out to the Logan Theater on March 19 for a Do312 Meetup hosted by CUFF and Ed Marszweiski (Lumpen Magazine/Co-Prosperity Sphere). This will be the official pre-festival kickoff for CUFF 2014, and will feature a screening of Crimes Against Humanity, the most recent feature by CUFF alumnus Jerzy Rose (which includes performances from CUFF 2014 poster artist Michael Lopez, and many other friends of CUFF).

Goose Island & Red Bull present: the Do312 March Meet Up

DJ Mixes in the film lounge by:
Rad Brian (Odd Obsession Video)
Faye Kabian

Hosted by: CUFF & Ed Marszweiski (Lumpen/Co-Prosperity Sphere)

- Thanks to our homies at Goose Island Beer Co. we will be providing RSVP’ers world class craft brews at all our Tastemaker Meetups, on the house of course!

- Since we love us some Red Bull & Titos Vodka, Do312 will be providing Red Bull & Titos cocktails as well.

- Movie snacks and concessions will be a-plenty!

- Get your 2014 Chicago Underground Film Festival program books

Followed by a VIP screening of Crimes Against Humanity

RSVP IS SUBJECT TO CAPACITY.  There is usually space for everyone but keep in mind that seating at Logan Theatre is limited. First folks to show up with RSVP will be admitted to the movie.

Crimes Against Humanity
Jerzy Rose, 77 min., video, 2013, USA

Official Selection Slamdance Film Festival
Official Selection Boston Underground Film Festival
Best Comedy Atlanta Underground Film Festival

“A priggish dean’s assistant at the local university spearheads an investigation into a possible satanic cabal in the ethnomusicology department; meanwhile his weepy, maudlin girlfriend Brownie becomes the victim of several freak accidents after cheating on him with a mysterious sweetheart. Crimes Against Humanity is a nihilistic romp through gossipy academic parties, boozy-stake outs, and surreal bedtime stories.”—Jerzy Rose

“Rose and co-writer Halle Butler are masters of wry humor, delighting in their characters’ self-pity, casual dishonesty and cruelty. Mike Lopez and Lyra Hill are beyond perfect in the lead roles, generating spark showers of subtextual resentment in their scenes together.”—Paul Sbrizzi, Slamdance Film Festival

“Recalls the fiction of Thomas Pynchon in its mix of conspiracy plots, academic references, and loopy humor…Rose creates a distinct, propulsive rhythm for the comic dialogue.”—Chicago Reader

“Star Lyra Hill’s wide-eyed, increasingly mangled deadpan gaze is worthy of a silent comedy all its own.”—Chicago Tribune
664907776899564.name: Chicago Underground Film Festival Do312 Meetup Screening of Crimes Against Humanity

SingStrong Chicago a cappella festival boasts 5 concerts, two full days of classes, dozens of free coachings, a High School Competition, and a separate ACA-IDOL competition for collegiate and semi-professional groups offering live, on mic judging, audience cell phone voting, and over $1,000 in awards. 

For singers who don't have their group with them, you can join our "Single Singers" group and perform on mic, on our Main Stage!

Get your tickets now at http://chicago.singstrong.org/tickets

We have 5 concerts featuring headline acts such as:
Ten
Blake Lewis
ARORA (formerly SONOS)
Breath of Soul
Grace McLean
Blue Jupiter
West Side 5
ONAIR
Ac Rock
Amy Engelhardt
...and see dozens more!!!

We are nearest to O'Hare Airport (ORD) and if you stay at the 4-star Hampton Inn & Suites Skokie, we shuttle you between the event site and hotel for free. And no extra charge for stuffing the room full of fun-lovin college kids!! And the open-mic aca-afterglow is at the hotel in Ruby Tuesdays. If you decide to drive, parking is FREE at the hotel, and at the classes and concerts.

Even if you can't make it this year, maybe you can help us spread the word, (PLEASE) because all the money we make goes to charity to support the Alzheimer's Association and local music programs. Thanks!

667750363286004.description:
Are you a lovely lady, or a macho man? Do you live in a cheap hotel or drive a Pontiac Wave? If so, or not, come celebrate Zachary Perron's birthday march 30th at the next Trash Ta Vie. Meet new friends for your ears and mind with the fabulous line-ups which are Inimai, Harfang and Jonathan Becker & The North Fields!

Jonathan Becker & The North Fields 
They've been around town their fair share, still promoting good values with great lyrics and great attitudes. Featuring their new release, which if you haven't heard, get on that, and a breath of fresh air for lovers of post-punk and alt-folk alike! 
http://jonathanbecker.bandcamp.com/

Truly an honor to have them perform with our next music-lovers;

Harfang 
Special guests from Quebec City, driving down to blow our minds with a level of musicality very rarely achieved by any band. Ever. With their compositions growing fast, now even featured in countries across the globe, notably in Turkey, the (less than a year old) line-up is in the spotlight for their amazing musical ideas and heavenly voice achieved by only the greatest singers. Once again, if you haven't heard their EP, click there.
http://harfangmusic.bandcamp.com/

And last but not least;

Inimai
A young group that has brought a new take on authentic sounds. Having played a ton of shows in the last few months, they took a break to write new material and get closer to their true selves. Also busy recording their first EP, Inimai haven't played in a while, and have built up a HUGE chunk of energy for this night.
http://inimai.bandcamp.com/

It promises to be an exciting night- the descriptions are nothing as alluring as the bands themselves, so come down and enjoy blasting your face off with cheap booze and fabulous music!

Contact any members of the bands to get tickets, which are at an amazing low of 5$, and that you can trade in for a free shot! This deal is not available at the door, so pick up that phone and give someone a call! 

See you there!

p.s. also zach will be wasted, expect swearing and asian none-sense.
667750363286004.name: INIMAI W/HARFANG & JONATHAN BECKER @ LE PETIT CHICAGO FEAT ZACH'S BIRTHDAY

30 August 2014
9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Millet Hall
Wright State University
3640 Colonel Glenn Hwy
Dayton, OH 45435

There is a $20 admission fee PER APPLICANT that the Philippine-American Society of Greater Dayton will collect at the event to defray the costs of hosting the Consular Outreach.

ALL APPLICANTS MUST SUBMIT THEIR APPLICATIONS AND REQUIRED DOCUMENTS IN ADVANCE TO THE PHILIPPINE CONSULATE GENERAL VIA MAIL FOR PRE-PROCESSING TO SECURE THEIR APPLICATIONS AND FOR SCHEDULE PURPOSES TO AVOID LONGER WAITING HOURS. APPLICANTS WILL BE NOTIFIED OF CONFIRMATION AND THEIR CORRESPONDING SCHEDULE VIA EMAIL OR PHONE CALL UPON RECEIPT OF COMPLETE APPLICATIONS.

THE FOLLOWING CONSULAR SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED:

1. ePassport Services – New/ Renewal applications
2. Visa Services
3. Notarials (Acknowledgments/Authentication)
4. Civil Registry (Reports of Birth/ Marriage)
5. Dual Citizenship

Requirements For ePassport Applicants (see complete list of requirements at http://www.chicagopcg.com/forms/epptreq.pdf):

1. Duly accomplished passport application form (http://www.chicagopcg.com/forms/epassport.pdf) and requirements;
2. Corresponding fees (money order or cashier’s check made payable to the Philippine Consulate General); and
3. Self-Address stamped envelope (Certified Priority Mail, Express Mail/FEDEX/UPS/DHL).

Requirements For Dual Citizenship Applicants:

1. Duly accomplished Petition for Dual Citizenship application form (http://www.philippineembassy-usa.org/uploads/pdfs/Dual%20Citizenship.pdf) and requirements;
2. Corresponding fees (money order or cashier’s check made payable to the Philippine Consulate General); and
3. Self-Address stamped envelope (Certified Priority Mail, Express Mail/FEDEX/UPS/DHL).

The application and requirements must be mailed to:

Philippine Consulate General
122 S. Michigan Avenue, Suite 1600
Chicago, IL 60603
Attention: Consular Outreach Services – Ohio

Applications for epassports and dual citizenship together with the completed requirements MUST BE RECEIVED by the Chicago Philippine Consulate on or before 23 August 2014. For application forms and complete list of requirements, please visit the Chicago Philippine Consulate ’s website at http://www.chicagopcg.com/forms.html.

Personal Appearance Required:

All applicants are required to personally appear at the Consular Outreach venue (Millet Hall, Wright State University) and to bring the original documents (e.g. passports/alien registration card/identification card/marriage certificate/birth certificate/etc.) for personal identification, photo capture, and biometrics in order to complete the application process.

For more information, please contact:

Mr. Silverio R. Manguerra
Administrative Officer
Philippine Consulate General
Tel. No. (312) 583-0621 extension 19
email: chicagopcg@att.net

or

Mr. Armin M. Sayson
2014 Chairman of the Board of Advisors
Philippine-American Society of Greater Dayton
Tel. No. (937) 361-1058
email: advisors-chair2014@phil-am-dayton.org
672162092840580.name: Consular Outreach (Chicago Philippine Consulate General)

684663411579307.description:
SAVE THE DATE!

CAMP Chicago Quarterly Dinner - Building the Leaders of Tomorrow

Assalaamualaikum,

Are you looking to take the next step in your career? Join CAMP Chicago for an interactive evening of leadership development, professional networking, and great company!

Keynote Speaker:
Munzoor Shaikh 
Senior Manager Healthcare Transaction Services
West Monroe Partners

Munzoor Shaikh is a senior manager in the firm’s Healthcare practice, with a primary focus on Managed Care, Health Insurance, Population Health and Wellness. Munzoor has more than 15 years of experience in management and technology consulting and is responsible for driving business transformation for West Monroe's healthcare clients.

Munzoor is a business transformation agent in healthcare, having successfully executed several large scale initiatives such as claims platform consolidation and migration, care management programs and initiatives, strategic product roadmaps, back-end health IT integration solutions and centralization of core healthcare IT services. Specifically, he focuses on helping health plans, integrated health networks, accountable care organizations and third party administrators tailor their operational and population health processes to decrease cost and increase quality of outcomes.

Munzoor is also an active community leader, contributing in various leadership oriented capacities. He is the founder of Bangladesh6G, a non-profit organization focusing on long terms solutions for Bangladesh that will span 6 generations. He has also served as an instructor for a transformational leadership program with the Wright Graduate University. Additionally, Munzoor served as the Steering Committee Leader for the Transformational Symposium honoring Dr. Mohammed Yunus in 2012 as the Transformational Leader of the year. Finally, he's had over 5 years of experience as a life coach practitioner focusing on goals in areas such as career, family life, and faith based leadership. 


EVENT DETAILS:

Date: Saturday, May 17, 2014
Time: 6:30pm - 10:30pm
Location: Caravan Restaurant
4810 N Broadway St, 
Chicago, IL 60640

Cost:
$30 Early Bird until May 4
$35 General Admission - May 5 - May 14
$40 Door Rate (if available)

Please register & purchase your tickets here: https://campdinner.wufoo.com/forms/camp-chicago-quarterly-dinner/

Suggested Attire: Semi-Formal, Professional, or Business Casual 

Refund Policy: no refunds available

Don’t forget to bring your business cards for an evening of networking with Muslim professionals representing a variety of industries. 

Halal cuisine will be served. 

For any questions please email Chicago@camp-online.org

Ladies, for us each day is a race...clean this, manage that, eat this, endure that...but how often do we feel like the winner? That's where Dirty Girl comes in. This women-only 5K isn't about who finishes first. It's about embracing life's messes, celebrating its obstacles and helping our mothers, daughters, sisters and friends do the same. So why get dirty? Because Dirty Girl is more fun than run.

Event Day Details: 
- We recommend arriving 60-90 minutes prior to your wave start time
- Waves start at 8AM and are every 15 minutes
- There is a $10 cash only charge for parking
- Head to the "Gear Check" area to store one bag while you get muddy
- There is a rinse station to spritz up before you party
- Registration includes a DG charm, tee & alcoholic beverage to those 21+
- All ages 14+ and athletic abilities welcome!
- 10-12 obstacles per event
- Make sure to bring a photo ID to check in and receive an adult beverage

>>> For all the dirty details, visit our FAQ page: http://godirtygirl.com/faq

692024820850157.description:
We are happy to have one of Chicago's finest DJs back at The Bower, Diz. Last year he played for the For Those Who Know 12 Year Anniversary party and delivered the dance floor a lengthy set of house education! If you're into house come experience a special night with one Chicago's house aficionados! 

For Those Who Know...
SATURDAY MARCH 29
DIZ (Chicago / Iz and Diz)

with resident
JUNIOR BROWN

$15 COVER
Doors at 8pm
Half price cocktails from 8pm-10pm

DIz (bio)
If life is about "being in the right place at the right time," then Diz's timing could not have been better. Born and raised in Chicago, the original epicenter of the House Music uni-verse, his adolescence coincided with the beginnings of that city's legendary scene. Nowadays, if you mention Diz's name amongst House aficionados, you are almost cer-tain to hear adoration and respect for his insane DJ skills, stage presence, and warm-hearted personality.


Diz's musical influences started at home, where his mother's love for Jazz led him to pursue the saxophone for many years. His DJ beginnings were about whatever he could get his hands on, like Disco and old Breaks records inherited from family members. When he was 14, his older brother took him to The Music Box, where Diz witnessed the true potential of House Music: to affect people's emotions and bring them together on a collective journey. He's been striving to do just that ever since, and in the process, has become a faithful participant in the music, the culture, and the times.


Throughout high school, he frequented parties featuring DJs such as Frankie Knuckles, Ron Hardy, Farley and many other masters, and finally had a chance to break into the scene at age 19 after meeting contemporaries Mark Farina, Derrick Carter and Spencer Kincey (Gemini). His early gigs were at Alcazar with Gemini, and at one-off parties. At his Wicker Park loft, what started as a means of paying the rent developed into a two-year run as a nightclub, featuring Diz, Farina and Mark Grant on the decks. Soon after-wards, he and his friends took over Shelter, one of the city's "most severe night spots." >From roughly 1993-98, Diz was the Friday resident at Shelter, and the Saturday resi-dent at Red Dog alongside Johnny Fiasco, and since then has held many residencies at other legendary Chicago spots.


In 1995, Diz accepted a job working for his brother's friend, Anthony Pearson (Chez Damier), at PRESCRIPTION (the label founded by Chez and Ron Trent). PRESCRIP-TION conducted distribution business with CAJUAL, and that is how Diz met his future producing partner and close friend, Joshua (whose nickname as fate would have it, was "Iz").


In 1995, Iz n Diz produced their first record together, "Ghosts in Detroit," released on PRESCRIPTION's sub-label, BALANCE. A year later, Joshua/Iz moved back to San Francisco, but he and Diz maintained a close friendship over the years and continue to produce together for labels like CLASSIC, AESOTERIC, GUIDANCE, TWEEKIN', SIL-VER NETWORK, and PANHANDLE.
692024820850157.name: Diz (Chicago) @The Bower Saturday March 29th

698536810209241.description:
GIRL GROUP CHICAGO >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
Lights are low and ghostly piano keys ring out into the crowd; in the dark, a spotlight falls on an ensemble of twenty women. Girl Group Chicago magically recreates the aesthetic of the 1960's with their charming harmonies and custom-made, A-lined, mod-cloth dresses.

From riot grrrl lovers to girl group record collectors, to members of a punk rock marching band, to a doom metal bassist, these talented ladies have come together from an array of musical backgrounds to form the first all-female orchestra of their magnitude. Winners of the 2013 Chicago Music Awards for "Best New Entertainer" and "Pop Entertainer of the Year." 

www.girlgroupchicago.com
www.facebook.com/girlgroupchicago

THE CONGREGATION >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
Classic soul meets rock and roll in this dynamic eight-piece collective from Chicago. The Congregation features Gina Bloom, a singer whose raw and powerful vocals are underscored by Charlie Wayne’s dynamic guitar riffs, the band’s rock and soul rhythms (Dan Wendt on drums, Chuck Sansone on keys and Steve Schuster on bass) and the lively call and response of a three-piece horn section (Justin Amolsch on trumpet, Erik Eiseman on sax and Nick Nottoli on trombone). When it comes to the songwriting, you won’t find any sugarcoated love songs here–you’ll get a little bit of longing and a whole lot of wronging.

www.thecongregationband.com
https://www.facebook.com/thecongregation
698536810209241.name: Girl Group Chicago @ Double Door w/ The Congregation!

699339313449541.description:
Hating Mondays Is Like Hating 1/7 Of Your Life.

.....but, YOU CAN CHANGE THAT by joining us on Saturday, June 7th, 2014, as we kickoff SummertimeCHI in fashion.  By purchasing a ticket to the event, you will be able to take advantage of a premium open bar, Harry Caray's catered appetizer/dinner buffet, and a 3-hour boat cruise along the beautiful Chicago River and Lake Michigan with fireworks shooting off above.  More importantly, by purchasing a ticket, you will be supporting The Monday Life and assisting the process of aiding hospitalized children.  

We are beyond excited to be hosting the First Annual "The Monday Life Presents:  Chicago's 1/7" - a formal gala to help hospitalized children heal.  Treat yourself to an awesome evening and support this awesome cause! 

*****TO PURCHASE YOUR TICKET, PLEASE VISIT: 
www.themondaylife.eventbrite.com

**A portion of your ticket cost is tax deductible.  We can provide a tax form to prove your donation amount upon request.

http://www.themondaylife.org/


INFORMATION ABOUT THE MONDAY LIFE AND THE PROJECT THAT THE MONEY RAISED FROM THIS EVENT WILL FUND:

The Monday Life is a non-profit organization that helps hospitalized children feel better and heal faster. The Monday Life does this by drastically improving patient environments in hospitals.

The idea started off small and simple- Get people to donate $1 every single Monday. These funds added up, and the success of the organization followed. The Monday Life now works with numerous children’s across the US.  By donating $1 every Monday, people could STOP HATING MONDAYS since they know they are doing good and supporting a great cause.  The funds raised by The Monday Life have gone toward projects that have resulted in enhanced health for patients (scientifically proven--see The Monday Life website) such as:  Art therapy projects, Music therapy projects, Massage therapy project, Pet therapy projects, and Enhanced technology projects.

Our goal is to host a succesful charity event that raises funds to support The Monday Life projects.   Specifically, our event will fund a project involving the renovation of a rundown basketball court / playground at Duke Children's Hospital. Take a minute out of your day and watch the video below for more information on the project: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_6_tBYL7I-s


WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING YOU SATURDAY, JUNE 7TH AT 7:30PM.
699339313449541.name: The Monday Life Presents:  Chicago's 1/7

De formule is simpel, internationale artiesten gecombineerd met lokale toppers. Speciaal voor deze editie komt de Duitse Sven Weisemann zijn warme housesound door de Soos blazen. 711712112206796.description:
Emerging Women is hosting another fabulous Power Party, on April 10th, this time in Chicago at TechNexus. 

Can't make it to Chicago? Sign up for the FREE LIVESTREAM here: http://www.emergingwomen.com/2014/02/power-party-chicago-april-10-2014/

The line up for Power Party Chicago will rock the city for sure – featuring Sonia Choquette, Christine Arylo, Sara Connell, Betsy Sobiech, Julie Murphy Casserly, and Dawn Bless, all successful visionary leaders, entrepreneurs, and creatives who are trailblazing a new way of influencing positive change in the world. Expect authentic sharing of what makes these women tick and how they were able to achieve uncompromising success by living the truth of who they are.

Find out more about Power Party Chicago here:
http://www.emergingwomen.com/2014/02/power-party-chicago-april-10-2014/

Speakers: 

>> Sonia Choquette
Sonia Choquette is a globally celebrated and dynamic spiritual teacher, six-sensory consultant, enchanting storyteller, and transformational visionary guide, known for her delightful humor and skill in quickly shifting people out of difficulty and into flow.

>> Christine Arylo
Christine Arylo is a transformational teacher, internationally recognized speaker and best-selling author of the official self-love guidebook, Madly in Love with ME, the Daring Adventure to Becoming Your Own Best Friend.  

>> Sara Connell
Sara Connell is an author, speaker and life coach with a private practice specializing in Women’s health & empowerment in Chicago. Her first book Bringing In Finn was nominated for ELLE magazine 2012 Book of the Year and is in bookstores now.

>> Betsy Sobiech
Betsy Sobiech is part of the global team that launched Tiara International LLC, a company that is redefining women’s leadership to include all women. As the Chief Operating Officer, her mission is to make the power and peace of true leadership accessible to everyone. 

>> Julie Murphy Casserly
Julie Murphy Casserly is a 17-year veteran of the financial services industry and has often been referred to as a financial healer and visionary. She is turning the personal finance industry upside down by de-bunking standard financial planning processes and educating people about a new way of finding financial success…and it all starts from within.

>> Dawn Bless
While singing and visual arts were her earliest blooming talents, Dawn Bless has continued to develop into an experienced Spoken Word Artist, Actress, and Playwright. She is currently writing a stageplay about the gospel group The Clark Sisters, as well as currently songwriting for a project with Grammy nominated singer Vashawn Mitchell.

*Power Party Chicago is an event in support of Emerging Women Live, October 9-12, 2014, a national event in New York City which will feature the following speakers: Arianna Huffington, Kris Carr, Tara Sophia Mohr, Sera Beak, Danielle LaPorte, Dominique Christina, Gabrielle Bernstein and many more!
Find out more about our main event Emerging Women Live here: http://www.emergingwomen.com/the-event/
711712112206796.name: Emerging Women POWER PARTY Chicago

715128991873103.description:
The team that brought you last year’s scintillating spectacle, Cabaret, is back -  this time with a little more jazz, a little more sass, and a few more murders. Black Productions is proud to present the Tony award-winning musical, Chicago, running June 12th-15th, 2014, at 8pm and June 14th-15th at 2pm, at the Capitol Theatre in Nelson.
Set against the backdrop of prohibition-era Chicago and featuring some of the best music Broadway has to offer, Chicago is a story of ambition, celebrity, and the seductive power of the spotlight. This tale of two rival vaudevillian murderesses and their slick-talking media savvy lawyer will be directed by Lisel Forst (Into the Woods, You’re a Good Man Charlie Brown), with musical direction by Allison Girvan (Corazon, Les Miserables) and choreography by Mackenzie Hope (Cabaret, Jesus Christ Superstar).
Tickets for Chicago are on sale now, $20 for students and $25 for adults and are available at the Capitol Theatre box office, by calling 250-352-6363, or by visiting www.capitoltheatre.bc.ca.
715128991873103.name: CHICAGO the Musical

728045853913054.description:
Uno dei grandi eventi della Birroteca Doppio Malto è il graditissimo ritorno in Italia del leggendario cantautore di Chicago Michael McDermott, accompagnato in acustico dalla moglie Heather Horton al violino e ai cori. 
Ormai da oltre 20 anni nel business della musica, McDermott ha esordito con una vera e propria pietra miliare del rock, quel "620 W. Surf" che gli dette la fama nel 1991, e in cui molti lo definirono un degno erede di fuoriclasse con Dylan e Springsteen. Ha diviso il palco con gente come Van Morrison, Cowboy Junkies, Natalie Merchant e Wallflowers, e lo scrittore Stephen King lo annovera tra i suoi cantautori preferiti, citandolo in più di un romanzo. Il film "Rounders - Il Giocatore", con Matt Damon e Edward Norton e scritto dal suo amico/produttore Brian Koppelman (autore anche della serie degli "Ocean's" con George Clooney), è in parte ispirato alla sua vita. Particolare è il suo feeling con l'Italia, dove s'è sposato proprio 5 anni fa, nel maggio 2009.

Un appuntamento imperdibile con un cantautore dalla personalità e dal magnetismo ineguagliabili, che passa da emozionanti ballate a decise sferzate folk-rock.

www.michael-mcdermott.com

Non mancate!!!
728045853913054.name: MICHAEL McDERMOTT feat. Heather Horton (Chicago, USA) @ Doppio Malto - 07.05.2014

732438540113522.description:
Spencer Vs Chadwick C Plays vs Spencer Hutchinson

Rescue or Destroy Round 6 between Spencer Hutchinson and Chadwick is a multi-sensory experience. Are they artists who play music or musicians who paint. Performers or painters? Yes, they are. Come to Gallery Bar Thursday, May 1st to see the battle of the Renaissance men. 

Spencer Hutchinson is a visual artist who discovered electronic music in 2007 and began the Ersatz Modem Project. His goal: apply to electronic music production the same attitude that Modern artists would apply to Abstract painting. 

Chadwick is a musician, an actor, an emcee and, quite literally, a performance artist - as he prefers to paint in public, on stage. “There’s just something about the audience being right there.”

So come on down, save some art and meet our soul-stirring duo and all of the other artists who are brave enough to face the ax man. 

ABOUT Rescue-or-Destroy : 

The next “Rescue-or-Destroy Art Tournament” will be May 1st at Gallery Bar in Chicago. Experience it! There's nail biting suspense, action-packed drama, tears and jeers and a big bald man with an ax. 

Rescue-or-Destroy is like a sports tournament for art - an “Art Tourney.” Eight pairs of artists compete, tournament style, in a bi-weekly event at Gallery Bar in River North. 

It works like this…

Sixteen artists are selected to participate and are paired up to create eight initial duos. Each artist brings a piece of art (their choice) for the event and the audience is called on to “rescue,” or “destroy” (hack up into a million pieces) one of the two pieces presented on stage. 

If you are an artist and want to participate. Contact Allen Vandever to find out how to be a guest artist.
 
Scedule: 

Bout 6 May 1st
Bout 7 May 17th
Bout 8 june 5th

Playoffs begin in July...stay turned!!

Rescue or Destroy kicks off at 8pm on Saturday February 22nd at Gallery Bar – 738 N. Clark St., Chic
732438540113522.name: RESCUE OR DESTROY ART TOURNAMENT Bout 6

744480865584466.description:
Chicago Farmer returns to Bradley, IL! This time with Local Heros Matt and Jake!

Friday April 18th

10:00 pm

21+ 

FREE SHOW!


Chicago Farmer sings on the title track of Backenforth, IL, out January 22, 2013. It’s the centerpiece of his sixth collection of Guthrie-inspired populist songs, as well as autobiographical. The son of a small town farming community, Cody Diekhoff logged plenty of highway and stage time under the name Chicago Farmer before settling in the city in 2003. Profoundly inspired by fellow mid-westerner John Prine, he’s a working-class folk musician to his core. His small town roots, tilled with city streets mentality, are turning heads North and South of I-80.

Backenforth, IL is also about finding your place in life – that sweet spot where we all belong. “I love the energy, music, and creativity of Chicago, but at the same time, the roots and hard work of my small town,” he shares. Growing up in Delavan, IL with a population less than 2,000, Diekhoff’s grandparents were farmers, and their values have always provided the baseline of his songs.

He writes music for the “kind of people that come to my shows. Whether in Chicago or Delavan, everyone has a story, and everyone puts in a long day and works hard the same way,” he says. “My generation may have been labeled as slackers, but I don’t know anyone who doesn’t work hard – many people I know put in 50-60 hours a week and 12 hour days. That’s what keeps me playing. I don’t like anyone to be left out; my music is for everyone in big and very small towns.”

He listened to punk rock and grunge as a kid before discovering a friend’s dad playing Hank Williams, and it was a revelation. Prine and Guthrie quickly followed. The name Chicago Farmer was originally for a band, but the utilitarian life of driving alone from bar to bar, city to city – to make a direct connection to his audience and listener, took a deeper hold.

Songs like “Workin’ On It,” are the kind of sing-a-longs he’s known for; it’s become common to see whole rooms full of strangers erupt and sing to the choruses of his songs on first listen. While “The Twenty Dollar Bill” is more sentimental, reminding everyone of that time their own Grandma surreptitiously passed along a little cash to hang onto.

Cody co-produced the album with Chris Harden in Chicago at the I.V. Labs Studios. While the inspiration has never changed, previous albums have been with Nashville session players – or just himself with guitar and harmonica.

For Backenforth, IL, he brought in friends for a loose and live vibe, accompanied by “The Hired Hands,” Darren Garvey on percussion and Mike Davidov on bass. Cody and The Hired Hands were recorded live and on analog tape to capture the feel and authenticity of each performance. Later, some of Chicago’s finest musicians chimed in on pedal steel, resonator, electric and acoustic guitar, organ, dobro, and vocals.

Chicago Farmer plans to continue touring relentlessly to support the new album.

With Backenforth IL, he solidifies that wherever he is, that’s where he belongs, that’s where the songs will be written and sung, and that’s where the music will be played.
744480865584466.name: Chicago Farmer at the Ale House Pub

758416340844102.description:
Easter Thurs w/  Chicago's finest disco don Rahaan Rah and the Bozak   ltd £3 tickets here http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?575336

Line up: downstairs Disco and house both new and old with very special guest Rahaan (Chicago), Dj Alex (Voices Agency), Neil Thornton & Jac the Disco  (Discovery)  plus upstairs hosted by Untitled w/ special guest Stephane Ghenacia (Colors Lnd), Ewan Smith & Chris Graham & Aky playing House and Techno

The Horse and Groom (the original disco pub) is renowned for throwing fun fueled Easter bank holiday parties with previous guest including Tornado Wallace, Chateau Flight, Eric  Duncan, Chateau Flight, Mark E, Greg Wilson to name a few of the great guest who have played over the last few years. This year we are super hyped to welcome back  Chicago’s finest Disco don Rahaan headlining the bash with fantastic support over both floors. Advance tickets are on sale for a super bargain £4 get them while you can folks we expect a sellout. Rahaan played a few years back at the Spacemachine launch and killed it so we are looking forward to hearing him do the disco again especially on the Bozak mixer.

Rahaan is without doubt one of the most traveled and in demand disco disc jockeys on the circuit, and according to the Redbull Academy 'he's not only a Dj, but a Dj's Dj.'Rahaan's been spinning music since the 80s, he got his schooling in disco music when he heard Ron Hardy play at the Music Box in his native Chicago. At the time other Djs like Pierre or Frankie Knuckles were throwing parties too, but it was the unique fashion Ron Hardy served up his disco and house - raw and real - that had left a long lasting impression on Rahaan. Since then, the brother from the Windy city has amassed a more than respectable record collection, mixing up the rare disco and classic always keeping his choice dance floor friendly. Over the years Rahaan has personalised plenty of classic tracks by transforming them into his trademark edits in a similar way Ron Hardy and Theo Parrish have done, with the only exception that he keeps close to the disco sound in his output, occasionally dipping into soul, boogie, jazz funk and funk territory. But above all, the essence of Rahaan's trademark sound is still undeniably 'Chicago' in its energy. There are plenty of soulful and uplifting, but never cheesy vocals. There is consistent groove in his boogie along type sets - all the way to his more bouncing and jackin' basement party style sets, in which you can literally feel the music, sweat and funk in the air. Over the years, plenty of Rahaan mixes that have appeared on sites like Bring The Heat, Deep House Page and the Chuck Brothers, and many fans have been wondering about those special extended and re-arranged and hard to find tracks. 

Upstairs hosted by Untitled. After a short break Untitled is back and we'll be helping you to kick start the bank holiday weekend with a very special party. For this event we've teamed up with the good people of the Horse and Groom and will be taking over the top floor of the infamous party pub. After throwing a string of successful parties in 2013 with guests including the likes of Nikos (Krush), Wesley Razzy (Rhythmatic), Bookless & Richard Rowell (Jaunt) we will be sticking to our policy of throwing exciting and intimate parties and have enlisted Stephane Ghenacia (Colors Lnd) to come along and make sure your bank holiday weekend starts off with a bang. Stephane is a new face in the scene who’s hungry to emulate the success of the names he shares the DJ booth with. He's already gaining quite a reputation in the underground with appearances at Fabric's room one alongside Apollonia (Dan Ghenacia, Dyed Soundorom & Shonky). It's clear this guy has an ear for good music
758416340844102.name: The H&G  Easter Disco tonight  w/ Rahaan (Chicago), Dj Alex (Voices), Discovery ++

WHAT

• A city-wide scavenger hunt hosted by the Children's Heart Foundation.
• Teams of 2-4 people will be given a list of 10 challenges; the first three teams to complete 9 of the 10 challenges win. 
• Challenges may include puzzles, games, or physical tasks.
• Race must be completed on foot or via public transit.
• For sample challenges, visit: http://www.citysolveurbanrace.com/clues).


WHERE

•The boundaries of the race area include (roughly): 
- Lakeview to the North, 
- Racine the West,
- Streeterville to the South, and 
- the lake to the East. 


WHEN

• April 26th, 2014.


WHY

• 40,000 babies are born each year with a CHD.
• 22,000 will require at least 1 invasive surgery in their lifetime.
• 8,000 will die before their first birthday.

Help us come closer to understanding what causes CHDs, how to  prevent them, and how to detect and diagnose them as early as possible. For more information, please visit:

http://www.childrensheartfoundation.org/
https://www.facebook.com/TheCHF


TICKETS

• To buy tickets visit: www.chicagourbanrace.com/register

767016116643186.description:
A Muslim woman defies the Nazis in World War II Paris. A true story. 

Chicago Premiere 1 @ 3:25pm
Purchase tickets here - http://eorchicago1.eventbrite.com/
Chicago Premiere 2 @ 5:10pm
Purchase tickets here - http://eorchicago2.eventbrite.com/

Enemy of the Reich is a new docudrama film from Unity Productions Foundation that depicts the inspiring, true story of a Muslim woman who opposed Hitler, risked her life, and helped launch the French Resistance. Her name was Noor Inayat Khan.

Opening remarks by Executive Producer Alex Kronemer

"Americans of different faiths need to know and appreciate Noor's heroism. It can bring us together."
-Imam Mohamed Hag Magid

"Enemy of the Reich: The Noor Inayat Khan Story is a moving account of a young Muslim woman who sacrificed her life to combat the brutal domination of Nazi Germany. As a leader in the international movement to reconcile Jews and Muslims, this compelling film is a source of inspiration to me."
-Rabbi Marc Schneier

www.EnemyoftheReich.com

Presented by Unity Productions Foundation 
Sponsored by CIOGC & CAIR

For more information, contact:
Reema Kamran - 630-640-9422 - reema@rreventmanagement.com
Roohi Younus - 815-370-6106 - roohi@rreventmanagement.com
Zacharea Katerji - 630-670-5215 - zach@rreventmanagement.com

Executive producers: Alexander Kronemer and Michael Wolfe. Directed by Rob Gardner
