Lit'l CHICAGO has been referred to as one of the best unknown blues bands in Canada. Once word filtered out about this hard working band from Sarnia Ontario, Lit'l CHICAGO club dates became packed house events with audiences feeling like they had just walked into a Beale Street blues club. 

The trademark Lit'l Chicago sound is delivered by Robb Sharp on guitar and vocals. Jerome Reeves plays bass guitar, Wulf von Waldow plays saxophone, Dave Grennan plays keyboards and the tall man in the back holding things together is drummer Brian McLellan.

Twice a year, the B.U.R.N. Board of Operations (aka BurnOps or the committee formerly known as the Steering Committee) hosts an all-tribes meeting. Our spring version is called Town Hall, and it's designed to help interested parties keep abreast of the plethora of new developments and new ways to participate in the Chicago Burning Man community. 

BURNOps books the space, but Town Hall is really for you. Contact ScottFree at scottarc@gmail.com to book your presentation.

1375 W Lake St
Chicago, IL 60607

We are having another zombie march in June.
The rules are very simple: dress and be made up as a zombie and just shamble and act like one.

We will all meet at Millennium Park and take it from there.
The last few years we have walked to the museum campus, walked to Daley Plaza, back to Millennium Park, to Buckingham Fountain and if we still have able body zombies left, we will head over to abc7 news station for the 5pm show.

804989839518068.description:
It is no longer sufficient to examine emerging market trends within a single geography. To gain true insights, emerging market businesses need to be analyzed pan-regionally. Chicago Booth is the first business school to rise to this challenge.
 
With over 450 speakers, students, and professionals from around the world featuring 30 panels across 5 geographic and thematic tracks, we launched the inaugural Chicago Booth Emerging Markets Summit in 2013 by bringing four regionally focused conferences and one pan-regional conference under one roof. Working professionals from around the world came together and explored emerging market trends, opportunities, and challenges from both a regional and pan-regional perspective.
 
EMS 2014 will be held at the J.W. Marriot on Saturday, April 12 and feature topics on:
·         Investing, PE and VC
·         Selling to the emerging markets consumer
·         Entrepreneurship
·         Government-Business Relations
·         Special topics
 
Don’t miss out on the best Emerging Markets Conference of the year!
 
For more information, visit our website http://www.chicagobooth.edu/emerging-markets-summit/ or contact us EmergingMarketsSummit@lists.chicagobooth.edu

821428847871564.description:
MEDLIFE at Uchicago would like to invite you to....
Dance for LIFE Zumbathon 2014!

*Individual Registration Open!*

Advance tickets: $7/ At the door: $10
No commitment- no fundraising. Just zumba for as long or as little as you like for a great cause!

Purchase individual tickets: www.strikingly.com/medlifezumbathon

---------------------------------------------------------------
Have you ever wanted to compete your friends in a booty-licious Latin inspired, calorie-burning Zumbathon and win an $800 VALUE DELUXE GIFT PACKAGE! Well now is your chance to shine. 

Teams of 4 will compete for 3 hours to be named the Dance for LIFE Zumbathon 2014 Champions. 

The $800 value GRAND PRIZE PACKAGE includes:
•8 All You Can Eat Passes to Shinju Sushi ($200 value)
•$50 Gift Certificate & After-hour party for 10 people with a personal stylist at Comfort Me Boutique
•$50 Gift Certificate to Rajun Cajun
•$25 Gift Certificate to Cedar's
•$50 Gift Certificate to The Sit Down Cafe & Sushi Bar
•$50 Gift Card to Bonne Sante Health Foods
•$100 Zipcar Gift Certificate
•$100 Kaplan Gift Certificate
•One month of Unlimited Yoga classes at CorePower Yoga ($185 value)

***********************************************

The Dance for Low Income Families Everywhere (Dance for LIFE) Zumbathon is a large-scale event that will bring together the University of Chicago and Hyde Park community to help improve global health care in a fun, fitness-friendly way. This 3.5 hour event will consist of 3 hours of Zumba with certified Zumba instructors.

Basic Rules for Teams
----------------------------
1) $25 for Teams of 4
    (that's only $6.25 per person and $2.12 per hour!)
2) Each team must raise at least $25
3) Each team must zumba for 3 hours and hold an On-site Fundraiser

Best House Competition
----------------------------------
Same rules as above except:
1) Many teams can sign up from each Residential House. and their points will be pooled together. 
2) House with largest combined score will receive Ultimate Uber Package- perfect for House bonding trips. 
3) Each member of winning House will receive $25 off first ride and the 2 RH's will receive a $300 value Uber discount.

100% money raised goes to the MEDLIFE fund to help improve health care and fight poverty in Tanzania!

How to WIN
-----------------
Teams will be graded on a point system in three categories:

 1) FUNDRAISING $1 = 1 Point 
 *$300 Milestone = 300 Bonus Points
 *$500 Milestone = 500 Bonus Points
 *$1,000 Milestone = JACKPOT 1,000 Bonus Points

 2) SUPPORTERS 1 Supporter = 1 Point 
 *Through Team Fundly page & have friends stop by and sign in at your on- site fundraiser

 3) SPIRIT (Optional- additional points!) 
 Team Costume: 20 points 
 Team banner at the event: 20 points 
 Team Promotional video: 50 points 
 Team Photo: 30 points 
 Change FB pro pic to team photo: 10 pts/team member (Max 40 pts)
 Change FB cover photo to Dance for Life poster: 10 pts/team member (Max 40 pts)
 Overall energy at the event: Max 60 points
Refer people to participate (Individual Ticket): 30 points/person

The team that has the most overall points by the end of the event will be named the winner!!

Interested? More information?
-----------------------------------------
If you have any questions please email us at 
Uchicagomedlifefundraising@gmail.com.

Support your favorite Team!
-------------------------------------
>MEME GIRLS: Senxi Du, Melanie Snider, Jacky Wang, Kristine Don (On site fundraiser - Cray Caricatures)
www.fundly.com/winners-in-paris

>FIASCO FUEGO: Andrew Mao, Elizabeth Huh, Shelly Thai, Emily Espinel (On site Fundraiser - Boba Tea)
https://fundly.com/fiasco-fuego

>ZZZ (ZEAL, ZEST, & ZUMBA):Vaidehee Thatte, Nora Vivanco Gonzalez, Kritika Dusad, Aradhita Majumdar (On-Site Fundraiser- Henna Designs) 
https://fundly.com/zzz-zeal-zest-and-zumba

>All the SIngle Ladies: Erin Dominici, Christina Xiao, Victoria Mooers, Paola Cardona
(On-Site Fundraiser-Scones)
https://fundly.com/all-the-single-ladies/

Thanks to our sponsors!
-------------------------------
Shinju Sushi, Comfort Me Boutique, The Sit Down Café & Sushi Bar, Bonne Sante Health Foods, Cedar's, Rajun Cajun, CorePower Yoga, Zipcar, Kaplan, Uber, and Chipotle!

823546174329312.description:
GRZEGORZ TURNAU - polski pianista, kompozytor, aranżer, wokalista i poeta, wystąpi w dniu 5 kwietnia, 2014 r., o godz. 19-tej, na jednym, długo wyczekiwanym koncercie w Copernicus Center, przy 5216 W. Lawrence Avenue, Chicago. 

Wszechstronny artysta, który stworzył swój własny, łatwo rozpoznawalny, pełen czaru i elegancji styl muzyczny i kompozycyjny, czasami nawiązujący do muzyki jazzowej, smooth-jazzowej, a także do dokonań Marka Grechuty i Jana Kantego Pawluśkiewicza, zaprezentuje kompozycje, które cieszyły słuchaczy na przestrzeni niemal 20 lat jego kariery. Laureat wielu nagród, m.in. Mateusza (Nagrody Muzycznej Programu Trzeciego), Wiktora (Nagrody Akademii Telewizyjnej), dwóch Superjedynek (plebiscytu w Opolu) oraz dziesięciu Fryderyków, do których nominowany był aż 24 razy, cieszy się niesłabnącym uznaniem. Popularność Turnaua to swoisty fenomen, który nie przestaje zadziwiać. Uprawia on bowiem trudny gatunek piosenki z tekstem, czy piosenki poetyckiej spod znaku “krainy łagodności”. Jego utwory to refleksyjne perełki, w których na happy end raczej nie ma miejsca.  A jednak od wielu lat przyciąga słuchaczy, którym nieobce są inne rodzaje muzyki.  Niezwykłe poczucie humoru artysty, błyskotliwość i jego dystans do samego siebie, jak i niemal sztubacka figlarność, spontaniczne żarty i swoiste flirty z publicznością, budują niepowtarzalny nastrój występów. Dzięki temu recitale Turnaua zawsze pozostawiają publiczność w zadumie, ale i dobrym humorze. Grzegorz Turnau prowadzi z nią dialog, spełniając jej oczekiwania dotyczące repertuaru. W zależności od emocji, które towarzyszą koncertom, zmienia się lista wykorzystywanych utworów. Dlatego każde spotkanie z widzami jest inne i niepowtarzalne, a  każdy spektakl unikatowy.

Koncert będzie wielką gratką dla fanów Grzegorza Turnaua także w warstwie instrumentalnej. Towarzyszący wokaliście Jacek Królik (gitara), Robert Kubiszyn (gitara basowa, kontrabas), Leszek Szczerba (saksofon, klarnet) i Cezary Konrad (perkusja), to znani i cenieni muzycy jazzowi, świetni instrumentaliści i autorzy wielu własnych przedsięwzięć artystycznych. W kwintecie, prowadzą z wokalem i fortepianem lidera pełnoprawny dźwiękowy dialog, uwidaczniający ich własne muzyczne osobowości.

Elitarny Grzegorz Turnau, w doborowym towarzystwie swojego zespolu, a wraz z nimi “Wszystko, co piekne...” już 5 kwietnia!

BILETY:

773-415-4910, POLAMER, KSIEGARNIE: D&Z, WRONA

www.bilety.com, www.kulturka.us, www.uptosound.com, www.copernicuscenter.org

831315796885900.description:
Dear Friends,

Please join us for a fundraising event for Chokwe Antar Lumumba.  Chokwe A. Lumumba is the son of our beloved brother and comrade Chokwe Lumumba, the late Mayor of Jackson, Mississippi, who passed away February 25, 2014.

Chokwe Antar Lumumba is a graduate of Tuskegee University in Alabama and Thurgood Marshall School of Law in Houston, Texas.  On Tuesday, March 11, 2014, Attorney and Managing Partner for Lumumba, Freelon & Associates, Chokwe Antar announced his intent to seek the mayor's office for the city of Jackson, Mississippi.  Attorney Lumumba, a gifted Human Rights and Criminal Defense Attorney, will seek to carry on the vision of The People's Platform that he and his father developed together as he served as campaign co-chair for his father's mayoral bid just one year ago.

In a recent Final Call interview, Chokwe Antar stated the following: "I think now it's necessary that we continue the vision and the work of the people.  It's too critical. We cannot leave that in idle hands or with people who do not understand the principles which must guide our leadership and guide our people."  This is why Stan, Conrad and I support Chokwe Antar Lumumba and his campaign to fill this vital office.

Please join us on April 4, 2014 for this momentous event and help us elect Chokwe A. Lumumba as Mayor of the city of Jackson, Mississippi.  We look forward to seeing you on 4/4/14 at Carruthers Center for Inner City Studies, 700 E. Oakwood Blvd., Chicago, Illinois, in the Don Bailey Legacy Room at 6 pm.

Sponsors:
Doris Lewis, community activist
Attorney Stan Willis
Dr. Conrad Worrill

Suggested donation $100 dollars or more but all amounts will be welcomed.

Contact information: Doris Lewis at 773-624-1828 or lewis_doris@sbcglobal.net

***Refreshments will be served***
831315796885900.location: Carruthers Center for Inner City Studies, Don Bailey Legacy Room
831315796885900.name: Chicago Fundraiser for Chokwe Antar Lumumba

http://www.ticketweb.com/fb/4131944/mp

Price:
$6.00 in advance / $8.00 day of show

Additional Info:
ALL AGES!

THE 92S

"We'll buy a house and fade to bland/ I’ll make the same mistakes as my old man," frontman Dan Durley sings on the opening track of The 92s' debut full-length album, Television Fuzz. What follows is an album as pretty as it is noisy and jarring, displacing the lessons learned during adolescence with instinct and naivety. Television Fuzz studies the existential crises that comes on the onset of every graduation; from high school, from college, from one job to the next, but most importantly, graduating from adolescence to adulthood.

DRAFT WEEK

Chicago is home to some of alternative rock's most acclaimed artists including the Smashing Pumpkins and Wilco. In recent years however, the Second City has given rise to substantially fewer artists. Draft Week is the solution to the city's quandary.

OLD HONEY DRUMS

We play happy music with banjos, ukuleles, and anything else within arm's reach.
831701430179891.name: The 92s (Chicago album release show) / Draft Week / Old Honey Drums

October 14-19, 2014

***TENTATIVE SCHEDULE*** 

Trip Departs Hazard, KY on the 2:00pm on October 14, 2014 en route to Chicago. 

Lodging on October 14 at Hyatt Place - Schaumburg
(Breakfast Buffet Included) 

October 15th - Bus will leave Hyatt Place at 9:00am to drop us off in the city. Bus will then pick us back up at 5:00pm to head to Minneapolis, MN. 

Lodging on October 15 and 16 at Radisson Bloomington at Mall of America. 

October 16th is your day to explore Minneapolis and Mall of America. The hotel offers free shuttles to the Mall (2 blocks) and also has one of the worlds largest water parks directly across the street. 

October 17th you will have to explore Minneapolis and Mall of America before boarding the bus at 5:00pm to head to Chicago. 

Lodging on October 17 at Hyatt Place - Schaumburg
(Breakfast Buffet Included) 

October 18 bus will depart hotel and take us in downtown Chicago for our 2nd day in the city. Bus will pick us back up at 10:00pm and depart for Hazard, KY. 

Overnight drive to Hazard and should arrive back around 9:00am. 

Trip includes 4 nights lodging and transportation 

In total you will have 2 full days in Windy Chicago and 2 full days in Minneapolis to explore the Mall of America.

849575438389735.description:
Order tickets via Eventbrite:
http://davidevesentinichicago.eventbrite.com/?aff=efbevent

A ONCE IN A LIFETIME OPPORTUNITY IS HERE. .Arriving from Italy is one of their most prestigious master photographers Davide DV Vesentini who will be shooting models in a model workshop to build portfolios and extend your name from here to Italy. The Jamaica importer Carmichael Byfield - designer & owner of the luxury fashion brand House of Byfield is also merging M & M Modeling Magazine LLC to secure an unforgettable 'Fashion Model/Glamour Bootcamp/Workshop on April 27th, a Photographer Fashion Workshop on April 28th and a Photographer Glamour Workshop on April 29th in Chicago, Illinois. Clothing is provided and will be styled by the editorial styler David Osatohannwen Okoro coming in from New Amsterdam for this event. This event will be published including work from all models and photographers involved in an upcoming issue of M & M Modeling Magazine in print and digital. Davide Vesentini is also submitting work from models shot by him to various European and Local publications.




Fashion Models taking part in the 27th event will be trained on high fashion poses, working with their environment, styled with hair and makeup and styled by fashion from House of Byfield and have the opportunity of being able to work with international crews and build a portfolio like no other here in America. 




Glamour Models taking part in the 27th event will be trained on glamour poses, working with their environment, facial expressions including hair styled and makeup. Also will have the opportunity of being able to work with international crews and build a portfolio like no other here in America. 




Photographers taking part in the 28th and 29th events will be trained in advanced lessons with the use of natural lighting, how to properly use reflectors, advanced use of flash, proper usage of mixed light (natural and strobe) indoor/outdoor lessons and advanced image editing as well. 

For inquiries contact us at 

mandmmodelingmagazine@gmail.com

www.mandmmodelingmag.com




**DEPOSITS MUST BE MADE TO RESERVED YOUR SPACE IN THIS EVENT**

25% PRICE INCREASE WITHOUT DEPOSIT




Check out more of House of Byfield and Davide Vesentini at www.dvphotographer.com

and  www.houseofbyfield.com

859526624072923.description:
TuSabés (Bad Advice Inc., Chicago)
Aran Daniels & Mike Petrack (TV Lounge)

21 & Up   $5 holla

TuSabés is the latest musical incarnation of someone who is no stranger to the Midwest scene- former Smartbar Music Director Nate Seider, aka Nate Manic.  Over the last 17 years, Nate's presence on the midwest dance scene has been nothing short of ubiquitous, playing hundreds of venues and events of every scale with some of Dance Music's biggest and brightest stars.  Afer he was named Music Director for the legendary Smartbar in October of 2009,  his creative influence was felt far and wide as he brought in some of the world's most influencial electronic musicians, all while maintaining his love and respect for Chicago's roots in Gay culture through nights like Queen! and regular local showcases.  Now Nate focuses on the production and DJing side of things through his latest project, TuSabés.  You can get more information, mixes and original tracks by visiting https://soundcloud.com/tusabesmusic .
859526624072923.name: TV Dinners w/ TuSabés (Chicago)
